title: Surgical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jul 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process were all online. It was quick and easy. After finishing the self paced text interview, i was offered a virtual interview on the same day. Interviewers were kind, authentic and awesome.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the time you had a stressful work. How did you go about it?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds total. First was with Department Manager, then with the team. Both were more about the culture fit more than the technical skills and ability. Very informative and helpful interview. Felt very comfortable
Interview Questions: How do you think your background experience will be leveraged in this new role?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First interview very informal, off the cuff. Very personable interviewers in the department. Very laid back. Worked with my schedule and was able to do virtual interview over teams. not sure what else to say
Interview Questions: Talk about how you support quality initiatives

title: Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was good and interviewed with multiple people. Scheduling for second interview was quick, however, it took a very long time to hear back about final decision. Overall, it went smooth.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with compliance?

title: Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Easy application process. I enjoyed my 30 minute interview and the conversation flowed well. Was informed of the hiring timeline and assured I would be kept apprised of my application status. After a month passed, I had not received a response to my follow up emails with the interviewer or HR. Can we respect applicants enough to not ghost them after an interview?
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: For an entry-level position, mostly answered behavioral questions. Beginning with a video interview that takes around 30-45 minutes. There were 3-4 interviews with various leadership. The interviews were conducted online and around 30 min each.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Providence?

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews. Recruiter said they would be  back to me within a specific time period and never reached back out.  Very disappointed in the process and follow up. It only takes a few minutes to get back with a candidate and let them know the outcome instead of leading them on for over a month. It’s disrespectful and unprofessional to take advantage of someone’s time they’ve put forth in interviewing for the position.
Interview Questions: Job related interview questions and walking them through my experience.

title: Patient Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very straightforward. However, when they offered me the job -the salary offered was extremely low and they didn't open up room for negotiation. When I stated the salary I was looking for (which was within the middle range for what they listed on the job posting) the recruiter basically laughed at me and said that they won't be able to offer that. Why list that salary on the job posting if you can't offer it? It was a huge waste of time for everyone involved. I declined the offer and accepted a job at a different company that could meet my salary range.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral based questions. They want stories.

title: Patient Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview survey was completed and then I got an invitation to do an online interview. Originally I was told I would interview in front of a 3-person panel, although on the day of it ended up only being one person.
Interview Questions: What experience do I have that will qualify me for the role?

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 15 minutes 1:1 Standard questions: tell me about yourself, tell me the time when you had to deal with a difficult employee, how do you understand diversity, an example of how you would include diversity in your care
Interview Questions: Standard questions: tell me about yourself, tell me the time when you had to deal with a difficult employee, how do you understand diversity, an example of how you would include diversity in your care

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Clear communication, always available, very nice people. Very transparent in the process. Interviews were mostly comprised of behavioral and experience questions, and there were 2 rounds, and a writing assignment.
Interview Questions: The questions were about experience, like 'tell me about a time when you resolved conflict'

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was Over Teams. Managers and Directors so nice and down to earth. Very informative, so you knew exactly what you would be doing day to day in your position. Told you approximately how long training would be.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about yourself

title: RN New Grad Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 nurse managers/educators. General interview and pick the top 3 desired units at the end of the interview. Panel stated they will try to match each person with either their first or second choice.
Interview Questions: 1. Why did you want to become a nurse? 2. What does cultural competency mean to you? 3. What would you do if you have a declining patient? 4. How did you manage a situation with a difficult patient? 5. What does teamwork mean to you? 6. Prioritization question--ranking tasks in order of what you would do first. 7. Case Study question (given 6 minutes to read/write down an SBAR) on a scenario (for example, stroke)

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Quick to schedule first interview. Interview was convenient and remote. Staff was friendly and professional. Overall, pleasant experience even though I was not selected for position in the long run.
Interview Questions: Why are you interest in this position?

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Tarzana, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They will send you a self paced questionnaire and then offer you an interview, the interview was pretty average. The nurse manager who interviewed me was very friendly. - need more words for submission -
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy process, and they made you feel comfortable. The questions were direct and straightforward. The job description was also well explained and they explained what was expected of you. It was a comfortable experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strongest qualities

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They asked questions on cultural diversity, care plans, priority, case study etc. Not so friendly or warm as well as not clear on open positions; felt cold, confusing, and rushed.
Interview Questions: time you were culturally competent

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The whole process included two separate video interviews plus text communications on salary expectations and other simple questions. Video interviews were disappointing as most of the interview team was not on camera.
Interview Questions: What interested you in the Providence?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, I received an automatic email almost immediately, and had an interview scheduled within a half hour. The interview took place a couple weeks later. It was a video interview which I did from home. It lasted about 25 minutes and the questions were very basic for an entry level position. I was told I'd hear back with their decision within a week. It's been over a month and I have never heard from them again. I don't care how low level the position is, this isn't acceptable. I have years of past experience as a CNA and was looking to re-enter the field while I work toward becoming an RN. I'm glad Providence showed me how little they respect prospective employees now, so I won't ever apply for a job with them in the future.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict with a co-worker or supervisor? Describe a situation when you've had to work with little or no supervision.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Tarzana, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Online interview very generic questions. The first interview is basically a pre screening to see if you are qualified for the position. Then they will reach back out to you for a second interview if they what to hire you.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize your tasks for the day?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Asked a couple questions and then gave you a prioritization question as well as a case study with follow up questions to that. Overall wasn't bad at all. Took about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for one of your patients.

title: Interventional Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, manager was very nice and friendly and very informative. Very direct questions based on the role and experiences. Very unique approach. Very understanding of past experiences and reasons why I had to leave my previous place of employment. Surprisingly I got a follow up email for a second interview the same day.
Interview Questions: State your experiences with trauma procedures?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted via text to answer preliminary questions, then contacted via email to schedule an online interview. Interviewed with a panel of 2 people for 30minutes and was asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: - Tell me why you are interested in this position. - Tell us about a time where you went above and beyond for a patient. - Tell us what your top 3 strengths are.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was first to get a feel of who you are and what you know about the company. Then in-person interview with a department within providence or float pool manager .
Interview Questions: What is one things about the mission statement that you are agree with?

title: Medical Social Worker (MSW) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and quick. The interviewer was friendly, detailed about the position, and answered questions well. The interview was like any other interview, asking traditional questions, such as why choose to work at this organization, provide background info, etc.
Interview Questions: Why choose to work at Providence

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Well handled and professional. They did review my resume and ask reasonable questions. They were insightful during the process and helped me understand the company culture. Overall reasonable experience and thru helped me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: What type if salary are you asking for ?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews total and a writing exercise. The first was an interview over Microsoft teams with one person, and the second was with a panel of people. In addition, they also gave me a writing exercise to complete between the two interviews. Everyone was really nice and responsive to my emails during the interview process, however, they took a really long time ti get back regarding final decisions. In addition, once I was declined,I sent a prompt email back asking for feedback on my interviews and was met with radio silence, even after followup. Other than that, though, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to deal with conflict?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Got one hour interview,  very general technical and behavior questions. Thought going well given past work experiences. However HR being ghost even I sent checking in email. Online portal kept saying under consideration for 3 weeks after the interview. Than it showed the session expired. Hope getting rejection letter or update of online portal earlier instead of keeping people waiting.
Interview Questions: What kind of project you are interested in?

title: Clinic Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Richland, WA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter sent me the job posting and I applied. There was a series of automated texts asking questions about experience, education, and desired salary range, and then an email to schedule a video interview. There were limited interview options available and I had to schedule it over a long lunch break. I was notified that it would be 45-60 minutes and would be a behavioral structured interview and listed a few points to be prepared for. Interview time came and I sat for an hour in the teams lobby and no one picked up. I called the office where the position was located and the interviewer was in a meeting and I left a message on their voicemail. They did call back and apologize and explained that the position had been filled that day and they had asked the recruiters to void the posting.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: 5 person panel interview, each person asks 1 question 5-6 behavioral/ experience questions 1 priority question 1 case study at the end of interview They give you about 5 mins to review a case study then ask you questions about it afterwards.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to deal with a difficult patient.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: simple application process….providence portal that allows you to send multiple applications to the providence network. everyone was really nice and kind. They made you feel at ease. you get a case study and you have to do a sbar and what you think is wrong
Interview Questions: 6 questions 1 clinical question diversity question strengths and weaknesses priority question (patient scenario who you would see first etc)

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It went great very informative and asked many questions about experience and availability . There was questions of how you deal with certain instances and how to deal with them .
Interview Questions: About yourself many questions and different scenarios.

title: IS - Project Manager Mergers and Acquisitions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions:
I initially had a very positive experience with the IS hiring manager. Within a few hours of applying, I received a questionnaire to complete. The next day, I got a call from the hiring manager to schedule an initial interview which took place a few days later. The one on one interview went very well, it was conversational and allowed me to represent myself well while also addressing the needs of the role. Before ending the call, I was told I did great and that he wanted me for a final interview. That was scheduled for a week later and took place. I interview with other team members and had a very positive experience. A few days later, I sent a thank you email to the manager and he let me know I would hear the following Monday, about 5 days after my second interview. That Monday, I received an email informing me that other interviews had to be rescheduled and I would hear from him in a day or two. Two days passed, no follow-up. I waited until that Friday, which was two days after I was told I would know one way or another, to follow up. It's been a week since I followed up and still no response. There was great communication throughout the entire process but to be ghosted by a hiring manager without the courtesy of an email was incredibly rude and a waste of time. I was told I was one of three candidates so it's not like there were too many interviewees to respond to. 

Update: About two weeks after posting this I received a canned email response that they had gone with a different candidate. All in all, still disappointing given the initial upfront communication and interest from the hiring manager, only to receive an incredibly impersonal email at the end of it all.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience managing multiple priorities and complex projects.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, Approachable , no cover letters required. Staff were professional and understanding. The interview should take about 30-40 min max. About 4 behavioral questions 1 case study 1 prioritization question and SBAR
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: After applying they will ask you to complete a one way interview. Waste of time. They pulled the position after receiving applicants. They appear to be apart of the companies posting GHOST positions but not actually hiring, from my research after my experience. Save your time apply somewhere.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our company? What is your salary expectation? Tell us about a challenging work place situation?

title: Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Panel style interview on video and clinical questions asked. Very great interview process with wonderful management professionals. Overall, it was actually quite an enjoyable experience as far as interviews go!
Interview Questions: They asked me clinical style questions and general kind of interview questions too.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Quick response to application with email response; immediate text "intro" interview to ensure I met the qualifications; quickly scheduled interview and lovely interviewer. Overall it was a thoughtful and responsive interview process. Recommend applying.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult patient and how you handled it.

title: Patient Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Apply on their website, answer a quick and easy questionnaire about the role such as if you are okay working that time frame, available on weekends and holidays, okay with getting a drug test and background check, schedule an online interview
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to work in that position? Why at this hospital. Can you work [specific days and times] ? What do you think you will learn by working here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Good interview process, felt comfortable and welcomed by staff especially being from another place. I felt informed by how everything works and all of my questions were efficiently answered. The residency director especially made me feel welcome and like she will be there for residents which was reassuring.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you found yourself in a difficult situation during clinicals?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 calls. First round was talent acquisition, then direct managers and then directors. Standard questions. The organization is very mission and purpose focused and it was reflected in the interviews.
Interview Questions: What are 3 things you need to be happy in a role?

title: Social Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Two different online interviews, first being around 1 hour, second being 30 minutes. First one was one on one, second one was with two people who were more of a director role.
Interview Questions: How would you handle difficult patients?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I applied and got a email the same day to set up a interview.. The interview took about 30 minutes and it was in person . Easy process. Just be yourself.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Providence?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application, I received a handful of automated text messages from Providence asking questions like, "Do you have experience with RFP's" and "What is your expected salary". Very simple and only took about 10min to answer questions on my phone, After completing the texting portion, I had three virtual interviews each lasting 30-45min. All interviews took place on Microsoft Teams over about four weeks. The interviews included pretty standard questions, and expected responses to be in the STAR response method. After completing the third interview, I never heard back from the recruiter or hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How do you get team members engaged on a project? Tell me about a time you had a difficult conversation? Tell me about a time you had to work with someone and had a disagreement?

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Always starts with an automated text interview for screening. The recruiter reviews them and determines whether to proceed with you or not. If selected, you'll interview with the hiring manager (and team members). As one who has hired staff, I knew I wasn't going to get the job in the first 10 minutes because it was obvious they were seeking a woman for the women-empowered team as evidenced by their expressions. I've also interviewed with Providence a few times. The recruiters are responsive but once they decline you, they go cold and treat you like you don't exist. You have to check the application portal for a status update - they won't notify you, the system doesn't produce an automated status update.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you've made a mistake and what did you do?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Live video interview with 2 managers, approximately 30 minutes long. They were both professional and the conversation flowed well. Explained the role and responsibilities. Situational behavior questions pertaining to my previous experience
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself, why St. Joseph's, Why do you want to be a nurse, tell me about a time you worked with a difficult patient,

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy, the interviewers are very informative and give insight after the interview . There is no second interview for me and introduce me to the staff right away.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself as a RN?

title: Senior Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: They outreached to me on LinkedIn, saying the position was remote. I was two interviews in when it turned out it was not remote, and I would have to move with my own funds to fulfill the requirements to have the job. I ended the process of my own accord due to this.
Interview Questions: Basic - what is your experience with X applications. Give us examples of how you would communicate with different audiences. How would you prioritize your work. How do you feel being underneath someone else with less work experience, as they are the supervisor.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Once you pass the first few steps, you get into a panel interview with about 5 people. They ask you personality questions as well as scenario and critical thinking questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Why would you be a good fit, etc

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview was going well and was interested in the position even though the future of the team wasn't very well fleshed out. I met with two managers at the company, and answered all of their questions correctly. The second one was supposed to ask me technical questions but said he had lost one of the questions, and the only one he did ask had some errors in it so it was hard to answer it correctly. A day after the second interview I got a form letter saying that they were not going forward with the interview. I thought it was extremely disrespectful after the time I put into the interview to not at least send a personalized note or give me a call. The only guess I have on why they didn't want to hire me is because I have no experience with Kubernetes, but that's clearly stated on my resume and I'm a quick learner. The second guy I interviewed with gave me some advice on what I should read up on with Kube, but I felt like I had completely wasted my time researching it when I later got the rejection letter. Seriously, why hand out advice if you're not going to go forward onto the third round? Not every position uses Kubernetes or needs it, and my time to spend on interviews is fairly limited. They just came off as really full of themselves. I guess the dead give away should have been when the second manager told me that most companies only use 10% of what Kube is capable of, but then didn't explain any further what the missing 90% could be.
Interview Questions: How can you sort, list, and count entries from a log file with a script without using any bash? (I have no idea what the use case for this would be, I'd just use bash)

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Told yes we want to do a 2nd interview nothing ever happens One Director told me the emails sent to me didn't go through to interview me because I contacted her on linkedin. Then, she interviews me and it already said i wasnt selected for that job before the interview. Super unprofessional. Led down dead ends.
Interview Questions: What is a social media effort you were most proud of

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Petaluma, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Manager interview and separate peer interview. Very friendly and kind. Was able to do interview on Teams which was helpful. Lots of time spent telling me about the hospital and department and asked situational questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at PVH?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for an interview and the hiring manager didn't bother to show up. Reached out to the recruiter multiple times with no response. Two weeks later the recruiter canceled the interview. Unprofessional and wasted time.
Interview Questions: I don't know, they didn't show up into the teams meeting.

title: Quality Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview directly with the manager and the potential team you'll be working with. Only 1 interview. Questions centered around skill set and different scenarios involving working different individuals and complicated problems.
Interview Questions: How are your communication skills across various lanes?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: they knew they weren't hiring me. never should have wasted my time. just as hard as floor nursing so pick wisely.... make sure you know what you are getting into
Interview Questions: many they were all over the place

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Three person panel interview via zoom. Behavioral based questions and case study.Few basic questions about the organization and your interest in the TIP program. Scenario questions to discuss your experience and response to situations.
Interview Questions: 1. Why the TIP program 2. Time you were culturally sensitive 3. Case study 4. A time you prevented harm/hazard from occurring 5. What can you bring to the organization? 6. Time you went above and beyond for a patient 7. Organize 4 tasks in the order of urgency/importance

title: Doctor of Physical Therapy Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: They ask random questions that aren’t relevant to role. You ask nothing about my experience or qualifications, revenue generated or Patient satisfaction scores. No instead you list providences core values and tell me to provide an example of when I treated a specific patient in the past and demonstrated all of these core values. Honestly just a lot of really bizarre questions.
Interview Questions: See post above about interview process.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: There are two types of interviews there is the initial online phone screening where you answer questions. If selected you move onto a group panel interview. Once that is done you get offered the position.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to do the work you do.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Amazing! Great interview, very diverse population, want you to succeed! New grad program opportunities for nursing! Overall, a wonderful experience. I would highly recommend accepting the interview if given the chance to meet with nurse leaders and/or tour the unit.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this hospital

title: New RN Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview overall took approximately 30 minutes, very kind staff. Several behavioral questions followed up with several case study questions. Afterwards, extra time was given to answer any questions and follow ups
Interview Questions: Describe what being a professional means to you

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: With the hiring manager and asked a lot of behavioral questions etc. friendly and kind people. It was on zoom during COVID but it was good. I did not find the questions hard. Basic things like tell me about yourself and previous work history
Interview Questions: What are your healthcare experiences

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviewers on my panel who were very welcoming. I had the interview over Microsoft Teams. Highly recommend trying the Teams link before actually being on interview to make sure everything works.
Interview Questions: 5 behavioral question, a case study with follow-up questions, and a prioritization question

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: After filling out online application, there was an automated text interview. Based on answers provided, it let me go online and schedule an interview. It was a panel interview which was conducted via Microsoft Teams with 3 managers. It was 30 minutes long and went very well! They asked about 3-4 behavioral questions, a prioritization question, and gave a case study. At the end, they allowed me to ask them questions. Overall, it was a smooth process!
Interview Questions: What would you bring to our team?

title: CF Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: You fill out the application online. Within the hour you get a text message with other pre-interview questions. Within one week, a link to a video conferencing interview is sent via email.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Met with a panel of 3 nursing leaders where they asked a series of questions regarding my experience, why I want to join their hospital, and clinical scenarios. They ask for individual examples with the questions that they ask, so make sure to prepare some examples for them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Providence?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Job fair interview. quick and easy. 3 panels interviews with multiple specialties. can choose which specialty you want to interview with. very quick process. All the interviewees were friendly. not very serious tone
Interview Questions: What do you know about St. Jude?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions and case study. The panel was cool and welcoming just be yourself and you'll be great. HR should Gert back to you in about 2 weeks or so...
Interview Questions: Know why you really want to work at providence. Know your selling points. Be ready to answer the case study which can be from any classes taken in nursing school.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The Application process is very Automated. everything was done with email, then will get questions texted to you by robot. No actual recruiter. Negative experience. The interview experience was average.
Interview Questions: What is your day like ?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: There was a Pre interview screening and follow up interview with recruiter, process was easy and the interviewer was courteous. Better experience than for administrative positions. I would recommend that applicants be proactive in following up with the recruiter and set scheduling expectations for the position up front.
Interview Questions: What is one way that you have resolved conflict in your current job.

title: Emergency Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview over Microsoft teams to see if you’re a good fit. Best to know of a few situations in which you’ve demonstrated good customer service, helped someone out and what you could bring to the team.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you helped a peer or coworker?

title: Strategy Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Passed the first round but didn't get luck in the second/last round. The interviews process took about two weeks but I didn't hear back about result until two months later.
Interview Questions: Can you walk me through an example where you used TAM?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Hiring event. So it was a lot of people applying and also a lot of different interviewers. Overall a liked the space I was in, I believe I was in the spiritual healing center.
Interview Questions: Why st josephs? What makes you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, first a phone interview to assess skills, interest, and overall application and then panel interview that is more in depth covering on the job skills and whether you would be a good fit on the team
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses, how you would like to develop on the job

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I believe I did 3 rounds of interview. I had to submit a video interview, there were multiple questions that I had to answer. I then had a interview with the team manager, very comfortable & then I had a interview with the team I was set to work with and other managers.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join Health Care

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview are conducted on teams and uses the behavioral based interview model. Recalling events in the interviewee's past to understand how one would react in the new work environment. New grad interview does not require many nursing scenarios
Interview Questions: What did you do to resolve a conflict ? How did it play out.

title: Nutrition Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was a 30 minute interview where I had to respond to behavioral based interview questions that apply to the position I applied for. They also provided information about the job and potential hours. It was a very standard interview.
Interview Questions: Please share a time where you faced a challenge and how you overcame that challenge.

title: Remote Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was alright, not to great but at the same time not to bad. It was what most would call, "average". I spoke to around 5 people similar to a panel interview. I do want to point out that at one point they asked me the same question twice for which I politely told them I had already answered that question.
Interview Questions: Variety of questions pertaining to work.

title: Coding Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Houston, TX) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: One interview was conducted.Within 2 to 3 weeks I was notified from hiring manager HR would extend a offer. It took about 3 days got a call to go over verbal offer then the formal offer letter was emailed. Next pre boarding sent out new hire forms and background check electronically
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself briefly.

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was by far the easiest interview process of all the residency programs I applies to in LA and OC area. I applied, then 3 days later received an automated text to answer some questions such as are you ok with night shift, whats your flexibility, do you have your BSN, etc. Then after that they liked my answers so I was sent a link to schedule an interview that following week on microsoft teams. The first interview was with 2 nurse managers as well as a charge nurse. After that they liked me so that same day I interviewed with the unit I was applying for director. Although I must note I found the first interview team to be very cold and make me feel very rushed. The director of the unit was amazing though and made me feel confident and welcomed.
Interview Questions: What attributes would you bring to Providence, why are you applying for this unit, a diversity question, pretty much all your typical new grad interview questions, as well as a prioritization question and case study.

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Asked 15 behavioral questions in a row, all very similar and the manager was extremely negative the whole time. They essentially told me that I wouldn't be a good fit for the position but that they would like to move me forward. After the interview, I withdrew my application as I did not feel the manager would have been supportive in my growth and overall success at the company.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you made a mistake

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Brea, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: After filling out the application, you receive several text messages with pre interview questions. You may have two rounds of this. Then once they determine you can move to the next round you do a live interview via video conferencing.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years? What CEU course have you taken? What experience do you have with adults and children?

title: Medical Office Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very quick and I was only asked a handful of questions, mostly scenario questions. I had the chance to be interviewed by a very kind hiring manager though.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Clinical Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with recruiter on supplement questions. Then once you’ve past through the initial step, you’re interviewed by the manager and supervisor(s) on a virtual call. Interviewee gives a pretty good summary of what is expected of you as soon as you are on boarded. The interview itself was professional but also friendly and easy-going.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here? 
What are your experience with difficult customers?

title: CNA/HUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting with nurse manager and RN coordinator. After the initial meeting, I received an email stating that they were preparing an offer. I requested a 2nd interview so that I could meet my manager in person. The recruiter and nurse manager were very understanding about allowing me time to accept the offer.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working with COVID patients? Can you tell us about your CNA experience?

title: Administrative/Clerical Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for an interview that no hiring ever showed up for. I was given notification through email to show up on time. I waited for more than 15 min and nothing. They send a bunch of robot/automated emails that look like there from real “people” but no one will actually respond. I had to call there office only for them to tell me it was already filled. Why didn’t they email, call, or just decline the interview straight? It was a complete waste of my time. This was such an unprofessional experience.  Your just another number. I’ll probably never apply here again.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I just started here and after getting to meet the team and our manager I feel right at home. I couldn't have asked for a smoother transition as a young and new professional
Interview Questions: Where did you grow up?

title: Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was selected to do self-paced pre-screening online interview. They were about 7-8 questions including these: Please summarize how your background and experience are a fit for this role? Briefly describe a recent reporting project that you worked on and what your role and work process was on the project? What analytical platforms and software tools do you typically use when analyzing data and preparing reports/data visualizations?
Interview Questions: Briefly describe your experience and skills with creating reports using financial data, and with utilizing financial data for business planning purposes?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have had several interviews canceled, 2 no shows for the same job. No replies to my email, call or text about this. Now they have a virtual hiring event today. It does not appear to be working. The towns people have warned me not to work here and it’s all becoming apparent now why.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Food Service Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: After filling out several surveys and applications I was scheduling for an online interview. I waited in a virtual waiting room for 40 minutes and no one showed up. I tried to email several hiring managers and days later someone reached out and said they didn’t know what happened. I never heard back.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First and only interview was over Microsoft Teams with a panel of five people. Lasted around 30 mins. They asked 8-10 behavioral questions one after another (like "tell us about a time when you managed a disagreement with a supervisor"). The group was nice and friendly, but I didn't know going in that it would be with multiple people which was a bit surprising. All in all the questions were very experience-oriented, but nothing too out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions:
-Tell us about a time when you managed competing deadlines.
-Tell us about a time when you dealt with disagreement or a difficult outcome.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: 30-min screening interview, followed by 1-3 panel interview (around 30 minutes each). Interviews were done virtually. The questions were mostly Performance-Based, Communication, and Behavioral questions. Big emphasis on the Mission and Values.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience that aligns with our Mission and Values.

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Detailed and long. The process was 2 months from the time I applied to offer. Many interviews and they make you provide references first. It was onsite and had a few panels.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your interests

title: Healthcare Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
They interviewed me twice (an hour-long conversation each), told me I could make a great candidate for the position, then sent me an automated offer letter, only to be told later on that I actually wasn't given an offer. It was a mistake and sent by accident.

Sometime later they sent me a fairly basic skills SQL test, and then after a week of radio silence I received an automated rejection email without explanation.  I emailed the hiring manager to find out why, and I was told they found a candidate with more advanced SQL skills. I find this odd, since my last position was nothing but advanced SQL day in and day out as a developer/engineer. I was then told I would probably be better off in a BI position than a data analytics, even though I specifically said I would rather have an analytics position, and its odd considering my last position was a blend of data analytics and business intelligence development, and I have certification in data engineering, data science and data analytics.

I just find it strange considering my last position was probably technically more challenging (with a technical SQL interview test that was MUCH harder I might add), and yet they still hired me despite having much less experience than what I have now (and it was a healthcare company as well)  but somehow I am not qualified for this position!
Interview Questions: What about this position appeals to you?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very pleasant. They asked what my individual pros and cons were. They asked me simple yet deep questions to get to the core of my knowledge and beliefs.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a fast pace environment?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Screen with HR over the phone, then once you passed that level, and in person interview at the hospital was scheduled with team and management. They asked questions about previous work experience.
Interview Questions: Is commuting an issue for you?

title: Register Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom or microsoft. It was panel interview along with case study. 5 questions including why providence, tell me a time you provided safe environment etc. The case study was average level.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was asked multiple questions the “regular” interview questions. Why do you want to work for us? What are your qualifications? And then if I had children and would be calling in frequently
Interview Questions: I received a phone call that they were not interested a month after my interview and then two months later offered the position

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and straight forward. Submit application online, one phone interview and an in person interview. It was not very challenging but they seemed to care about me as a person not just a worker
Interview Questions: What are your values? Why do they matter to you?

title: Practice Manager and Business Development Roles Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: I can’t seem to have a positive interview with this organization.  The last position that I applied for, I was led through the interview as if there would be next steps.  I had an email after hanging up the phone which was a denial letter, timestamped about 15 minutes before the interview even concluded.  Unprofessional!  The latest position that I applied for, for which I was completely qualified with current and relevant experience, I set up an interview through the automated system.  Two days later, the interview was cancelled and I was sent an email that they would not be moving forward with my candidacy.  I reached out to an HR contact and was told they would look into it as it could be an error with the new app system.  Ghosted.  Avoid this unprofessional group at all costs.
Interview Questions: No questions asked.  Interview cancelled

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got to speak with the supervisor and the manager I would be working with in my frist interview.  They explained all the technical aspects of the job and the specific benches and analyzers I would be working on if hired.   Very friendly and very professional
Interview Questions:
What is your background?
What would you do if a member of your team corrected you on a procedure?

title: New Grad RN Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial meeting was with two nursing executives associated with the hospital. The second interview, a few weeks after the initial, was with a nurse on a specific unit within that hospital.
Interview Questions: What brought you into nursing? What are you worried about most coming into the program?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Hartford, CT) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Group interview via zoom. Interviewers were personable and professional. Asked a lot of situational questions. Also asked a lot of follow up questions. There was a phone interview with HR to screen and then one interview with the Hiring Manager (s)
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult decision you had to make about personnel?

title: Telephone Triage Nurse Advice Line Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Short, easy, generic questions during the interview. Some miscommunication with the Human Resources department prior to the interview, but was later resolved.  Two person panel for first interview, then a phone interview with manager at a later date.
Interview Questions: Experience in the medical field?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward,  practical,  discussion based. Non skills related, mostly communication on how to handle certain scenarios and experience in the field. Timeline was a bit drawn out but not too much. Overall very smooth process
Interview Questions: How would you handle X scenario in the field?

title: Specialty Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
One interview with the hiring manager and another Specialty Scheduling Coordinator from the clinic where I applied to. The interview was easy, and the interviewers were both pleasant and kind. I asked about compensation which neither of the interviewers were able to provide; they directed me back to the recruiter for questions on compensation.

I asked the recruiter about compensation and they were unable to give me an answer other than "between $x-y and goes up from there depending on experience."

The hiring manager offered me the role and I was sent an offer letter by the recruiter. I have over a decade of relevant experience and the rate of pay I was offered was less than a dollar above the "x" amount listed.

Upon researching average compensation for the role with Providence in my area, I found the average rate of pay to be above the "y" amount. I attempted to negotiate, requesting the average rate of pay that I had determined in my research. The recruiter got back to me later that day saying the amount I was offered was the "maximum offer." I declined the job offer.

The next day I received an email from the recruiter with a new offer of the exact amount I had asked for. I declined the job offer again.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with computer software?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I had some behavioral and experience questions. Then went into reading a case study and answered questions about the case study. I was interviewed by 3 people who were very nice and willing to give advice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at St. Joseph ?

title: Business Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then was asked to submit a series of self-paced video recordings answering about 10 questions. Afterwards, I met with the hiring manager 1-1 for about 30 minutes. Interview went well and was told she'd email me for a second round to be scheduled for next week with another Data Analyst. But I never received an email from her and the recruiter also ghosted me.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with healthcare finance?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. Was given email instructions on how to access online interview via computer or phone. Interviewers were kind, answered questions and provided information clearly.  Interview was average 30 minutes long, can go as long as an hour if needed as stated in email.
Interview Questions: Based on the areas of coverage that was provided, how do you feel about traveling to those areas and are you ok with traveling out of your assigned area if needed?

title: Family Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
This was for a Family Care Coordinator position at the Alaska CARES clinic at Providence in Anchorage, Alaska. 

After I submitted my application with resume and cover letter, I quickly received an email for a text-based screening. I completed the screening and then received an email offering a virtual interview. The virtual interview was with a manager at the clinic and was sort of a pre-screen to be sure I understood what services the clinic provides and was still interested. I later received a call from the manager offering me an in person interview. The in person interview was with a panel including the manager and several other team members. 

The next day, I received a call from HR offering me the position which was followed by an email with the offer letter.
Interview Questions: What would your coworkers say is the best and worst thing about working with you?

title: Admin Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled for an interview at 12 pm and no one ever showed up. After waiting over 15 minutes, I emailed the recruiter twice and I still haven’t received a response. It’s been 5 days.. very unprofessional!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was informal with questions that were pretty standard. The person performing the interview was late due to numerous meetings. Which was completely understandable. She was patient and kind.
Interview Questions: How I would manage a team. She also described the role in depth.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Online/telephone with a recruiter. Process initially was a couple weeks to get beyond that phase, then in person at a local facility with a group of people (roughly 5 in a room).
Interview Questions: General operational questions on problem solving and teamwork

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom interview, 3 person panel. They asked a case study, general interview questions. Everyone was extremely nice! I felt comfortable answering all the questions. 

-give us a time you dealt with a safety issue
- cultural 
- why St. Johns
Interview Questions: Why did you choose St. John’s

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward process. After the initial assessment (filling out a form online about skills and experience), there were two rounds: hiring manager interview and panel interview. The process took two weeks.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why did you choose Providence?
Q: How have you demonstrated the company values in prior roles?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers asked general questions such as how you handled conflict or a time you provided patient-centered care. They present a case study and asks how you would address that situation and to provide an SBAR
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict and how you addressed the situation.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: This is for the inpatient rehab in Fullerton. Automated system to self schedule an interview. The director of rehab was kind and asked normal interview like questions. Overall took around 30-45 minutes.
Interview Questions: - Why did you become an OT - If you encountered a physician that does not believe OT is necessary for your patient, what would you do? - What do you do to promote work life balance when you're not working - Where do you see yourself in 5 years - What was an example of how you were creative during a treatment session - Specific questions about prior work experience

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy, biggest issue i ran into was it took three different reschedule dates due to the original person not being there. After we connected on zoom the two people i interviewed with did a great job asking relative questions and making the conversation flow nicely.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a crisis situation?

title: Principal Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It was a very drawn out interview process where I was interviewed by close to 10 people.  But everyone was kind and asked good questions. I ended up getting the position
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when...

title: Provider Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email that they had scheduled an online video interview for me. I joined the meeting 10 minutes before the interview and muted all my devices. The interview started at 2pm. I waited until 2:15pm and no one joined. I looked at my phone that was silenced and I received an email at 1:59pm that I am no longer in consideration. Why schedule the interview or not notify me way sooner before I got ready and waited there?? Very unprofessional!!!
Interview was scheduled  with Linda Jedrasiak.
Interview Questions: No interview questions were asked.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Clam, approachable manager with thought provoking questions that truly showed both her care for the unit and the individual. Felt more like a discussion than an interview. Some difficulties with Teams but those were resolved.
Interview Questions: How would your best friend describe you?

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great flow..supervisor was easy to speak to..the whole process was great. Interview left me very informed and feeling optimistic about the position. I received great feedback from my responses which was great!
Interview Questions: What my current experience level was and position

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Answer a series of automated messages by a recruiter online with generic but simple questions. Afterwards I was invited to an online interview that was self scheduled with their automated system.

Did not get to interview because nobody showed up for my interview. I arrived early as instructed and waited 30 minutes after the scheduled time. Emailed the recruiter about the situation and was told to reschedule on the automated system. Nobody showed up again for my 2nd interview. I waited in the room for 40 minutes again. Emailed the recruiter again and no response. Please be more considerate and don't waste your applicant's time if you're not serious about the application process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Process Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview questions sent and must be completed via video. Experiences in social media recording videos would be beneficial to this process.  The questions were about challenges, working in teams, self introduction, etc
Interview Questions: Working in a service oriented environment

title: Clinical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Went pretty smoothly, manager was very communicative and kind. There was an initial phone interview lasted around 30 minutes and then proceeded to a panel interview that lasted about an hour via zoom.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you bring to this position?

title: AR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Remo, VA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy and laid back. Very professional not too stressful. Had a really good vibe. Loved the informative information given about the position. Would definitely recommend the company. Supervisors are good at their jobs.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: New Grad RN (TIP Program) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: interview in front of panel of three people, then case study with five minutes time frame. Panel seemed somewhat disinterested in interview but probably did multiple interviews that day. Questions were usual why this program? Why this unit? How do you deal with cultural sensitivity?
Interview Questions: Average questions usually asked for new grads

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions:
Online screening interview process
Total questionnaire had been asked to check your general profile
Later, after reviewing of those answers given by the candidate the hiring team will respond if the candidate get selected for the next round
Interview Questions: General questions had asked by the organization

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based interview probing for examples and demonstration of the Providence core values.  Very interactive and positive.  Team approach which allows you to meet members of the working team as well
Interview Questions: provide an example of where you demonstrated compassion on the job

title: Medical Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of behavioral questions like how did you make an upset customer happy? I felt like they asked dumb questions. Why are you applying to work at Providence?
Interview Questions: What kind of work environment do you like?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with the unit manager and shift manager.   We discussed my background and resume with three additional interview questions. Two of the questions related to clinical situations and the other on was a behavioral interview question. Overall, easy to talk to and discuss opportunity.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were in a conflict with an someone while at work.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Great manager. Down to earth and practical. No empty promises, said it like it is. Straight to the point and clear with questions. He was professional. 10/10 would interview again.
Interview Questions: What is your experience? What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses? What are you looking for in a job? What made you apply to PVH?

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got called the next day, interview was easily setup. The interviewers were very nice and made you feel at ease. The interview was via zoom which was nice. The whole process took nearly a month though.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time for them to get in touch. The process was choppy and slow. I ended up getting an offer from a company that I really wanted so I canceled the scheduled interview.
Interview Questions:
Why are you a good fit?
Why did you apply?

title: New Grad RN Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview online due to COVID. However, lead interviewer wasn't very friendly. Not even sure how much they were paying attention to responses. Kind of already felt right off the bat that I wouldn't get the job. Felt uncomfortable and awkward.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the organization.

title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: On three separate occasions, I was stood up by individual and panel interviewers with no notices prior or subsequent to the scheduled interviews. A person who identified herself as a staff attending only to sit in could not locate any of the panel assigned to interview me and after around 20 minutes, exasperated after receiving only a reply from one of the panel members stating that she had a conflict at the time, said to me, 'I'll just do it'. The interview was not organized and did not follow a 'behavioral model' and only lasted 10 to 15 minutes max. The same day, I saw the position reposted and shortly thereafter received a rejection letter although I was qualified for the position, and made several attempts to report that I had not been properly or fairly interviewed for the position.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when a crisis arrived and how you resolved it.

title: Operations Manager, Claims and Insurance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: My 1st interview was a panel interview and went well mostly. They asked me about my background and something personal about myself. My 2nd interview was with the hiring manager and the questions were mostly about my skills and management experience. I never heard back with an update regarding the position. I sent a thank you note to the hiring manager who stated that they were in the process of finalizing the interviewing process. I believe a courtesy email would have been helpful to inform the candidate on the job status.
Interview Questions: How would you define success?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Croton-on-Hudson, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: your average run of the mill interview questions, not too heavy on the technical details.  More or less looking for fit with culture of team.  They will obviously ask about prior work experience
Interview Questions: tell us about a time where you had to motivate a coworker /colleague to work on something boring/not overly interesting

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Easy very amazing people. Was a video panel interview and was not as hard as sounded. . . .Was an hour long and went through basic questions and personality. I must say they never made me feel nervous but was a joy to interview
Interview Questions: About my past job experience

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Westminster, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was offered an interview within 2 days of submitting my application. The interview was hosted on Microsoft Teams and consisted of 5 behavioral questions, a prioritization question, and a case study. The interview lasted approximately 30 minutes.
Interview Questions:
1) What do you bring to the table?
2) What does cultural competency mean to you and give an example of how you applied it in clinical 
3) Why did you choose Providence?

title: Emergency Room Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: They never showed up, the interview was scheduled for a position at providence Portland ER on a certain date at a certain time. I sat in the interview room for 2 hours waiting for my interviewers to show. I never received a response by email explaining why they wasted my time. I reached out to my recruiter for an explanation and got no response. Just a email the following day saying that they “went with someone else”.  What a horrible experience for a position I was looking forward to interviewing for.
Interview Questions: The hiring managers in the emergency department never showed to the meeting.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an automated email immediately asking me to complete a self-paced video interview. It's the most awkward thing ever. Then was asked to interview with the hiring manager, and again with the hiring manager and the entire team (8 total people) in a panel interview. Process took about 2-3 weeks total. Offer was far below what I had indicated would make me interested, which is unfortunate because I enjoyed the hiring manager and the vision for the position.
Interview Questions: The first interview with the hiring manager was more casual and asking about background with systems, etc. The panel interview was all behavioral questions "Tell me about a time you..".

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fast and simple , with only a few questions and a case study. It was about a total of 30 minutes with a panel of three people, for me at least.
Interview Questions: Time you went above and beyond

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Wasn’t with actual hiring manager. Interviewer talked most of the interview. Otherwise the process was okay. Got to tour the unit post interview which was helpful for making a decision
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you had a special connection with a patient?

title: Float Exercise Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
