Interview Descriptions: Automated text messages were asked of you. Then you are set up with a time and date. 3 supervisors/managers are interviewing you and asked you structured behavioral questions. It is a round robin type of questioning.
Interview Questions: When was a time when you were coming across an obstacle at work and had to overcome it?

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: One of the worst experiences with an employer i have ever had. They set me up for3 interviews but no one ever showed up. A really awful experience. The recruiter doesn’t even reply to emails.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was given 5 interview questions and had to answer each in a video. They were usual interview questions like: "What would you do if you disagreed with your work team?"
Interview Questions: What was a situations that was overwhelming for you and how did you resolve it?

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Their first screening isn't even made by a person, rather it's a request to record you answering some generic questions.  Would have been much better if they at least made the effort to reach out and have someone screen the candidate.  As it is, they are going to loose a lot of candidates due to this.
Interview Questions: Mainly behavioral questions, ala "Name a time when..."

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: After applied online, got email for interview pretty quick. Only take video one way interview; The questions are normal. All of behavior questions. You can prepare it after seeing the questions. The questions are not hard.
Interview Questions: 5 questions. Don't remember exactly.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Fifteen minute phone call prescreen, and make sure you are interested.
Fortyfive minute Microsoft teams virtual interview getting to know the job just with one person. Them getting to know you and you getting to know them. Pretty typical.
Lots of follow up emails.
Interview Questions:
Why you want to work here?
What qualification do you have?
Do  you have questions for us?

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: A panel of three interviewers each took turns asking questions. Beginning with what qualities made me a good fit for the role, what drew me to the company, how the mission statement resonated with me. There was also a series of questions that questions requiring specific examples of dealing with patients in the past. The interview finished with two case studies.
Interview Questions: What does excellence mean to you?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Tarzana, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fast and detailed and  professional and I had good vibes from the interview but I was offered the job and currently waiting for my offer. I hope I will get the pay I’m looking for
Interview Questions: What the job was like, and how the environment was with everything that happens at the hospital.

title: Sr Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Hesperia, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: During the process of the first interview, I was scheduled to meet other leaders from other locations. After meeting them, I was told they will get back to me. However,  I never received a follow-up email or a phone call on the outcome of my 3  interviews meetings.  I  emailed  HR -Recruiting to follow up, needless to say, they never respond neither. It's been a month since I interview with this company. I'm very disappointed with how unconsidered they are with their hiring candidates. Lack of follow-up after interviews says a lot about how this company's HR  poor hiring management functions.
Interview Questions: How will I perform disciplinary actions with my employees?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was relaxed and non-threatening. They were attentive to my answers. They made the atmosphere light  and very laid back. The interviewers seemed very interested in my work history. overall it was a  great experience.
Interview Questions: how do i handle difficult situations

title: AR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, but a little lengthy and time consuming due to multiple interviews. The questions asked felt relevant to my experience and the position I was interviewing for.  What to expect after each interview was clearly explained.
Interview Questions: If I was comfortable working for a religious non profit organization.

title: Electronic Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied 1 week ago and got an email to complete an online screening. Once that was finished I got another email to schedule a video interview which was scheduled for today. Interviewer was a no-show, emailed the recruiter after 15 min of waiting only to be told that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: N/A, interview did not occur.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received an email Nov. 17 after 7pm for an interview scheduled first thing in the AM the next week. The interview was through Teams. Turns out the browser is essential since Teams at my current job is set for Chrome, I used Microsoft Edge for the interview, but the camera function didn't work. They didn't want to have the interview without it so I switched to Firefox. They joked about my technical problem solving skills.   There were two interviewers and they took turns going back and forth asking me questions. The position description had a list of challenges and responsibilities but they said the position only has 3 functions. *That was illuminating.* They seemed nice and no one was rude, but it felt pretty flat and sterile, like the intent was to check a box.
Interview Questions:
After submitting my application materials there was a video pre-screening with about 10 questions. The live interview asked some of the same questions, some new questions, and some that didn't really relate to the job since the position description didn't match what they described in the interview. 

Take 5 minutes to tell us about yourself and your career. What are some of your short and long term goals? How are your excel skills? What is your Power BI experience? Tell us about a time you gave someone feedback and it didn't go as planned? In the last year what process have you changed in your current job to be more efficient?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume for a position posted with an erroneous job description.  Needless to say the interview ended after they realized I wasn't a match and I read the job posting to the interviewers.  They didn't make a good impression and from the endless number of negative reviews, I am relieved that it interview ended.
Interview Questions: Not relevant. An erroneous job description was posted for this position.

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied 5 weeks ago and a few hours later I received an invitation to participate in a self-paced digital/text interview that consisted of a few very simple automatically populated questions. After 3 weeks, I received an email requesting to schedule a video interview with a link to select from available interview times. The link then took me to the ModernHire website where no interview times were listed. I could not reply to the individual who sent the link because the email was a "donotreply@modernhire.com." I then emailed the secondary recruiter from a previous email who contacted the original recruiter and the times were now available. Needless to say, my interview was set for today to which I logged in early waiting for additional participants. After 15 min, I emailed the recruiter to confirm our start time and called the extension listed without success. I waited on the video call for the allotted 30 min until I disconnected ending an ultimately disheartening process. By outsourcing their hiring procedures, SJH/Providence may be missing out on a larger pool of  qualified applicants.
Interview Questions: N/A: Interview was never performed.

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Forestville, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1st recruiter sets interview Interview 2nd talent advisor sets offer decision Set start date Lots of paperwork Emails A lot of waiting. I feel like it's a great process it's just time consuming.
Interview Questions: One weakness, one strength, difficult situation

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received an invite for live online interview with the Director of Pharmacy and other management team members at a hospital in Orange County, Ca.   Interview was arranged by Providence corporate recruiter based in Seattle, Washington - She sent me several confirmations and reminders  that my interview was scheduled at the end of that week, Friday @2pm. Not sure what happened, but when I entered the virtual interview room @1:50pm that day, no one else was online there with me.  I waited until 3:15pm . No one ever entered the virtual interview room besides me. Texted recruiter around 2:30pm, but she never replied. If they wanted to cancel the interview, they could have simply contacted me.  I was really disappointed.  Even bought a new headset/microphone just for the interview.
Interview Questions: Interviewers did not show up for the interview.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with three leads. Nothing too difficult, fairly relaxed meeting and nothing that was too uptight. Easy to answer questions, they all were your typical interview questions. The onboarding does take quite a while. Expect at the least a month before you will start your job.
Interview Questions: What are some strengths that you would bring to the team?

title: Network Engineer I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Providence uses the ever-embaressing one-way video interview scheme, which is truly one of the worst inventions ever. The service they use is not only an insult to applicants, but also fraught with technical problems (even if you have a webcam and microphone, you can get error messages which do not explain the problem, and the "help" sections are completely useless). Please do yourself a favor and apply to a job that cares enough about staffing to do person-to-person interviews. Using one-way video interviews is an absolute joke.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite color

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easier than most, standard questions.  Had a virtual/web-browser text-based interview followed by a Teams interview with video. Heard back from them within a week after the video interview, total process was only 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Providence?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Lacey, WA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Job fair, great interview, had "conditional offer" by end of day, had "formal offer letter" 3 days later including a start date, a pay scale, a supervisor, AND the audacity to ask if i had anything "pending" out there as far as applications or interviews that would slow down my ability to accept their offer...only to have it ALL be contingent upon a background check they have yet to run on you, nor tell you what would prevent you from getting the job, a bunch of automated email messages that sound like real people but they're not so you can't get any direction. Extremely cumbersome. By far, the absolute WORST hiring experience I've ever been a part of, completely backwards way of doing things and from such a large, prestigious organization that has been around for a very long time to be doing this to people. I used to think highly of this organization, not anymore.
Interview Questions: Adaptability: Something that changed (rule/policy) that you had to adhere to, what was it, was it difficult/easy transition, overall outcome positive or negative?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with my hiring manager as well as a Panel interview with other members of the team. There were also members from regional leadership present in the interview
Interview Questions: Example of demonstrating excellence in my practice

title: Data and Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Recorded interview with a follow-up video interview. The people were very pleasant. I don’t remember much more because this all took place in August/September 2021 and I received a rejection over a year later. This was the first follow-up I received from Providence, despite following up myself a couple times and Providence’s stated value of communicating with candidates, so that’s kind of disappointing (if typical of employers).
Interview Questions: Have you ever dealt with a difficult coworker?

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: the interview consisted of an initial phone call and then an in person interview. standard interview questions.  come prepared and ready to ask questions after the interview is complete. following the interview you will hear back pretty quickly with a decision.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Regulatory Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I applied as Regulatory Specialist and was emailed to a self-paced interview, then after the initial self-paced interview, I was emailed for a virtual interview with 2 women that at never even bothered to perform the interview! I prepared and rearranged my calendar and they didn't even send an email response back apologizing or trying to reschedule.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you applied to the position. How long do you plan on staying in this position? Have you ever worked with denials? How long have you worked with denials? What was the worst case you ever worked on?

title: Human Resources Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First it was thru video then in person. The interviewer was very through and listened in on my concerns or questions. It was very positive and my nervousness went away quickly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at providence.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2  rounds of interview , first it is online through a website which  is all behavioral questions, I had 7 and second round is with a senior employee in the position, its a 45 minute video interview
Interview Questions: PSJH is a faith-based, not-for-profit organization.  We start our meetings with a prayer or reflection, and the sign of the cross is on our logo and openly displayed in and on our buildings.  We are a mission driven organization. Our five core values are Compassion, Dignity, Justice, Excellence, and Integrity.  How do our values align with yours?

title: Patient Experience Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two weeks after applying, I was invited to take part in a live video interview. I scheduled the earliest available interview time they had. On the day of the interview, I dialed into the phone line as instructed, and also waited in the video conference room. After waiting in the room alone for 10 minutes, I reached out via email to see if perhaps I had mixed up the dates or time for the interview. 20 minutes after the interview was scheduled to begin, I received an email back stating that the hiring manager had already filled the position, and that they no longer needed to interview me. It was incredibly unprofessional to not reach out to me prior to the interview to let me know that they had already chosen a candidate. Instead, they thoughtlessly wasted my time and had the audacity to automatically send a follow up survey mail asking about my experience with the interview process. I am disgusted at the level of unprofessionalism, but thankful that they showed early on how little they care for the time and energy of those they will potentially call colleagues. If I could give this company a negative 5 star review, I would.
Interview Questions: Couldn't tell you-I assume as it's primarily a customer care position that the questions would be mostly fluff like "Tell me about a difficult experience you had with a customer and how you handled it" "Tell me what 2+2=" etc

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: They ask scenario-based questions that are pretty self-explanatory. Your strengths and weaknesses and if you had a non-compliant coworker how would you handle it. It was an easy interview, the manger was very nice.
Interview Questions: Scenario in a diabetic patient

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Immediately following my application, I was sent an email invitation to do a self-paced video interview with Providence. Recording yourself is super awkward. It's no substitute for a traditional interview.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself. Why are you interested in this job? Have you worked for Providence? Why are you looking to change jobs? Do you have any billing/collections experience? Have you worked in an office setting with specific performance expectations? What are your salary expectations?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Due to covid it was a audio interview with 2 people who asked a series of questions pertaining how much health care experience you have and what you would do in a situation with an upset patient.
Interview Questions: How do you handle an upset patient?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 weeks waiting for the interview after confirmation and another 2 weeks waiting for the training start date. Both labs and registrar areas are understaffed, therefore tension can be high as employees or “caregivers” often work overtime.
Interview Questions: How have you shown compassion?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was very short and fast. Hired pretty much on the spot!
HR is lacking in many ways- they do not give complete information about the onboarding process. I believe the HR is outsourced and needs much more improvement.
Interview Questions:
-Previous work experience
-Team player vs solo worker?
-A difficult situation and how I handled it
-When can I start?

title: RN ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: They asked numerous scenario and experience questions, etc. be sure to come prepared with questions. Also if you agree to their terms and conditions. What is your greatest achievement etc
Interview Questions: Why do you want icu

title: Senior Manager Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
Providence is an amazing organization. However, your interviewing process is a mess. In the past two years I have done your "screens" via video. The best and most dysfunctional, personal favorite was being contacted directly and then your "manager" and the other person, began eating. Yes. Really. Eating within five minutes, while on video, one was eating oatmeal and the other began munching on an apple. Both under the age of 30.  I was so shocked I was texting my ex Director at UCSF in San Francisco what was going on. 

You have a problem, it is unprofessional and NOT a good look. Yes. I declined. I refuse to work for snacking munchers while during an interview, this is NOT Google. Google would not allow this, you would be fired or put on suspension.
Interview Questions: Do not remember, they were too busy eating during the interview.

title: Practice Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: They utilized behavioral based questions for the first round interview. This was followed by a second round of interviews with the practitioners. This included understanding the current state of the clinic and improvement areas.
Interview Questions: Do you plan to say in the position?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done virtually due to Covid.  I was asked about my experience, my skills, why I wanted that specific job, etc.  They read their mission statement early in the interview.  They asked me when I could start (which is why I find it very odd I got a rejection email the next day).
Interview Questions: They asked questions about dealing with difficult patients and families and how I handled the situation and wanted stories about these situations.

title: Med Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: short and not organized.  she didn't seem prepared.  she also didn't answer my questions just read me the description.  she said they would call me back in 2-5 days.  still have not called.
Interview Questions: availability was the only question

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Walla Walla, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Really well and easy would easily give it five out of five stars very good questions were asked the manager seemed very positive and nice. Also due to COVID the interview was through the phone
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to take steps to solve a problem

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Edmonds, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Once some initial tech issues were addressed, I was able to submit a revised resume and apply.  Want to go back to school to become a med assistant; but also need income. My career has been marketing with many healthcare clients.  Up front in the cover letter and on my resume, I attempted to be crystal clear that I had all the admin skills required.  Ran my own business from fully equipped home office; worked in Silicon Valley Tech.  Everyone did their own admin work.  Three persons interviewed me.  One was favorable in tone.  One was quiet; and one had already decided she wanted someone who knew the Electronic Medical Record System.  I get it.  And let them know I understood how overburdened everyone in healthcare is.  At the end of the interview I was asked: “Do you [even] know how to use office equipment?”  I added “even” because that was the inflection in “know.”  I was clarifying and polite in my response.  If my offense was all in “my head,” I apologize.  That said, Recruiters, hiring managers, and HR, if your view of folks over 50 is that they are so inept they cannot even operate office equipment—don’t interview them.  For the record, go into FedEx someday; look at the ages of folks using office equipment.  Folks in their 20s don’t do paper.  Ironic to be insulted by a healthcare provider for my lack of admin skills.  Healthcare has THE lowest tech admin.  Brought my med records on CD from UT.  Sadly my clinic can’t use as only does hard copy or fax.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got a video call where they asked me the average interview questions. Received a call for the second interview which was in person. It took about 15 minutes but they pretty much asked the same questions.
Interview Questions: Why was I leaving my current job, Flexibility, Experience, How soon would I be able to start.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about an hour long. Interviewers were pleasant, respectful and very open. Surprisingly, I wasn’t as nervous as I thought. They answer all my questions and were very detailed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you went out of your way to help someone?

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: This interview process wasy, straight forward process. Great contact, communication and heard back very quickly. Many vignette and scenario questions. This was a very warm and inviting experience compared to other companies I have interviewed with before.
Interview Questions: What was the Most difficult client experience.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: 7 Interviews: 4 one-on-ones (with team leaders, executive, and VP), 1 group interview with entire team, 2 technical interviews to confirm skills in SQL and Excel.  Regardless of the sheer amount of interviews, the process itself lasted less than 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time/ multiple projects as a professional?

title: Supervisor - Service Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process is a 3-step process at least during COVID times.  

1.) Submit recorded responses to a handful of questions. 
2.) Interview with a panel of people in the position
3.) Interview with reporting manager(s)

From what I understand, if you pass this then you move into background checks and everything else.

FYI - Any mention of potential salary range will not be mentioned until at or after the 3rd interview. 
 Personally I find it very unappealing and unprofessional to hide a position's salary range for an approved position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you chose to apply for this position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: casual but formal, wasn't nerve wracking and were open to questions. information was guarded about the position and it felt off somehow so i decided against the position. don't stress and just prepare how you normally would and you'll do great
Interview Questions: how have you taken care of someone culturally

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
- Video interview
- Employer not specific about due date for self-paced interview
- Lack of follow-up timeline for when they’d have a decision 
- Lack if next-step process and who this was with.
Interview Questions:
- About yourself
- Case Studies

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: After filling out the application for the job on the Providence website I was sent a linked to an automated text interview  with a chat bot for screening purposes for the position and then went on to a phone interview with a manager in the department I was applying for
Interview Questions: They asked about past experience with various research projects

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews one with the team manager and the second with the department head. Typical questions on fit and your background. Got through the second round and said there was interest, but suddenly they decide to not make an offer.
Interview Questions: Teach me something as if I know nothing about it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It starts with an interview with the recruiter. They send your information to the manager. I got an interview with 2 clinical supervisors. It was fairly easy since they asked basic questions that hospitals usually ask.
Interview Questions: Why Providence? What type of patients have you taken care of before?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, was primarily tell me about a time….. first interview was virtual, no problems.  The interviewer was very friendly and courteous.  I felt at ease during the entire process.
Interview Questions: Simple and to the point

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Started with a video questionnaire, some subjects did not relate at all to the position. The second interview was with the hiring manager. It was cold impersonal, with no explanation or introduction.  It became apparent that this was not a place I wanted to work.
Interview Questions: Share your experience with this technology.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Well organized with prompt communication regarding interview time. Clear explanation on how to completed over the phone and online interview questions. Clear walk through on how to perform video interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Began with application on hospital website. Was contacted by recruiter to fill-out self-paced text interview. From that interview was invited for video interview with hiring staff at clinic. Video interview with Director of Therapy and Outpatient therapy director. Scenario based questions. Very friendly and easy to interact with both interviewers.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to be adaptable and describe the outcome

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, the person I spoke to waited until the interview was almost over to tell me that the critical care positions were full, and they only had med/surg and tele left.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose this hospital?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long ad expected. They really take time to choose the best  candidates to join their program. Be prepared to shoe off what you got and stay sharp
Interview Questions: Why did you go to nursing school

title: Supply Chain Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fresno, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied on website. Then waited one to two weeks for interview. then interview date was emailed and set.  you will get an email on how to do the interview through phone
Interview Questions: Asked about work history and experience.

title: Community Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and shortly after received invitation from HR to interview. During pandemic, interviewed via zoom with the manager. Week or two later invited to interview with the team.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super fast process.  I applied for the job on a weekend & interviewed on the next business day.  Two days later I had an offer that I accepted.  Recruiting staff was good about letting me know next steps & hiring manager and lead were very helpful in the process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when  you had a difficult patient.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Online application was quick and simple; text interview asked a few questions where you can select the answers; and for the video interview, you must answer questions through video. All are self-paced but there are deadlines.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself

title: Clinical Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
Terrible. Slow. Disappointing. Unprofessional. Frustrating. 

They use some "smart" candidate program so you have to video interview just to submit your application. So in total, I had four interviews over almost four months. Met the entire team in the final two interviews and some of people interviewing me weren't even in the same division! Seemed odd, especially when one person asked "so, sometimes we have to help each other out, even if we aren't on the same team...how do you feel about that?" Didn't hear back from the hiring manager that I wasn't selected until I asked, which was weeks after the final interview. What a letdown. Also, I asked for feedback TWICE (hello, I had FOUR interviews) and never heard back from the hiring manager. That was frustrating and just plain rude 

Sometime in late 2019-mid 2020, Providence has outsourced its HR and it is NOT good. Had three different "recruiters" on my hiring process and none were based in the US. Two never responded to emails at all. All sent template emails and the one who ended up scheduling one of my interviews had a major mistake in it.  Also, I was asked for FIVE references BEFORE even meeting the hiring manager! What kind of company asks that? Providence is not going to hire good candidates like this, that's for sure. There are a lot of competing health systems in the greater Seattle area with likely better hiring practices
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you made a mistake.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Online application was done first which consisted of behavioral questions. Online interview was arranged afterward and was fairly nice. They provided questions ahead of time so it helps to just prepare.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult coworker and how you handle conflict?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: HR Rep reached out for preliminary conversation, discussing "why you want to be a project manager", review of qualifications/experience and desired salary. Followed up by setting up a panel interview with the hiring manager and a couple SMEs.
Interview Questions: Have you ever developed a project plan; give one example. Personal strengths/weaknesses.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then about a week or two later there was a zoom interview that would usually be done in person, but this was during peak covid so it was over zoom. They asked about 5-7 questions and had about 3 people present to ask my questions. I can't remember the questions but I remember there was one specific question I had no idea how to answer.
Interview Questions: Did you like your clinical experience?

title: Data Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  I had to complete a self-paced video interview just to submit my application (7 questions). It is supposed to be very efficient but it is not (e.g. the interview system is not even connected to the job application, so you must upload your resume again).
Interview Questions: PSJH is a faith-based, not-for-profit organization.  We start our meetings with a prayer or reflection, and the sign of the cross is on our logo and openly displayed in and on our buildings.  We are a mission driven organization. Our five core values are Compassion, Dignity, Justice, Excellence, and Integrity.  How do our values align with yours?

title: Personal Nutrition Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Tarzana, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was a quick set of questions done through an online chat format.
The second interview was supposed to be a video interview but ended up being just a phone call with a lot if straight forward questions .
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was via recruiters. I applied online and after applying you get sent a link to answer a couple of automated questions and then after that you go through one more automated question interview. After they review it they do a video interview. It does take awhile over 2 weeks to hear something from them.
Interview Questions:
Q: Three strengths?
Q: Has a manager ever given you criticism and what was it?
Q: Talk about a bad experience with a previous customer/patient

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Missoula, MT) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initially things went fine.   People were very kind and interested.  The facility was great and seemed like a great place to work.  However, that changed when they made the offer.  $16.34 to start.  This is below the industry average and average for the state.  I asked that they take into account my prior medical field experience and the face that I hold two other certifications.  I asked that they reconsider.  I never heard back.  No email.  No phone call.  RUDE!  There are medical assistants in this town that make .50 more than their offer to start and these are people with little to now medical field experience and only one certification.  Their HR is horrible.  Their recruiters are not knowledgeable.   Lastly, when the recruiter called (not the hospital HR, it was an outside recruiter) she told me they would need my medical records.  I asked her if she meant proof of vaccinations and she said she didn't know.  I told her I was not releasing my entire medical records/history to an employer because there is no need for them to have access to my medical records.  She said she would have HR call me back.  They never did.
Interview Questions:
They wanted me to discuss a difficult situation at my prior job and how I handled it.

Why did I leave my prior joob.

title: Community Health Education Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Van Nuys, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Although they sent a link to a virtual interview room, the first interview was conducted by voice call only.   The Director of Community Health called and asked some questions.   The interview itself lasted for about 10 minutes but there was an interruption and lasted for about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions:
How many years of experience do you have as a health educator?
Have you served the underserved population?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an email to answer general questions once that was done I then received another email asking to have virtual interview and to select date and time the best suits you.  Once selected the send another email with link for the virtual interview.   I was interviewed by 2 person and asked General questions. Interview went fairly easy and quick.
Interview Questions: What mistake have you made in your job and how did you fix it?

title: Child Psychiatrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Smooth interview process, staff very welcoming. 

However, I was then hired for a part-time contract position, and the credentialing process has taken almost 6 months and has been extremely burdensome and frustrating.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First there was a text-interview. Then Providence emailed me with details of the interview and question examples. The video interview was short and covered almost all of the questions mentioned in the email. Hirer was very nice.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you organize your time on shift?

title: E R Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute zoom interview with 4 people. The following day an hour interview/ discussion with the lead social worker.  I was interviewed for the wrong position (although a similar position) despite not applying for the position I was interviewed for. All parties were unaware of this and thus I had to follow up with the phone interview. I don’t believe two interviews is the typical protocol.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to make a difficult decision but knew it was the right thing.

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed manager , 1 person interview. Lots of questions. Have stories for times you disagreed with supervisor,  or peer. How you handled hard to work with peer. 30 min interview. Discussed residency and department.
Interview Questions: what do you know about company

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Called in a for an interview. Never heard back after the interview whether I was accepted r not. Only found out online that is not been considered for the position
Interview Questions:
How do you manager projects?
Specific tools to manage peoples?

title: IS Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
The worst interview and recruitment system I ever had. A complete waste of time. Recruitment process is pretty bad. The recruiter are heartless and making the rejected candidates to wait 1 month just to get their rejection email. I am not even reach my final interview but they want me to wait. It would be better if the hiring manager say no, the recruiter send the rejection email right away so then the candidates can use their time well. 

I got a video interview, then a phone interview with hiring managers, they keep repeating the question, and it seems like it is not 2-way communication. They mute when I explain and not giving feedback towards my answer, if u wanna feedback u need to ask them.  

Providence please fix your recruitment.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Senior IT Position Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Did a video interview, then did a Zoom interview. 

Was told after the 2nd interview they would make a decision quickly. They never got back to me and their recruiters didn't respond at all to e-mail. 

This is basic courtesy to let potential skilled your decision. Providence is in Portland. A small community of IT people who you will likely see again.
Interview Questions: Various IT specific questions were asked.

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
1) First interview might be with a recruiter, either a recruiter from a third party agency or an internal recruiter from the organization’s human resources department. They often don’t understand the business analyst role as well as the hiring manager does and so may be looking for specific skills or other personality qualities.
2) Technical interview 
3) Onsite interview
Interview Questions:
1) Past experience.
2) Knowledge of SQL, python or other coding languages
3) Management experience
4) Familiarity with cloud infrastructure concepts

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Comfortable, selled job well offer made on the spot……. The shift ended up being completely different then what was offered……. A lot of false promises were made. Pretty desperate for help these days, like a lot of places.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for

title: Senior Editorial Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had to record myself answering questions that were timed. I was automatically emailed a request to speak to the hiring manager, but there were no slots available. In the meantime, they auto-sent 30 question surveys to all of my job references in my name. I had five video or phone interviews, one of which they asked me to call the personal cell phone of an upper mgmt leader that was in the middle of a move.
Interview Questions:
Are you a "doer"?
What was your senior thesis in college? 
What do you like to write about? 
How do you handle passive aggressive behavior?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: After filling out application I received email to answer a couple of general questions as to how I work with others and how I would handle certain situations.  then I got message to set up virtual interview.  Due to the pandemic I did a virtual interview with 2 managers.  It was easy going and they did not make me feel nervous.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient if they were to come in upset.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly easy interview process. very straight forward. there were 6 behavioral questions,  and 1 case study. make sure to have questions prepared to ask them at the end.
Interview Questions: why st. Joe hospital ?

title: Resident RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: After application I had to record a video introduction and give timed recorded responses to questions. Two weeks later they contacted me to set up the next video interview. It is a slow process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I had a couple text interviews and then was scheduled for a phone interview with the hiring manager.  I dialed in at the interview time and waited 20 minutes and they never showed up.  The only contact info I had was for the recruiter who finally got back to me a week after the scheduled interview and said that the hiring manager was cancelling the interview and would get back to me if they resumed interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to show compassion.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA)
Interview Descriptions: No one showed up to the live interview process, not sure where to go from here.  I was sent an email about my interview, I had arrived 10 mins prior and ended up waiting nearly 2 hours for nothing.
Interview Questions: interviewers did not show up on scheduled day

title: RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Nurse manager went over the brief job description, then asked about 5 typical RN residency interview questions. Then the manager asked further questions to match me with an appropriate floor.
Interview Questions: What made you want to work as a nurse?

title: Behavioral Health Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The staff I met with were incredibly personable and friendly.  The took time to get to know me and worked with me to find a good fit. The HR rep was very helpful in answering my questions.
Interview Questions: What was my experience working in the mental health field.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It was slow. there was little clarity on job description , requisition id, and the next steps. The interviewer was genuinely interested in the application process. But there was lack of coordination within the team.
Interview Questions: Explain Tableau dashboards you have worked on. Compare it to Power BI dashboards.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Screen call with recruiter, followed by structured panel interview, welcoming environment.  The recruiter followed up after the interview to debrief and talk about my experience. Described the next steps for the second round.  Offer was made by recruiter..
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you didn’t see eye to eye with your boss?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: After filling out the online application they will send a link for a video interview.  You have to record yourself answering various questions. After this step, they will contact you for an in person interview. Everyone was courteous and professional.
Interview Questions: Describe a clinical situation where you had to respond quickly to intervene.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview with a 3 person panel, behavior questions were asked along with an evaluation of a case study. About 30 minutes for the interview and they were very friendly!
Interview Questions: Why should you choose Providence

title: Senior Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional organization.  After submitting my application, I received a request for a self-paced interview.  A week after completing that, I received an invite for a video interview for the following week.  A day before this scheduled interview, I received a cancellation notice with no further information.  Two weeks later, I received a boilerplate rejection email.  A complete waste of time.
Interview Questions: What are some previous projects you worked on?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It was a pre-recorded video interview with maybe 5-6 videos you film and 3-4 types responses. You had unlimited chances to refilm your responses. Overall, it was pretty easy but it was a bit awkward.
Interview Questions: When was a time a patiently was rapidly declining and what did you do?

title: Clinical Dietitan Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: For this position, I filled out an application online before interviewed for about thirty minutes with the manager and one other employee. After the interview, I was informed of their decision in under one week.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you encountered a conflict in the work place?

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I completed a digital interview process by recording my responses to about a dozen questions, which took about 2-3  hours. I don't know how much they considered the video application - then interviewed with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: They asked about my breadth of experience. The thing that threw me off was that the posting said it was for a full time role. When I spoke to the hiring manager, they admitted that it was temporary position. That was very upsetting to me and contributed to my decision to not move forward.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was 30 minutes long, pleasant and low stress. Was conducted virtually due to Covid-19. I was offered a job within 48 hours of my interview. Couldn't have had a more positive experience!
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: NICU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked various questions. There were 3 people interviewing on an online call. The interview lasted about 20 minutes. I thought it went well, but as someone who has no previous experience, I did not "wow" them enough for a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Human Reaources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews with internal team, an additional 2 with the recruitment agency. The first 2 interviews were a mix with the team and Hiring Manager. The entire interview process was scheduled via zoom interview.
Interview Questions:
Give an example of a stressful situation you’ve overcome 
Do you have the ability to work autonomously?

title: Senior Revenue Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Starts with an online interview, and if you do well, then you move forward to face-to-face interviews.   Typically panels interviews.  Then you have to wait approximately 3 weeks before you hear anything back and as a current employee I have for feedback on my inteviews and have yet to receive any.
Interview Questions:
We have a busy time. 
Do you have a problem working more hours during the beginning of the month?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Tools months to finally get an interview that was online with 1 hiring manager and 2 nurses on the unit. Behavioral questions and questions regarding my past experiences were asked. They were all very nice and made me feel comfortable during the process.
Interview Questions: Favorite and least favorite thing about being a nurse?

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy-going and simple interview. Met with the hiring manager and felt very comfortable and easygoing. I enjoyed chatting during the interview and did not think the process was difficult at all.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and what would you do in a difficult situation ?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with HR as a general screen. After that I was recommended to interview with the nurse managers for the unit. There were behavioral questions, nursing situation questions, and a few questions that allowed the managers to get to know me more. At the end there was time for me to ask questions. Overall it was a smooth process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time a patient was not happy with the care they received and how did you handle the situation?

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
It was online iterview, regular project related questions.
It was an online test, asked everything about technical questions like  about SCD type and type 2 design,indirect file loading and dimension and fact table load details and once online test is cleared,there is one more round of technical interview with team lead and it is not so difficult,they mostly asked the same questions as they gave in online exam and some behavioural questions.
After that they gave an offer .This for contractor position .
Interview Questions: tell about  your current project

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Pre recorded interview on own time and given 1 week to respond. Set of questions provided and has about 10-12 questions.  Interview set up is easy. Waiting after interview can be long.
Interview Questions: Where did you have your capstone

title: Team Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Two in person interview with 4-5 people each time. It was basic questions as it was an internal position and they already knew what I was capable of. The position was not filled by me but a team member
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Video interview conducted online. Roughly 10 questions that were very open ended. Seemed a bit pointless, as video interview invites are automatic upon applying for the position. Just seemed like an initial screening step that was a waste of the interviewers time instead of having recruiters or HR personnel screen applications in a more traditional manner.
Interview Questions: Salary expectations are asked during a preliminary interview

title: Licensing and Credentialing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Total of three rounds with hiring manager and Director of the team about credentialing and licensing process and personality based questions along with collaborating team members with payor and contracts.
Interview Questions: What is the process of credentialing

title: IS Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: video questionnaire with you recording your answers . you get four attempts to record a good response to each question.  it was a series of 11 questions with two being fill in the blank
Interview Questions: are you a team player

title: Nursing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Petaluma, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: multiple zoom meetings, nearly 10 meetings total, met with nearly every stakeholder, many whom could not be bothered to have looked at my resume or learned my name, many times the interviewers were late, it was a very scattered and disappointing process since it took so long and it seemed my time or efforts were not appreciated or respected
Interview Questions: why do you want this position?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews 2 were over the phone and one in person. They were easy the first interview I had to record myself by answering some questions and the 2 interview was with the supervisor and the 3 interview was in person with the manager. I applied to this job in November 2020 and I just got hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Providence?

title: IS Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Kenmore, WA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Text interview through web site; then on demand interview though web site with video recordings responding to pre-recorded questions.  The process seemed to be okay during COVID.  I am still waiting for responses from the company
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Residence Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Providence (Paterson, NJ) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a meeting scheduled with the program director and a recruiting specialist.  They were very accommodating and scheduling was very flexible, and it was relatively easy to find a time that worked for all of us.
Interview Questions: What made me apply to St. Joseph's

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
The interview had many questions.
It was also a long process with multiple interviews.
They also included  phone interview
It also was a long hiring process.
Overall if you have good interview skills, have confidence, and are prepared it wasn't terrible.
Interview Questions: Please describe one weakness of yours and how you manage it.

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very smooth and proceeded in a timely manner. I was able to hear back from providence within a week.  The staff i interviewed with was kind and very informative, in a way that I was able to to better understand the environment of providence as well as my job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Was there a time a patients family member was not satisfied with your care?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, got a chance to meet all the leads for every shift. Got an idea of how the facility was ran prior to working there. Expectations were met once I worked on the floor
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you over other candidates?

title: Software Engineeer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard cold response. HR phone call asking questions about my experience and some behavioral scenarios. Some questions were oddly specific. Followed by next day rejection email with no info.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions about past experience.

title: Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First you’ll have to record a video interview and answer questions. Afterwards you’ll interview with the hiring manager and another person. If you’re moving forward you’ll get a call from HR.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this organization?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I first applied on their website and they sent me a invite to do a video interview with a present questions. After some time I received a live interview with 2 ppl in the panel. It was a very pleasant interview. There were two ppl that interviewed me and they were very polite and created a comfortable environment for the interview.
Interview Questions: Was there a time when a patient was not satisfied with your care?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was conducted as a self paced video interview. There didn't seem to be a time limit on when you had to complete it by, but you only had so many minutes for each of your answers and a limited number of times to re-record your answers. There was then written responses at the end.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about PSJH and why you're interested in our organization.  If you are a current caregiver, what do you enjoy most about working for PSJH?

title: Diagnostic Radiology Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: application- recruiter initial interview- hiring manager interview x 2- afterwards nothing but silence, no communication, follow up or feedback- wtf?!?! do they treat people worse after they’re hired? who would want to work here? Pwho does this?!?!
Interview Questions: standard scripted questions, totally by the book, unimaginative

title: Infection Preventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and straight forward. I had an initial self recorded interview submitted through a system run by the HR department. then moved to a virtual interview over Teams with the IP team.
Interview Questions: Q: From your previous work experience, what strengths do you think bring to the IP Team?

title: Transition Into Practice Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I like that I could record my own answers on my phone and then upload the videos. It took me roughly 2 hrs to record and upload my videos in total. It was total of 12 questions, some required videos and others required a type in answer.
Interview Questions:
Why did you become a RN?
Why are you interested in the Residency Program?
What experience do you have in the practice/ units/ clinical hours and floors you were on.
How did you learn about this position?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Savannah, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met with head of department to discuss job description and how my experience would benefit the position. Discussed benefits such as in-house health insurance, life insurance, and paid time off.
Interview Questions: Did you have any experience with budgets and AP at your former job?

title: IT Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The initial screen is not performed via phone.  Instead, they use an online video interview screening process where you record yourself answering various position-centric questions via recorded video.  While I have years of experience giving presentations to remote participants via video, I did not feel comfortable.  Actually, it was quite the opposite where I felt uncomfortable.  I believe my issue is that there is no actual person asking the questions and who, typically, would provide conversational queues as I answer the questions.  All-in-all, I found the experience unsettling.
Interview Questions: There were various questions that differed depending on the role.

title: Diversity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3rd part on-demand interview website riddled with coding errors. Made video load upside down. Finally fixed WEEKS later. Passed over despite stellar current credentials and just being published in the field. The person they hired instead quit in less than a week. Job reposted exactly a week later, with no education requirement this time at all, but only 8 years experience in writing health care initiatives.
Interview Questions: Very generic, almost as if they were written by a white person with no real clue of what Diversity means. As a member of a Jesuit parish and familiar with the Ignatian pedagogy, I added that into my answers, but none of the questions showed any real knowledge of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion beyond The Golden Rule.

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough on questions ranging from technological to social interaction.  Focused on how to serve customers and resolve issues.  Interested in how a person handles multiple tasks as well as meeting deadlines.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an individual that disagreed with you on a professional level?

title: Senior Manager Financial Planning and Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Applied and received email for video interview (Modern Hire- thought was spam)
Video interview 9Qx3mins - after 3rd attempt of  question 3 I decided if they cannot take 30 minutes to meet candidate it was indicative of treatment of employee likely.
They then state as application withdrawn - not sure who made the decision to offshore outsource interviews, but they should realize they are likely missing very valuable candidates
Think about interview treatment - it’s that important
Interview Questions: Why did you select this organization

title: Medical Facility Access Monitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at Indeed.com, got emailed to apply on the company site, had video interviews, and emailed a month later to finish the interview process. Had a recruited email me back.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work here??

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Oregon City, OR) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the residency program, did a virtual recorded interview immediately. 2 months later on Friday I received an email asking to schedule an email (automated). It was scheduled for Tuesday. Decision made on that Friday  via email.
Interview Questions: What 3 qualities do you look for in a job?

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
It was a 3 round process:
First, I did a phone interview with a recruiter. 
Then, I interviewed with the hiring manager and lead.
The last round was a meet and greet with the team.
Interview Questions: What's your overall full cycle recruiting experience?

title: Neurology Clinic Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The virtual screening interview process was efficient. I was given a link and was able to record myself answering questions with my laptop camera. The system allowed you to stop and re-record several times.
Interview Questions: How would you relate your previous background and skills to this position?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: First I had a 30 minute interview through the web and then an in person interview outside (due to covid) for about 45 minutes. And another call after that.  Overall it was a pretty normal process. I had to reschedule the last call due to an unknown reason on their part- overall wonderful people.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: So far so good.  I applied and after about a week was contacted for a self paced video interview. I enjoyed this process as it allowed me to review my answers and re-record if I flubbed or felt I left something out.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership/management style?

title: Senior Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: First submitted video interview followed by virtual interviews. A fair amount of recruiters involved, everyone I spoke to was very friendly. From start to finish the process can be long.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good. Quick. Know order of draw not just behavior questions like they tell you to prepare. I had to reach out to the recruiter after a week but they were nice and said I made it to the next round.
Interview Questions: How has previous experience shaped you for the job?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, interviewed virtually with about 6 management position interviewers.  They asked me about my previous experience and what I was familiar with technology wise. After the interview, it took about a week for Providence to reach out to me and offer me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where there was a misunderstanding and how did you handle it?

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It started with a Text interview followed by a video interview where you can record a limited number of times to answer your questions. Based on that they will contact you if you are chosen for an in person interview
Interview Questions: Strengthens, why you want the position, etc

title: Senior Clinical Integration Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: I first spoke with someone from the Talent Acquisition department who said she will set up a video interview for me with the hiring manager. I struggled with my webcam for a bit, but the process itself was smooth.
Interview Questions: Questions about experience in the specific role.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I had a Panel interview with three different managers of different units. It seemed like the interview went well and I really connected with the interviewees. At the end of the interview they told me I would be contacted soon and had to wait a week to hear back.
Interview Questions:
- strengths weakness
- why this hospital
- why this unit

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very judgemental and interviewed based on age.... She was tough but I felt like her intentions weren't for the best. I felt threatened and just the vibe wasn't there for me to work on the floor
Interview Questions:
Why this unit? 
Where do u see yourself in 5 years 
how much commitment do you have

title: New Grad Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First interview 30 minutes. If pass, second round includes two 45 minute interviews. One week before first interview, then one day between first round and second round.  Each interview consist of a panel of about 5.  Second round may be a group interview.
Interview Questions: Mostly Behavior Questions: Tell me a time when: involving patient safety, culture, customer service, change in patient condition

title: Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Disappointing process. This was for an interview at their foundation, Well Being Trust, for which candidates had to interview through the hospital. In total, I interviewed a total of 4 times. The final interview was with the leadership. After which, I was ghosted. A frustrating part of the process is you have about 3 different HR representatives emailing you to schedule interviews—making it confusing to know who to follow up with. The representatives also made frequent mistakes in scheduling the correct time or forwarding the correct conference links.
Interview Questions: Do you support the values of Providence St. Joseph?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phenomenal.  The interview was conducted by the managers of the departments I’d be supporting rather than a panel who wouldn’t oversee what I do.  I appreciated that they showed a vested interest in handpicking the right fit for their team.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this department?

title: Reimbursement Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening is done via the web, which consists of several questions. Depending on those responses the screening can be only 3 - 5 questions or as many as a dozen.
Interview Questions: Please describe your current job duties.

title: IT Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: You are asked to Record a video interview so an artificial intelligence applicant tracking system  can evaluate you before they have to bother a human with your application. Very impersonal.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself

title: ER REGISTAR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Hood River, OR) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone call by the team leader to informally chat and set up a panel Interview with the department manager, a couple of team members and an HR representative.  Felt like a group discussion not an interrogation.
