Interview Questions: Pretty basic questions such as tell us a time you had a conflict.  What are some of the more difficult problems you have encountered in past jobs?

title: Program Consultant Human Resources Strategic Initiatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: This was a very in-depth interview process. It began with a video interview with pre-populated questions where you record your answers. This was then followed by an interview with the manager over the phone followed up by a video group interview.
Interview Questions: What values do you identify most with.

title: Transition Into Practice Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Dixon, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with three nurse managers from different departments; behavioral questions and a scenario question; you had five minutes to answer the scenario and then you got to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were in an unsafe situation and how did you cope with it?

title: Principal Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: First there was a virtual video interview, then a low key, relaxed conversation with the hiring manager.  They asked questions about what I have done and why I want to work at Providence
Interview Questions: Standard situational questions. "Tell me about a time..."

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to do a phone interview with the recruiter who told me about the program and what is involved after asking some interview questions and at the end let me know that I would be moving forward in the process to have a video interview using Microsoft Teams. 
I had my video interview on a Friday and heard back from them on the following Monday.  The whole process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter saying that I was selected for an interview, it was conducted via video due to COVID. The hiring manager asked behavioral based interview questions to hear about examples i have encountered.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult patient

title: Preop/PACU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Met virtually with a panel of 3 management staff. Very friendly and welcoming. Asked me a series of questions and told me I would hear back within 1-2 weeks. When I didn't hear back after 3 weeks, I reached out to inquire if I was still being considered. They told me I was still being considered and they would get back to me but they never returned my calls/emails after that.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the position

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Just a few days after applying for this position I received an invitation to interview. It was an "on-demand" video interview, which I had never heard of before.  Basically, applicants are prompted to answer a series of questions using a video recording program. Applicants are given two attempts to record their responses and that is it. If you don't like your response on the second go around, then too bad.

I get that virtual interviewing is the new norm right now, but not having another person to interact with was horribly awkward. It wasn't a conversation but rather a rehearsed answer. Showing personality is hard enough in a virtual interview and this format makes it even more difficult. I'm not surprised I didn't get a call back for a second interview.  But honestly, I think it speaks volumes that Providence won't set aside thirty minutes to conduct a phone interview so it's probably for the best.
Interview Questions: The usual interview questions were asked, I wasn't surprised by any of them.

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Answered about 15 questions; 5 of them I had to record myself, the rest were typed. This was the first part of the interview process, the second interview is with a panel.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to be a registered nurse

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Because we’re in quarantine, St. Joseph allows a self paced interview. You have to record your self answering interview questions and submit your answers. There are 5 questions based on a call center environment.
Interview Questions: What is your idea of a call center? Why would you like to work in ours?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Within 3 seconds of submitting your resume and answering 3 very basic questions (education level, ability to work in US, 18 or older), you automatically receive a link to a video interview. It involves 11 questions.  If you prepare, do it right, it takes a couple of hours. I found the lack of scrutiny and demand to be highly disrespectful.
Interview Questions: Assessing KPI's, Management style, About yourself, experience, etc

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Fort Worth, TX) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done over the phone due to covid. The questions asked were basic and easy to answer. The interviewer was polite and easy to understand.  They just asked about my background, why I was interested in the company, then answered any questions I had.
Interview Questions: What do you think you would offer to our company.

title: End User Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received an email that I made it to the first interview within a couple of weeks. The first interview was pretty easy, record a video of yourself responding to questions up to 3 minutes per question and 3 chances to re-record each.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell us a little about yourself and why you want to work for Providence St. Joseph Health.

title: Medical Biller Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was placed through Ajilon, a local recruiting company. I attended an in-person interview with 2 hiring managers on 10/21/20. To date, they have not responded to the recruiter who set up the interview, and it's been 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: They interviewed in a style I can only describe as "90s" in that they had a set of questions printed out so that they asked identical questions to each candidate. There was some room to express one's sense of self, but it was very "ask then answer" formula.

title: Patient Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Apply on web site, do first interview via text, second interview via Video, then a rejection email afterwards.  I've applied for 15 positions in the last 6 Months and it's always the same, I don't know if these position exist or not.  I have 10 years plus experience in each of these positions in 2 different hospitals.
Interview Questions:
1. Have you every worked here before, how many years experience do you have.
2. Tell us a situation where you had a conflict with a co-worker and how you resolved it.
3. Tell us a difficult situation with a patient and how you resolve it.

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was to complete a one way interview answering a series of 11 questions.   Submitted the interview and did not hear back. Took approximately 1.5 hours. The technology was amazing and a very thorough process.
Interview Questions: Tell a time that you have worked with a difficult individual?

title: Home Health Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Contacted me the same day regarding the position I was applying for and scheduled a zoom/phone call meeting/screening. They were very professional, however did not answer all of my questions regarding the role.
Interview Questions: How would you collaborate with your team members?

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called and did a phone  interview. You’ll get an email from another recruiter to schedule interview for zoom video with the manager. You have the option to either do an audio only pr with video. I suggest you do the video since it is preferred
Interview Questions: When was the last time you have shown compassion?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was pretty straightforward. I got a call and was scheduled for a panel interview. There were only 3 people the day I interviewed: the manager, assistant manager, and nurse educator. Usually, they have more people during the panel interview.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time in your life when...
Why a Magnet hospital?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Multiple people asking questions in a group setting.  You are required to pass a background check and urine drug screen . No nicotine is allowed or they  will not hire you.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: They send you an On-Demand video interview and then call back for in person interviews. They ask a variety of questions and you have to record yourself answering those questions. For most of the questions they let you have 3 attempts to perfect your recording.
Interview Questions: They ask why you want to be a nurse

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, a recruiter reached out via email to schedule a Zoom interview with the Director. The interview with the Director was short, approximately 15 minutes. The interview consisted of about 5 straightforward, standard interview questions followed by a description of the job. Following the Zoom interview, I was again contacted by the recruiter to schedule an in-person interview. The in-person interview was a panel interview with various team members. It was approximately 1 hour long and I considered it difficult. Following the in-person panel, I received an email from the recruiter requesting a list of references (5, including 2 managers) to be notified electronically with a 28 question survey.
Interview Questions:
1. Why nursing? 
2. Strengths and weaknesses
3. How do you apply St. Joseph's Health System mission into your practice as a nurse? 
4. Describe a time you went above and beyond.
5. Describe a time when you had a challenging time with a coworker and how you handled it. 
6. Why did you apply for this position? 
7. What is something we don't know about you from looking at your resume? 
8. Are you bilingual? 
9. Your grandmother and best friend are in a car accident with you. Who do you save first and why? 
10. Describe a busy day at your current job.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was the initial video interview, hiring manager and  a group panel interview with potential colleagues and director. The questions are situational. They request for a reference check prior to the panel.
Interview Questions: Situational type questions, such as how would you handle or course correct if there was scope creep.

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: September TIP program. Applied, no decision, unfortunately. There was an online interview through the virtual process - recording necessary right after job submission. Questions need to be answered immediately right after starting the interview. Due date was not listed in any of Providence website so I assumed I have to take an interview right after job submission.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a nurse?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was like a conversation. The hiring manager was very nice and seemed to just get to know the employee. Make it simple conversation and it will get better as you continue with it.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself.

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Brea, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was via web such as zoom. It was very quick and to the point. Many questions asked were related to the situations in a call center and how one would handle or deal with the situation occurring.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a complicated individual?

title: Emergency Room Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Application process easy. Texting interview happened after application was submitted. Video conference interview was set up with the charge nurse.I’ll interview process was straightforward and easy tons of communication via email phone calls and text messages. Interview process was different than ones in the past. The hospital really cares about how you interact with staff, guests, and ancillary staff.
Interview Questions: Please describe to us a time when you have a bad or good interaction with a coworker. How did you handle this interaction with coworker. Was the outcome good or bad and tell us why..

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Bellingham, WA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received an email with reference request, must answer withing 24 hours or resets. Reference checked via email-  so must have emails of references. Calendar with various dates and times, to schedule an interview via video cam.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult surgeon or a tense procedure?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on Microsoft teams with 10 panelists from different specialties. My choice in regard to what specialties I wanted then determined who would ask me questions. Questions were generic interview questions. There was some technical difficulties.
Interview Questions: Why they should hire me

title: CRC I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initially the interview process starts with a phone interview. During this the ask you several introductory questions to learn more about your work experience and inform you to the job role they are looking to fill and its responsibilities. If you make it through this phase they bring you in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a group setting?

title: Janitor/Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview through a company called aero tek, pretty quick response and set interview set date. We interviewed through webex. Overall a good experience and good wage. I recommend this company
Interview Questions: Why do you think you'd be a good candidate for this position

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had the opportunity to take the On-Demand interview for New Grad ICU position at St Joseph’s Petaluma facility. The questions were very straightforward. 5 questions and multiple opportunities to re-record my answers.
Interview Questions: Why St Joseph? how i find out of the position? and why ICU interests me?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was selected for an on-demand interview. The process was pretty straight forward. You had to record yourself answering questions; It took about an hour. The questions were typical. I was a little awkward answering the questions and having no interaction with them. people.
Interview Questions: The first video recorded was an introduction of yourself.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, get a call from HR for screening, and HR set up an interview appointment with managers. It took about 30 min to complete the interview. they are very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why you choose providence Everett?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email with instruction about voice interview. Clicked the link and entered cell phone number, automatically called to my cell and answered questions. It took 30 minutes to complete with any flexible time
Interview Questions: Why did you choose providence?

title: Marketing and Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Prepare yourself. Three months, multiple interviews, they ask for references, they contact references, then a five-part written test (given 48 hours in the middle of the week to complete. ) Then the panel ....
Interview Questions: Do you collaborate well with others?

title: Supply Chain Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Interview questions were as expected; why do you want to work here? tell me about a time?

The interviewers were nice but hastily wanted to get through the process.   Overall it was easy, I was offered the job but declined as the pay was a lot lower than expected.
Interview Questions: How does your past experience qualify you for this postition?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Paterson, NJ) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with Human Resources. After interview with Human Resources , short interview with unit nurse. They were very informative about unit and hospital. Interview Lasted about 20 minutes. Thought it went well, but did not get an offer
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Missoula, MT) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy with no hassle and quick response times. Everything moved fluidly and worked well. Probably one of the easiest flowing interviews I have ever had. Multiple team leads involved in the process so expect that heading into it.
Interview Questions: Explain a time that you had a disagreement with a coworker and how you handled the situation.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Make sure you know the mission statement by heart and repeat it over and over if you really want this job (you don’t). What you know isn’t necessary. Heard the pay and management wasn’t great anyway.
Interview Questions: Mission statement mission statement lol

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I logged onto the call and the recruiter stood me up.  She did reschedule me for later in the week. They may outsource their talent aquisition over seas.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great, the recruiter really set me up for success. I wasn’t able to attend the first interview  beacuse my kids were home due to Covid. I ended up losing the first position but the recruiter called a week later with an even better location.
Interview Questions: What are your short and long term goals

title: Staff Nurse (RN), Oncology Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: After applying I received an email to provide an on demand interview which was a video recording of myself answering the given question prompts. After a week I received an email about a Zoom interview with the nurse hiring managers. After that , I received another email about Q and A from the nurse mangers of my desired units I had applied to
Interview Questions: Tell me what skills do you believe makes good customer service and tell me situation where you had to use those skills

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward; asking for your experience and availability. Running checks on candidate and guiding you through the in-processing steps. You will need a resume and references. There will be multiple steps in the process, so monitor your email and be available for calls when scheduled.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge at work that you overcame?

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds. First- Automated video interview, second- discussion with CHRO, third- discussion with VP HR. Questions were easy but they look for labor relations experience which I was lacking. Otherwise it's a good experience.
Interview Questions: Strategic role

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a panel interview. It was a great experience and I am so thankful for the opportunity. Some people ask more than one question and the other person did not ask any question.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 yrs goal?

title: PICU Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I did a "speed dating" type of interview. The managers from both PICU and pediatric med surg were there. They were very kind and warm. I enjoyed our conversation and left feeling like I would love to work for either of the managers.
Interview Questions: Why children?

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: On demand interview process was straight forward. There was a mix between typed interview questions as well as the ones where you’d to record yourself. They only allowed 45 seconds for thinking time but you had an unlimited amount of time to record your answer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become an RN?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was an on-demand interview followed by an interview with the recruitment team and if chosen you moved on to an interview with two units. It was a long process.
Interview Questions: Time you didn’t get along

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The online interview was great, easy to follow, and much better than the typical phone interview. Within about a week, heard back for an in-person via Microsoft Teams interview and by that evening for a second interview the following week. Have yet to hear back and no clear understanding as to when or how we will receive any follow-up information but was told we would hear even if it was a "no."
Interview Questions: Give a time when you went above and beyond?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Silver Spring, MD) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was smooth . very easy . don't have to worry . they ask just general questions . watch youtube learn answers  most of it is general . phone interview.  be brave nothing to worry
Interview Questions: why did you choose nursing profession

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Superior, WI) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Brief 30 min interview with talent consultant.  They set up a second interview that included  two managers and educational preceptor.  An HR worker called me back the same day with a job offer to begin in August.
Interview Questions: Why Providence?  What made you interested in nursing? Name one time specifically that you weren't able to complete all the tasks for a patient and what did you do about it?  Name one time specifically that a patient complained about the care they received and what did you do about it?

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds. First was a panel with mangers/educators from random units. If you moved on to the second round, is was a group interview with the unit manager for the unit you applied for. I personally didn't think this was an effective method. I think the individual interview should have been with the unit you applied for.
Interview Questions: -why St joseph, safety scenario, strengths

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was not awkward and the two people I spoke with were kind. Overall they asked great questions about myself and skill set. Not very many questions related to the company it self.
Interview Questions: How to I handle work conflict

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: email, then phone, then we had an in person interview. it took about an hour and basic interview questions. the manager and the lead interviewed and showed you around the unit. you get to ask them any questions you had and they ask you about your skill set
Interview Questions: why have you decided to work here

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Quicker and easier than expected. Applied online and had an interview set up within a few hours. The online application was fairly easy and pulled most of my information for me from my resume.
Interview Questions: Experience based and Physical requirements.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Didn't get to interview. I received an email, phone call and text message on 3/13. This was beyond pushy - to ask if I could jump on a call that minute to interview. I responded to the email and provided a few times that would work for me that week. Complete silence. 

Fast forward to March 25, I receive the exact same canned email asking if I could interview. Again, I respond with my availability and again complete silence. 

I understand we're in a crisis but I'd still expect a response.
Interview Questions: None

title: Internal Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The company's recruiter emailed me after receiving my application, saying she was "delighted to inform me" that I had been chosen for an interview and to let her know what times would work to schedule it. I responded with some times, and she never responded to set anything up. I followed up, but she ghosted me. I understand that things change, but a courtesy call to let me know would have been the professional thing to do.
Interview Questions: QShe asked for a time to schedule our phone interview.

title: End User Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: One virtual interview where you get questions on a screen and you reply by yourself while it records you and your answer and one face to face interview. If you pass the first 2 steps a few weeks later you receive an offer letter.
Interview Questions: How do you map a network drive

title: Certified Nursing Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were about 6 to 7 questions total. A lot of behavioral/tell me a time when questions, so be sure to have specific examples ready. The questions were more difficult compared to other hospitals I have interviewed at for a CNA 2 position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Data Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an hour phone interview with the team. They talked about Moda's mission and operations and asked me basic questions about my qualifications and some hypothetical situations. They also sent me a SQL test to be completed on my own time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you made a mistake in an analytics project and what you did to address it

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Overall very friendly but be prepared for a large panel- about 10-15 people interviewing you! There was also a video interview that you need to do after submitting your application.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why nursing?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Easy but took some time, definitely has a waiting process to it. But overall very easy. Nice people when I was interviewed, nothing bad to say at all about the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The nurses were amazing and made you feel comfortable. They were open and friendly, the experience was not as daunting as other interview procedures.  They genuinely engaged with you and were making jokes. It was a very good experience overall.
Interview Questions: What was a time where you saw something unsafe?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Video interview was very challenging. Then I had a 3-person  panel interview, then a small group interview.  Although the process is nerve wracking, it was also professional. I felt I was treated well.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult work relationship. Why do you want to leave your current situation. What parts of the job description would you find the most challenging.

title: Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application, a video interview, an in person panel interview, then an interview with a Director.  It took 4 weeks for them to contact me for an in person interview after submitting the application and video interview online.
Interview Questions: When was a time you disagreed with a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview to assess fit and availability via telephone by the pharmacy hiring manager. Asked very basic standard interview questions. The interviewer was friendly and interactive; it was a very pleasant process.
Interview Questions: About my schedule availability on a monthly basis.

title: Labor and Delivery Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple Video interview, zoom interview, then a few months wait to hear if I was accepted for the job. From time of apply to start time it was 6 months
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you encountered a difficult patient or family member?

title: Register Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Went very well, smoothy. Everyone was so kind. I was able to ask questions and get all my questions answered in timely manner. I will recommend this organization to my nursing friends. very positive attitude
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: End User Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Virtual process. Some questions appear on the screen you have a countdown and you answer the questions . If I properly remember you can record again if you didn't like your initially recording
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with Windows 10

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 stages to the interview and they were short questions, video interview, and a zoom interview. Pretty quick and friendly with easy questions. Seems like a good place to work at.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Received an invite for a video interview immediately after applying - got a call to an in person interview a few weeks later. I will be applying to all units at the same time.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about nursing?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Torrance, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, interviewed at LCOM Torrance. Applications were open for around 1-2 weeks. Interview was with a panel of 4 nurses (Unit manager, clinical specialist, and 2 floor nurses). Interviewers were nice but seemed tired (this was in the afternoon).
Interview Questions:
What would be your unit of choice? (written down on paper only).

Tell us about a time when you delivered excellent patient care/went above and beyond for a patient

Tell us about a time when something unexpected happened, and how you handled it.  

Tell us how you handle a culture different from your own

How would you handle a medication that you've never given it before 

Why Providence New Grad program (as opposed to other new grad programs)?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Administrative Assistant - position located in Milwaukie hospital. 

Two days after submission of the application, I have received generic message to do on-demand video interview. There has not been deadline set up, but reminder has been sent day later. After submitting on-demand video, confirmation on submission has been received by email as all previous communication was done. Few days later, application status through email has been sent.
Interview Questions:
There has been 11 interview questions (some had sub-questions or required examples of work situation). Some of them are:
What you know about Providence and why you are interested in our organization.  How do you relate to our mission? What is it about this position that appeals to you? How does your background align with this position? How you handle conflict; how you prioritize work; are you a team member or individual; give example of customer service,  etc. Pay expectations - dollar amount only.
Pretty straight forward and usual generic questions.

title: New Grad RN Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First had to complete an online interview, which wasn't bad. The next step was a panel interview with 5 interviewers. Each of them asked a question for a total of about 10 questions. the questions were general ones,
Interview Questions: Why St. Josephs, Ever had a difficult patient, name a time when your patients health was deteriorating and what course of action did you take?

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The first step of the interview process required an OnDemand video interview where candidate is required to answer specific questions through their computer web cam. The next step is a phone interview with the hiring manager and an in-person interview is scheduled if chosen to proceed to the next step.
Interview Questions: Give specific examples of a time that you provided excellence in your work or service.

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: there was first an online video interview. you have the chance to record your response multiple times. you then get selected to have an in person interview. in person, it is speed dating style. There are about 8-10 tables with 1-2 managers or educators from each floor or deparment. They ask the same questions at each table. 10 mins/ table.
Interview Questions: Why st. jude?

title: Transaction Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Philadelphia, PA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Nice people. Short interview. Easy job  seemed to be more in depth in the application but after arriving noticed it was a very entry level role. Would only recommend to new employees
Interview Questions: How can you help the team.

title: Senior HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Longer process with drug test. Very thorough though! They did a initial interview and went on to interview with managers and other team members. Once through you go do lots of paperwork and a drug test when offer accepted.
Interview Questions:
What is tour past experience? 
Have you worked within the scope of HR?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Video interview via email invitation. Passed that and was invited for an in person panel interview. Mostly behavioral questions. About 10-15 questions and additional follow up questions from panel. It was about an hour or longer interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had a disagreement with your boss, what was the situation, how did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
HR first emailed me an invitation linking me to an online text message conversation between you and the system to provide answers asking for most basic questions that consisted of 3 things: active CNA license, BLS, and are you capable of lifting objects of more than 20 pounds followed by yes or no questions. It gives you 48 hours to complete it but you can do it in 5 minutes. Thats not even the best joke out of this. 

The next day they send me another invitation for a "self-paced on-demand video interview" where you have 48 hours to complete 22 questions that have the most generic and bland questions you're practically reading off of your resume. I did this in January and it takes them 3 months to finally get a response! 3 months! 

Thankfully I applied to other jobs and got a better response and even got a PCA job at Hoag! Better pay too. Dont bother waiting for St Josephs response. Just apply to a better place that gives a damn about their employees.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about St Joseph Providence Health? 

What qualities are you looking for in your next organization? 

Please describe your first work experience and why you want to apply for this position. 

If given the job, what are your thoughts on the salary of $15.35 as a patient care assistant? (This one isnt the exact wording but it asked about your thoughts on the salary)

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions.  Not as difficult as you would expect.  Very nice overall. Usually a two-person interview.  Only the initial interview, most clinics do not need a second.
Interview Questions: Tell us about when you went above and beyond with customer service.

title: Per Diem RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Received a phone call from the company’s recruiter upon submission of my resume, and I have to be honest this was the WORSE first impression of a hospital organization I have ever had. And I’ve worked for quite a few. Her interview responses and questions were painfully scripted and dry. If she was trying to sell me the company she utterly failed. I had already received an offer from another reputable facility but was holding out for St. Joseph’s Napa location just because it was at the peak of my interest. However, five minutes into this call, I could not wait to get off the phone. 

She also asked for SPECIFIC start and SPECIFIC end dates. She was not satisfied with the fact I worked from August, 2015 until November 2019. She wanted an exact date and day. I’ve never ever ever been asked this, was so awkward. The per diem pay offered was also very bad.... I ended up emailing her the day after just thanking her and letting her know I was taking an offer elsewhere. But what I really wanted to say was that she left a horrible representation of her company. Someone really needs to reevaluate and train her.
Interview Questions: Can you give me SPECIFIC days of your start and end dates.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very long, not even over yet. It’s been 2 months and I have not been accepted nor rejected. It was a phone interview and then a panel interview. The panel was 6 people, all very nice.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a customer?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with HR that lasted about 30 minutes---with standard questions about experience and knowledge.  This was my second interview by phone; the first was screening and this one had more in-depth questions.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience working in long-term care and as an agency nurse.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The video and text review was very similar. Video interview was a recording of self. First question was introduction of yourself. Interview questions were simple. Text interview had similar questions.
Interview Questions:
Why we should hire you?
Would you be willing to work night shift?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the nurse manager and assistant nurse manager. They were both writing down my answers while I was answering their questions. It took about an hour and I was offered the job less than a month later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
To the point, short, interested in what I had to say                                                                                                    
Paitent and asked questions thouroghly
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict, and asked about various roles in past clinical experience

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: An online interview that took about 60 minutes. Link was sent to my email that I could do on my own time. Interview was recorded question by question. But you were given the chance to re-record each question
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer did not speak fluent English, got the impression they were not in this country, keep asking me to repeat what I stated clearly. Did not understand the concept of on the job training when mentioned.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in five years.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
I had submitted an online application for a physical therapist's opening in Vancouver, WA. I got an email from HR few weeks later to schedule an interview, to which I replied. The very next day, I got another email from HR stating that they had filled the position.

Obviously, the personnel who is/are handling this process either do not communicate with each other, do not know what's going on, or both.

Anyway, I will stay away from them in future after this not-so-pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: It was never scheduled

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Most of their interviews are first done as and on demand in a recorded video form. They ask questions and you record yourself answering them. They sometimes will follow up with a phone interview or only offer a phone interview for some clinics/positions
Interview Questions: Give a time you when above and beyond for a customer or co worker

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Monroe, WA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: i interviewed with 4 people who worked in different departments.  the clinic practice manager, a registered nurse, a certified medical assistant and a personal care representative.  we interviewed for about two hours.  each person asked me approximately ten questions apiece..
Interview Questions: if i am ok with a religious based company

title: RN Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Initial interview via online portal.  Nursing manager arranged for final FaceTime interview as I was out of state.  Nursing manager very kind and welcoming throughout interview - expressed ability to help staff grow in Providence system.
The offer was extended by a hiring recruiter.
Interview Questions: Are you OK with their values and mission?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview is quick and thorough. I was able to ask questions in a timely manner and met all the people I would be working with, which was very much more piece of mind.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have to complete the tasks

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Panel with 3-4 Interviewers 
They email you the same day if you move forth  
If you move forth then you get to meet with the managers of the top 2 units you chose
Interview Questions: Why St Joes, Difficult patient, cultural diversity

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First interview was via phone giving a general synopsis of the position, then  second interview was on site with 3 people in a conference room, going into more detail and asking me questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Enter the room with 4-6 other candidates to a room of 7 tables with 2-3 managers each.  

Answer same 6 questions on a list at table for each table, 10 minutes each table. 

Come back few hours later to do a case study 5-10 minutes long explaining concern, diagnosis, interventions, recommendations, and sbar
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for St Jude

title: Brand Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was probably the oddest screening process I have ever been through. I applied for the position over a month ago and got an immediate call back the next day when they left a voicemail on my phone. I called back and left a message, but never heard anything again. Fast forward a month and I get another call out of the blue from someone over seas. They really catch you off guard instead of scheduling interviews. At the beginning of the call, the interviewer asked if they could call me back in 1-2 minutes so they could find a quieter place... they didn’t call back for 45 more minutes! If you aren’t ready, why call? The “screening” interview took about an hour in which they asked very detailed questions, but couldn’t answer any of my own. In fact, some of the time they would even reject my question and say I could ask it later in the interview. It was very obvious there was a language barrier throughout as she would repeat back my answers and they were no where close to what I said. The interviewer also obviously did not review my resume, as they often misrepresented my work experience. One example is her thinking I had only worked for 1 company for 2 years and didn’t have enough experience, when I actually have listed over 6 years of experience across multiple positions/companies. Almost immediately after the phone call I got an email saying I wasn’t qualified for the position and they wouldn’t move forward. Just strange, overall, and I felt like I wasted my time interviewing.
Interview Questions: How long has it taken you to close a deal?

title: Clinical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online interview with both written word and video. it let you take as long as you want but the video only gave you two attempts to record. it was very easy but pay sucked
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about Providence St. Joseph Health and why you’re interested in joining our organization? 4000 Characters

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (West Seattle, WA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the whole interview process was very easy. The questions were mostly situational and very easy to make answers with. Then she gave me a tour of the facilities.
Interview Questions: Name a situation when you dealt with racism or someone with a different view or something.

title: Principal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Extensive and Very positive for allowing me to get to know the company fit as well as they to check my fit with them!  1.  Phone Interview  2.  Virtual Interview  3.  Case Study  4.  Virtual Interview by would be peers within team  5.  Site Interviews with Director/Sr. Director panel
Interview Questions: Tell me your experience with harmonizing training across different corporate cultures.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Houston, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: very informative and interesting as we did a tour upon discussing the job and the jobs qualification. the interviewer was very straight forward with me about what they needed and to not take the job if i felt like it would be temporary
Interview Questions: how would i handle certain situations in the department

title: Medical Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviewers and they switched off asking questions. They both wrote notes and there were about 15-20 questions in total. Overall they were both very professional and nice.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with electronic record management?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Providence included a recorded screening of three questions at the beginning of the interview process. All candidates received similar questions and the review committee then watched each of the top candidates answer the same few questions in a viewing, which then allowed them to narrow the field and select who to invite in for in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: Give an overview of your career.

title: Mobile Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic interview that consisted of coding as well as questions wrt mobile technology. The recruiter did not even bother to get back with an update. The recruiters are quite senseless and do not even have the courtesy to inform candidates about the outcome of the interview. Even in big companies like Microsoft, recruiters do come back with an update. I recommend not to give interview at this company as the recruiters are absolutely stupids and do not care about candidates. They should first fired from this company.
Interview Questions: Explain the mobile projects I worked on

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: First applied and then was contacted by a recruitment representative.  Started with a video interview where you answer a series of questions while being recorded, team interview, social and then received results of the interview and hiring process.
Interview Questions: Experience in Human Resources/area of focus?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: A pretty relaxed and comfortable interview more like a conversation. I had a tour of the hospital during the interview and was hired on the spot before I could sit back down.
Interview Questions: Questions on priorities within the hospital

title: Specialty Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to scheduling an interview. The interview was a week or so later. I was 15 minutes early and it lasted for about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Asked to share past experiences pertaining to different questions.

title: Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Had multiple rounds of phone interviews and one in-person interview.  The one  hour interview was based on negative questions on how a candidate's weaknesses would impact the work product and organization.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a single interview with a panel of 3 hiring managers for Med Surg. I applied online, and interviewed 3 weeks later. The interviewers were very pleasant. They asked mostly personality based questions.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.

Why did you choose nursing?

Tell us the mission and vision of the hospital?

What would be your unit of choice?

Tell us about a time when you delivered excellent patient care.

Tell us about a time when something unexpected happened, and how you handled it.

title: Scrum Master Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Very unprofessional.
Got verbal offer 3 weeks after initial interview. On a weekly basis, the company said they were putting an offer together and needed to get signoff through their process. SIX weeks later they "decided to go a different direction".
No apology for stringing me along. No other explanation.
Interview Questions: Give us a high level summary of your experience

title: Compliance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, there was an initial screening interview approximately 1 week after I applied. Then 1 month after that, I had a 3-person panel interview that lasted 1 hour. Finally, I had a director level 30 minute skype interview
Interview Questions: Please share with us a time when you disagreed with a decision made by your supervisor. How did you deal with this disagreement? What did you learn from the experience? What was the outcome of the experience?

title: Credentialing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process here requires an initial video portion when applying then if you get selected for an additional interview it requires meeting with 4 people from the team and the interview process is about 2 hours long.
Interview Questions: I was asked about a time where I did not get along with my manager.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a telephone interview with the promise of an in=person interview. Never happened. I had to follow up with the recruiter about 3 times. Finally received a call her the hiring manager. Left no voicemail or email. Contact the recruiter to verify who was calling and no response.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Financial Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online, very quickly (within 1 week) received an invitation for an online screening interview. It was an awkward, but I think overall positive process, even through I did not receive an offer.  I had to record my own answers on video without any re-dos, and answers were timed.  There was an opportunity to practice with a couple of questions.  It was a bit awkward because I could not watch the timer/see my face and look into the camera at the same time.  I think at least for my part, it was hard for me to act natural in front of a camera by myself.  In the end, I am not sure if I was not selected because of a skills mismatch, if they didn't like my answers, or because my video interview ended up looking weird :).   When I did not hear anything for 3-4 weeks, I figured they were not that interested, and sure enough I got an automated refusal email.
Interview Questions: 10 questions, about 4 written (unlimited time to respond), and 6 timed recorded questions online.  They were about why I think I qualify for being the director of financial operations, how this job would help me advance my career, and other standard questions.  One of the written questions was about who much I would like to be paid.

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and approximately three weeks later received a call for an interview.  The interview was done in a round table format, with several employees choosing from a list of pre-packaged questions for about 45 minutes.   About a week or so later I received a call for a second interview, which followed the same format.  I was told I would hear from them soon.  It was soon, but it was in the form of a vague voicemail from an HR recruiter based in another city that I'd never met.
    The whole process seemed unnecessarily drawn-out and over-the-top for such a simple position.  Candidates who go through the whole process in addition to their individual prep work should be extended the courtesy of a simple answer from someone present during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Simply run a general search for "administrative interview questions to ask" and you will find most of the questions asked in the first few results.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: About 4 weeks after applying I got an email for an online interview. Not long after that, they emailed me to schedule an in-person interview.  This interview was getting to see how I interacted with them and to tell me about the position. After the interveiw, they asked for my references. I did not get past this step because I accepted a different job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you struggled and what you did to overcome it.

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: first there was a video interview where you record yourself answering questions and then two in person interviews with three people asking questions. i was not hired so i dont have a hiring process
Interview Questions: describe a time when...

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to do a web-based interview within 24 hours of submitting my application. I was then asked to come in for an interview less than 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions using the STAR format.

title: Registered Nurse, Telemetry Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a panel of about 10-12 people. They each asked me a question and asked for scenarios. They scored me based on my answers. I applied online first and had a quick phone interview before they chose to call me for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you went above and beyond in your job?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very light on code but more of a conversational team discussion on problem solving. I believe the interview was absolutely best for senior devs rather than whiteboard and coding. More of a higher level discussion with architects and approach to a solution.
Interview Questions: Random questions on design pattern and architectural  devisions.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great online job board which allows the prospective hire to upload a resume, cover letter, letters of recommendation etc. And then as the application works through the process the job you applied for gets tagged with where your application is in the process
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse

title: Patient Financial Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It was short and to the point.  Interviewers were  very nice and personable.  The background process wasn't too long as well.  Overall the experience was very pleasant and exciting.
Interview Questions: What skills do you think will be and asset to the team.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was exposed to this interview through a recruiter. I was straight out of my medical assistant program and they handpicked individuals who were interested with the company. I met a the lead recruiter for about a 30min interview and got offered  a extern position right after.
Interview Questions: How is your time management skills?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call months after applying. THey did a phone screen then set up an interview.  I had to go do a drug screening and a physical before starting.
Interview Questions: What’s your ideal work environment?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was not intimidating and very easy.  The first interview was a panel, where each participant asked a question. The second interview was more of a career fair and very informal.
Interview Questions: How did you go above and beyond for a guest or patient?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and didnt hear back for about a month. First interview was a panel with 4 managers of various nursing departments, they asked very typical questions. That night I received an email to return the next day to meet with the manager of my desired units. We meet in a group interview and discussed the flow of the unit and we were allowed to ask questions. I heard back the following week.
Interview Questions: Why Saint Josephs/Nursing?

title: Compliance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I thought the interview process went great, panel of three people one was the department director, I didn’t get a rejection notice till 5 or 6 months later though which was really unprofessional to essentially never get back to a candidate that interviewed with the department’s director.
Interview Questions: All questions were in three part format eg tell us about a time where you had a compliance issue, how did you handle the situation and what was the outcome.

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Then submitted videos for online interview. Afterward I was contacted by a recruiter for a phone interview. Then did 2 in person interviews. One with the Clinic Supervisor and second with a Panel.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Providence

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first step in the process was recording video answers to about 10 basic questions via HireVue. Overall, this felt very impersonal, unnecessary and even a bit awkward. The next step was a 2:1 phone interview, but one of the interviewers couldn't make it due to something popping up. I felt like this interview went well and the interviewer implied that I would advance to the next round when I asked but I heard nothing, even after following-up with the recruiter--no response. After several weeks, I received an automated rejection email. Overall, I thought the process was very unprofessional and I was unimpressed.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment are you most proud of? We are a faith-based organization, how do you feel about all meetings opening with a prayer?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: lengthy process. Had to interview with multiple different people. Full day. Started with a phone screen with the recruiter and eventually I ended up with a full day in-person panel discussion.
Interview Questions: How are you a fit for Providence

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Professional in all questions asked and presented. Interview process was smooth and without any problems. Was giving circumstances on how to answer questions and gave answers to the best of my knowledge.
Interview Questions: What are my current duties at my present location.

title: Advance Practice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: initial phone interview with recruiter then phone interview with two corporate directors from the region and local manager. Not very professional. i was originally applying to two different positions and that's what they told me the interview was for,  so during the phone conference i was focused on the position that i liked the most. But it was very clear by their responses that i wasn't even being considered for it, it made for some confusion on my part and put me at a disadvantage for the rest of the interview
Interview Questions: behavioral type questions: tell me a time where u handle conflict with a co-worker etc.

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: in-person interview and they asked about strengths and weaknesses. Personal experiences with patient care and the most difficult patient I had in previous work. Also, why should the employer hire you?
Interview Questions: what was the most difficult patient?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted remotely using a video platform. Questions were provided in advance and recorded. The questions were not technical in nature, but it was very helpful to practice.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process has been smooth so far with the status of "review" on my application for over 2 weeks before I received a follow up email from the recruiter asking for more details.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this role?
Why are you looking to make a career change at this time?
What hours are you available to work?

title: HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was contacted for a phone interview that ended up being  the strangest and worst interview I had during  job search. She asked the same question over and over again, truly bizarre.  I  have been asked this question in numerous interviews and  always moved on to the next question but I really can't describe what was going on.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Typical recruiter screening by phone first, which was very thorough, then phone screening with hiring manager, followed by in person interview with hiring manager and other colleagues in office who would be peers.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging employee relations issue you’ve handled

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Streamlined and easy, already a Providence employee so it was an internal review. Had a straightforward set of questions- strengths and weaknesses. Be prepared to discuss difficult and strong times in your career
Interview Questions: Discuss how you managed a difficult situation? What are your strengths, what are your weaknesses?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview conducted today with HR and in-person tomorrow with department manager/supervisor. I submitted my references today as part of the process, which has been quick up to this point.
Interview Questions: What challenges have you faced in your profession?

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a video Interview followed that take about 1 hour to completed. There were 13 questions for video interview. I got an email for an In person interview week later. The in person interview was   with 1 manager, 1 supervisor and a lead.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Senior Employment Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Millersville, MD) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was fluid, and pleasant, I felt comfortable in my surroundings. I had to wait for a bit, but given the type of work that is done it us understandable. Our people always com first.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and two in person interviews. Online career website keeps you up to date as your application is being processed. Background check and UA will be required if job offer is extended.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous experience with Epic?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
They start with the HireVue online interview, then send you an email to let you  know if you have moved on to the next step. 
Pros: practice questions (4) and unlimited practice time; easy to set up; convenient; can have notes, but you want to look into the camera and act like it's a person. 
Cons: if you don't like doing videos, then this isn't going to be fun.
Interview Questions: How did you find out about the job and what prompted  you to apply?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Through and positive interview process. Three person interview whom cover different registrar positions in the hospital. Very friendly staff & management.  Most welcoming interview that I have had in the medical field.
Interview Questions: Past medical experience

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview/screening with lead recruiter to determine fit and if you met the required qualifications. Next, the recruiter sent a link for a Digital Interview with 10 behavioral-type questions. And last was an in person interview with 4-5 people including the hiring manager, lead pharmacist, and 2 support staff. All employees were very friendly and they set you up for success.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you made a mistake and how did you fix it and avoid it for future.

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Rosa, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: They made it brief but just wanted to make sure you knew where you wanted to be and that you had some knowledge already background coming in. I think they were fair and it was more a conversation than an interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer on this unit?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Fresno, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed over the phone first.  They asked questions to understand my core values.  They then scheduled an interview in person and a case study session.  The entire process took 3 weeks.  I heard back from the interview in 2 days.
Interview Questions: Some of the questions included: "why do you want to work here" and "If you encountered an unsafe practice from a peer, what would you do about it"?

title: Cash Applications Specialist Interview
