Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Liberty Lake, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then had a phone interview. Set up an in person, on site interview. In person interview was with two people. Asked basic job related questions, and asked some behavior related questions.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in a female dominant office before?

title: ER Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxing and enjoyable. Interviewers were very nice and easy to talk with. They were really interested in getting to know me. Very relaxed process. Even gave me directions back to the parking garage and walked me out.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what things have you done, how much do you enjoy your job, what is your favorite things about your job. What do you enjoy doing in your spare time. What is your preference in shifts. Can you work any days.

title: RN Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Snohomish, WA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted about a week after applying where a recruiter sent me a list of questions to fill out online and email back to her for the hiring managers to review. After this, I talked on the phone with the recruiter who asked a couple questions about my goals and what interested me in the position. Once everything looked good, we scheduled an in person interview that took place about a week and a half later. I had my interview in front of 5 different people who took turns asking me questions. My interview was about 45 minutes. I was contacted the next day with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you achieved excellence in your life.

title: Staff RN I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, emailed by company for one way video interview. 20 questions (mixed with interview questions and how you heard about the job), 1 hour long. If video interview is passed, will be invited for in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why St Joseph?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was an online recorded video interview. Your prompts were written and you had about a minute to think of your answer before the system began to record you and your answer. Some questions wanted a written out response. The second interview was onsite with the National Communications team. We met in a small room for less than an hour.
Interview Questions: They asked how I select which tasks to accomplish if I know I have too many on my to do list before the day is over.

title: Nocturnist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was laid back, easy going, and very open. I was initially contacted by the hiring director and with the assistant of their hiring coordinator, I was scheduled 2 interviews, one with a Board of Director and one with the hiring director for the hospitalist group. They were very quick about responding back and replied back with their offer within one week of last interview.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my education, and experience in residency

title: New Grad RN (TIP Program) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in early January and received a call from a recruiter in February who did a brief phone screen and scheduled me for an interview. The interview was the BEST interview I have EVER attended. I met with 5 managers/clinical directors/educators and they were the nicest people ever. They all had very positive attitudes and amazing personalities which made me feel comfortable. We all connected really well and even laughed together a few times throughout the interview. I enjoyed our conversation so much that I didn’t want to stop talking to them! I was offered the position 2 days later.
Interview Questions: Can you give us a time where you went above and beyond?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and chill. We talked about experience and we over the unit. She introduced me to staff on the unit and explained the expectations of my job and asked if I could handle it.
Interview Questions: How would St. Peters Hospital benefit from having me apart of the team?

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It took only almost twenty minutes. Ask you about your past work  experience as CLS. Expected salary. Why do you want to work in providence. Expected salary. What shift do you prefer to work. Are you willing to be on variable shift? Also discuss me the rate. The schedule of shift.
Interview Questions: Experience as CLS

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I reside out of state, so I initially reached out to a current employee and then I was contacted by HR and followed up with a phone interview. I then followed up with a video interview.
Interview Questions: What exams do you feel most comfortable in?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Had a great, in depth interview with HR and then was slated to interview with the manager but that didn’t come to fruition. The HR person was super helpful and communicative. Past that, I didn’t hear much though I did receive a decline email. Kind people and I would apply again.
Interview Questions: Goals, understanding of organization, past experience.

title: Social Influencer Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple rounds of interviews, between Portland and Seattle. I have to say, the team at PSJH was nothing but amazing. I had an amazing experience and have nothing but positive things to say about each interviewer. The organization as a whole is going in a great direction and the marketing team is really focused on innovation. In particular, the Executive Director of Marketing was exceptionally hand-on during the process and was always great about providing feedback along the way. That is very rare in today’s job market and something this organization should be proud of!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be apart of this organization?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. It took about 30 minutes. Their questions were very straight forward and I never felt like I had to put my guard up. I was happy with how the interview was conducted.
Interview Questions: What is my biggest weakness

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviewing process.  You'll interview with the department manager and two of the top techs. Very laid back. Manager takes a very long time to respond to those that apply and interview.
Interview Questions:
Behavioral questions. What would you do during busy times. How would you handle being overwhelmed. 
Example: Doing portables throughout the hospital how would you prioritize the Texans that you are given? Stat exams over routine.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to answer questions with safety concerns, medications, and critical thinking. It is intimidating but not impossible, just be honest. If you don’t know the answer, say-I don’t know the answer just yet, but if given the opportunity, I would like to learn.
Interview Questions: 1. What are your strengths? 2. What would you do with a patient_______?

title: Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Everyone I spoke with during the process was friendly and professional. I decided to not pursue this opportunity any further since the position that I applied for paid less than my current position.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, shortly after received a phone call interview in december 2019. the phone call interview was mainly about what you are about and why you would want to work at st judes.  No clinical questions were asked during the phone call interview
Interview Questions: what can you contribute to the hospital

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and personal interview, recruiter was excellent and considerate. In person interview was standard. Be prepared to describe past experiences and education, also how you are good fit for the company.
Interview Questions: Tell us your experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Paterson, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit a resume. I waited for over a month. I called them a few times asking about status of resume. They finally  called me for Video Conference interview and an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What is my greatest strengths?

title: Hospital Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 4-5 other pharmacists.  Although they had mostly never worked the shift I was being hired for (....) they were senior pharmacist sin the dept.  They really wanted to to focus on either clinical experience or co-worker relationships.  If you have answers ready for all of the "what if" scenarios you will be fine.  Obviously - strengths and weaknesses will be discussed....
Interview Questions: Lots of questions about "how would you or how did you" RE conflict or stress

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy- I had three interviews. Providence has recruiters that contact you to schedule your interviews. Although the process was lengthy (about a month) the people that I interacted with along the process were all very nice.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my ability to cope/deal with an acute inpatient setting

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by recruiter; submitted to an online interview program; called by principal; and informed I wasn't selected via email. 

Overall,  it wasn't too bad, but one would imagine that a company which prides itself on having an amazing mission and is in the business of helping people would be so sterile in its hiring process (i.e. emails, online video interviews, email rejection). I received two phone calls - one from the recruiter and one from the very harried hiring manager.  Would not recommend.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to this role?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Online video interview, then in person interview with three people. Waiting to hear back now and it has been four weeks.  They responded back quickly at first but after the in person interview, you get to wait for weeks before hearing back from them. The last I heard from them was regarding information related to my references but I have not heard from them since. Hard to tell if I will get the job or not.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you and a manager had a conflict and how did you resolve it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Overall I had a very positive interview experience. Process was fairly quick compared to other jobs I’ve had. HR phone screen and communication through the process was excellent. 1:1 interview with manager and RN.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you used problem-solving skills.

title: Travel Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Conducted over the phone, very informative after interviewing process was complete. The interviewer made me feel very comfortable, and verbalized their needs and expectations for staff nurses. The interviewer verbalized the patient demographic, as well as, culture in the ED.
Interview Questions: What was a time you felt like you went above and beyond for a patient or family?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application for RN Residency program. The next day, was sent an e-mail to complete HireVue video interview which took around 1-2 hours to complete. Given a question, time to formulate and answer, and one chance to video record your response. Informed Providence would reach out by phone or e-mail with application updates.
Interview Questions: Name your top 3 choices for residency.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, lasted about 20 minutes.  HR questions are the norm..."Tell me about a difficult situation and how you handled it"?  HR member was short, snide and incompetent.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Doctor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Telephone was very easy going when they called. They asked questions as to what my best qualities were, reviewed my resume, etc and also asked where I would be willing to work if they did have any positions.
Interview Questions: What are some of your assets?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: They begin with a phone screen before they have an in person interview. During the phone screen they give you a little history about the company. After the HR representative of a specific region speaks to you they then pass it on to the hiring manager. If you are selected they then will contact you for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What procedures have I assisted in before

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had two rounds of phone screens and then one in person interview. The first phone screen was with the recruiter which went very well. The second interview was with the hiring manager and a would-be peer. The in person interview Iwas told would be with the hiring manager but turned out to be with the peer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict.

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Before I had my in person interview, I had to answer many questions (verbally and written). I received a phone call two days later asking for an in person interview. We read the expectations and job description together. I took my typing test, then they asked me four or five questions. They were super nice and made me feel right at home!
Interview Questions: What has been my busiest day at work? Where was it, why was it so busy, how I handled it, etc?

title: Childcare Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (West Seattle, WA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: After the first initial phone screening, I set up an in person interview. Very relaxed interviewing process, I felt very comfortable talking with the manager and director. I was nervous going into the interview, but they immediately made me feel comfortable and asked questions in a very casual conversational way.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had conflict with a co worker and how you resolved the conflict

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to do an online interview and was given a link to do it on HireVue. You are given 3 business days to complete the interview. Once on HireVue, there's an introduction to the digital interview process by Providence. Before you start the actual digital interview, there are a couple of practice questions to help you get used to doing a digital interview. You can do the practice questions as long as you'd like. You can start the actual interview once you are ready.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with registering and admitting patients?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The phone screen with the interviewer was bad.  They were scatter-brained and not a good listener. They subtly criticized, shamed, blamed, and lectured me for having jobs that didn't last long enough to their liking. They also implied that I was not someone who wants a job for the long term.  Needless to say, there was no invitation for an on-site interview, which is fine by me. However, they ended up doing me a favor because based on the way they treated me, I certainly would not want to work for them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Awesome management, open and welcoming.  This is a Catholic organization, values aligned with helping the community, most of the upper management is Catholic and provide history of the start of St Joseph sisters during 1st week of orientation. HR is disorganized.
Interview Questions: What is your personal professional goal?

title: RN Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, waited about 2-3 wk before hearing from a recruiter. Had a follow-up phone interview with the recruiter, and then was notified the next day or 2 regarding an in-person interview, which was scheduled about 3 weeks later.  The interview was for a med-surg. position, so representatives from various units were in the room- I think there were 5 people total.
Interview Questions: Why did you pick nursing?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to the office for a  10-person panel interview.  There were many behavioral questions. Be prepared to discuss many instances of when something went wrong in your previous position and what you learned from it.
Interview Questions: We have crucifixes on the walls and moments of silence before meetings. How do you feel about this?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen with a recruiter. He stated that he will update me by x day on when the in person interview will be for the following week. Did not notify me by x day. I followed up consistently, and was told to hang tight because the nursing manager was not sure of his schedule yet. Told a couple weeks later, the position has been filled without going into interview. I thought this whole process was super unprofessional. Why bother trying to schedule if you arent going to in the first place?
Interview Questions: Why St. Joseph?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening to see if you values and culture, hiring manager interview, drug test that included blood and urine and then a physical. The process is very lengthy and might take two months.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed at Digital Innovation Group division.

Interview process took around 4 months. I went to a couple of recruiting events to meet employees, expressed my interest to potential hiring managers, engaged with a recruiter. Passed a phone screen, then was invited for an in person group interview once position became actually open. Recruiter communication was not timely and clear throughout the process. After the final interview, I received no response at all. Not even a canned rejection email.

Interview questions were sometimes odd. For example, I was asked a question that should be answered with an explanation of an OSI network layer model. How is it relevant to a supposedly software development PM role? Not that I don't know the answer, I just don't see a connection to the work that was described to me.

Interviewers were friendly. I did not have much time to ask questions of my own. Recruiter instructed me before the interview to answer exactly the questions asked, so I stayed on that course, perhaps foolishly. The questions were often framed in such a way that answering in such a way did not showcase my relevant skills. For example, a question how I user certain things 'at my last workplace'. 'Last workplace' lasted less than a year, which is not too relevant compared to a 20-year professional experience. 

Interview took from 10am to 4pm, and included a lunch with two program managers. I had to reveal my dietary preferences to the recruiter, which in hindsight I wish I did not do: these preferences may be interpreted as a symptom of diabetes, and could have led to a negative decision. It's just my preference to stay fit, nothing would happened if I had pasta once in a year.
Interview Questions: What happens when a user clicks on a web form?

title: Food Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: In the interview I sat down with the manager and an assistant manager. They seemed genuinely interested in me as a person and the atmosphere was relaxed. I was asked a variety of questions but was not rushed to answer any of them.
Interview Questions: Describe one time in the past when you were presented with a challenge. Describe how you overcame it.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Hard interview, 1/2 interview, presentation required, team was really nice, provided tour, better have your situational stories ready. Have lots of questions for the team ready and seem enthused. Overall, tough interview, but great team.
Interview Questions: Many conflict stories

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was contacted a few weeks after my application for a phone to phone interview. I passed the phone interview, then was scheduled for a one on one with Director of the unit.
Interview Questions: The patient load is too heavy, what do you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview in the conference room, simple questions.  Mostly friendly staff that have been with the unit greater than one year. Unit manager, charge nurse, aide and a registered nurse. Lasted approximately half an hour.
Interview Questions: How do you embody the pillars and mission of the hospital.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Columbia, SC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Very organized. No confusion with the date and time and location of interview.  Interviewer was very respectful and not so harsh.  Interview was very professional. Interview only last fifteen minutes
Interview Questions: How many years of patient access have you worked?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Bartlesville, OK) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed for a Phone interview and received a call back for second interview within two weeks of each other, interview is scheduled for the next week. Ladies I spoke with were very nice. Not intimidating or snobby at all.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was long and disorganized. Recruiter didn't call at specified time. Second phone interview was overly personal on part of the interviewer--I knew more about her than the job at the end of it. Third and supposedly last multi-hour panel interview was followed by multiple other interviews. 
Across the board everyone talked a lot about Providence being caring and mission driven but not one person I asked was able to tell me about any actual service or program that showed this--they all fell back on repeating advertising copy, talking about their personal experiences and feelings, or quoting scripture. Seriously. 
Basically I think I kept getting called back until they finally figured out I wasn't Catholic--at which point I was told I wasn't "a good fit" for the job. Which, as I'm no fan of bigotry and treating patients like cattle, is a true statement.
Interview Questions: "Abortion doesn't exist at Providence. You won't have a problem with that, will you?"

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Completed online application, was emailed within a week to complete online interview throught Hirevue, after a week or so I was contacted via email to come in for an inperson interview. I was interviewed by the manager of the department and the hiring manager, the hiring manager was rude (would randomly stop asking interview questions and would  turn around and start answering emails) so it made my interview awkward and uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went over and beyond for a customer

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email to have an over the phone interview. The recruiter missed my phone interview 3 times. She also didn't know the time of the interview that I had for in person so I moved on.
Interview Questions: Why Providence Hospital?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very short and simple. It was more to know my personality more than anything else. They did not really ask anything too intrusive and I felt like they cared which was the most important factor for me.
Interview Questions: Didn't really have any questions in particular except do you have family here in Torrance or a reason to stay.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Liberty Lake, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Standard phone interview,  recruiter was engaged during the conversation.  Answered all my questions about the position, was very positive  I received a call the next day to schedule an in person interview which was scheduled for the next week.  Interview panel consisted of 3 members, hiring manager, another supervisor,  and a trainer.  Strange and unwelcoming interview, interviewers were not engaged, couldn't be less interested in anything I had to say.  The experience was  very uncomfortable and I was glad to leave the room.  I was not surprised that I didn't receive an offer, but I was surprised by the radio silence.  Not even a courtesy "thanks but no thanks" email.  I've heard great things about the company, but I was not impressed by the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Standard

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Brief; depends on hiring mgr and group. The first interview will be done thru HireVue, which is a video that is sent prior to getting an in person interview. They will either do a panel or multiple on site.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screen followed by e-interview. The phone screen was to inform about the position and schedule. E-interview consisted of 5 questions. Fairly standard questions and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Providence?

title: Specialty Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: A telephone interview, followed by an in person panel interview with 10 members of the team.  A pre-selected question list was provided to the panel, which was then followed by any questions by the members of the panel if they wished.  I was able to speak at length regarding my previous work history and also ask about the company during the interview. It was a little nerve-wracking to have so many people on the panel, but they were welcoming and kind.
Interview Questions: An example of a time when I handled a patient complaint.

title: Contract Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I am a current employee looking for a different direction, I completed a Video interview do not know if this will proceed to the next level yet as I don't know how long the process takes
Interview Questions: 1.  What motivates you?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview.  It was very professional and good.  They were very pleasant and the questions were not difficult.  I am scheduled for an in person interview next.  I have not been offered the job yet.  I am very hopeful.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work all shifts?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the online application in the middle of March and didn't hear back from them until about mid April. Once I heard back from them that I was selected to interview I only had a few days to prepare. It was a video interview that I could do whenever and it was fairly easy. I just had to record myself and I had unlimited time to prepare my answers.
Interview Questions: What is the most important aspect to you in selecting a residency program?

title: Speech Language Pathology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with a rep and scheduled a follow up interview. Pretty straight forward initial interview that took about 15 minutes over the phone. It got a late start, but the rep was very friendly and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got an email the next day to schedule a phone interview with the recruitment staff. Very thorough questions. Next is supposed to be a phone interview with the hiring manager. The recruitment staff said it could take 2 weeks before they call me and to contact them if I haven't heard from the hiring department so they could follow up. I contacted the recruitment staff, and she didn't even respond to my email. I didn't even receive a rejection email.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Coder I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled for 7 am on Monday. It was a group interview of 6 people. Everyone asked different behavioral questions. The interviewers were benevolent and the process looked like they like me. But it was a delusion and already 2 hours after the interview  I got a rejection and position was closed.  Then opened in the next day new but the with the same name and same location. Seems interviewers knew were not going hire me before I came.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to be in your career five years from now?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 5 people, each taking turns asking questions . After you accept their offer, the ore hire process is the most time consuming. So be prepared for that.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a mistake you made at work and how did you overcome it?

title: Administrative Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based STAR system. Basically how you handle difficult situations and the outcome of your decision. It takes about an hour and several people interview you at once. It can be very intimidating.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to decide between two important tasks and what you did.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence (West Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I was told by interviewer they would call me me in two weeks. It never got done. I went over interviewers head and got the job.  Interviewer had an odor that made me sick and her hair was greasy and dirty and she had a nasty disposition.
Interview Questions: Can I be called on a particular day?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had applied countless times directly to this local organization and never received even the slightest feedback despite meeting or exceeding nearly all their requested qualifications.  Not a single word.  I had pretty much given hope, but finally, one day, a recruiter that they hired in Massachusetts set up an interview with me to discuss an analyst role I was excited about.  The recruiter was cordial but ultimately also never received any feedback from Providence other than a vague, "We didn't feel it would be a good fit".  Which could mean anything, really.  Very disappointing.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a messy data set?

title: Compliance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Irvine, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: A video interview, then two weeks later an in-person interview plus writing case history brief and then I heard never nothing. Not heard a single word, not an email or a phone call. I contacted the recruiter - nothing. This lack of consideration and respect for candidates tells me volumes about this organization. For a group of people who are focused on spiritual values in their mission statement and include the phrase 'God's Love' in their career section, they have a long way to go in living out those values in their day to day professional duties. Not every candidate will be selected, but at the very least, give them the dignity of closure.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work history

title: UMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
With interviewer, typical questions, I had a great time speaking about my experience  and skills.  There were 2 interviewers in the room and each had a list of questions.
After two weeks, I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience

title: SICU Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The application was online, and my interview was scheduled through their nurse recruiter. My nurse recruiter scheduled the interviews, and let me know where to go and who to look for. Then, I went to the unit I would be interviewing at and was in a one-on-one interview with each unit's nurse manager.
Interview Questions: When was a time you faced conflict in the workplace?

title: Registered Nurse I (New Grad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 8 weeks. I applied online via their website. Was contacted a week later for a phone interview, then didnt hear back for a month, meanwhile I reached out twice and was told to sit tight, basically.  4  weeks after my phone interview I was contacted for an interview, then was offered a position one week after the interview.
Interview Questions: What does cultural competence mean to you?

title: Pre-Visit Planning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Bangor, ME) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Manpower, then with the new Supervisor of this pilot program at St Joseph Hospital in Bangor Maine who is developing this Pre-Visiting Planning Department with 20 new employees to get patients registered prior to being seemed by their providers.
Interview Questions: Familiarity with computers, working independently, customer service experience.

title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: At providence, I had a panel interview with 2 managers. It was not a lot of hard questions, just the basic common ones that everyone asks. I think it went great.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: From the time of application to the phone screening it took about 3 days. Then I had my phone screen scheduled for a couple days out. Once I finished my phone screen it took about a week to hear if I landed an in person interview. Once I had the interview  it took about another week to learn that I got the job offer. All the staff from recruitment forward were kind and all communicated well, letting you know exactly what to expect and what is expected of you.
Interview Questions: Why St.Josephs hospital?

title: Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online Application that is extensive in your education and work history, also some personal questions. But is easy to apply for more than one position as it saves your answers
Interview Questions: Referrals and situational analysis

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and got a callback and scheduled a phone interview within a week.  The phone interview was straightforward.  They're very open-minded and value your opinion when it comes to the interview. 

The only thing was I was told I would get a callback whether or not I was going to move forward but I never did.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Billing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview and it was horrible what happened to face to face anymore tired of robots it was horribly awkward recording myself and it was event a good way to portray myself don't feel like I got a fair shot
Interview Questions: What was one time you  had an issue at work that you had to resolve and how did you resolve it. Why would you be good for this position. Do these hours work for you all generic question I had to record answers for I'm not an actor I don't do well recording so this was not a fair shot to present myself.

title: RN Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The first interview consisted of a video interview followed up with a secondary in-person interview if you were selected to move on to the next step of the process.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you had a patient with a deteriorating condition or health status

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen, took about 1 hr.  (Contract role)

Began with general discussion about the project(s), asked questions about existing infrastructure. 

Notable questions:
What were some mistakes I made, that broke something
What was the most challenging project I worked on
Interview Questions: What were some mistakes I made, that broke something

title: Front Office Scheduling Coordinator - Specialty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1st step after application is an email from the recruiting department asking for a 30 min phone interview. I completed the phone interview and it was very positive, as my skills, experience and background with this company stood out to the recruiter and she shared rather enthusiastically that she thought I'd be an excellent fit and would forward my resume on to the hiring manager. Almost a week went by so I emailed to follow up, a different recruiter responded and let me know the manager wanted to schedule an in person interview, they also sent me a link to where I could enter 5 (at least) references they could reach out to, all 5 of my references were from Providence, and these individuals have given great and positive reviews and references for me in the past (did not seem to make a difference)- I scheduled the in person interview for later the same week, the recruiter did the scheduling and sent me a confirmation email with the time and location of the interview and who I would be meeting with. When I got to the interview early and checked in, the lady at the front desk said they had just been asking about me and then the clinic manager and supervisor came and got me right away. I was given a detailed run down of the job description and duties and the kind of team member they were looking for. There were 4 people interviewing me. They took turn asking questions. Their main focus was on compassion since the specialty clinics serve cancer patients. One of the negative points of the interview was one of the interviewers first questions to me was aggressive and confrontational (in tone) "You were late to the interview today, can you explain why that was?" I was early to the interview and they thought I was late. They thought it was at 2pm, but the recruiter scheduled and sent confirmation for 2:30pm (I arrived at 2:10pm). I just answered with that the interview was at 2:30 and I have confirmed with the recruiter. I knew I was not late or wrong so I did not get defensive or snap back, I just simply stated what was. I didn't really even get an apology for that, I still felt like they thought I was wrong somehow. For a clinic that stresses compassion I did not get the sense that anyone in that room was treating me as such during the process. Interviewing did seem to end abruptly, and energy in the room at the end definitely left me feeling as I would not be called back. 3 days after interview I was called by yet a 3rd different recruiter and was left a message that they were moving forward with different candidates.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time when you showed/demonstrated compassion, what did you do/say?
Tell us about a time when you dealt with a difficult customer/situation - how did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: ER ADMITTING Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Was called for an interview one week later. Met with 2 ER supervisors. Easily answered all questions. Maybe I was too confident or have too much experience,
Interview Questions: All the usual. Greatest strength, greatest weakness, hipaa, emtala. Availability, etc.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was given as a phone screen for a position on the float pool unit. It was on the phone with human resources and it had to do with telling me about the position and what it entails or what would be required of me and then asked me about four basic questions about the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do think that the Float Pool would be a good fit for you?

title: IS Customer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: A single panel non-technical interview with several Supervisors setup via Sr. Recruiter and Recruiting Coordinator. The process took weeks prior to the 1 hour interview. The interview itself took less than an hour only to be told that I’m over qualified. Because of this I was left wondering why couldn’t the hiring manager figure that I was over qualified just by reading my resume?
Interview Questions: Several role-play scenarios depicted by each Supervisor. All non-technical instances.  One in particular was “I heard about this thing called a PBJ sandwich. Can you walk me through how to make one?”

title: Surgery Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was an initial phone interview by a representative in the HR Department. Resumes are then forwarded to the hiring manager and the applicant should expect to hear back within a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Providence?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. A recruiter called me approximately one week after I had applied. The phone call from the recruiter served as candidate screening as I was asked around 3 questions pertaining to dealing with stressful environments as well as how I deal with conflict. After answering the questions, I was offered an on-site interview with an RN manager, RN educator, and Charge RN. In person interview was straight forward. Was offered the position within the week and accepted.
Interview Questions:
- A time where there was conflict with a colleague and how the situation was dealt with. 
- 3 words my peers would give to describe me
- Time where I took initiative to advocate for a patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed via hirevue twice. It's a video interview, where you record yourself with your webcam, 8-12 times questions. Then I interviewed again in person with the nurse manager. She said she'd get back to me by the end of the week. She didn't. I eventually got an automated rejection email. I felt like after spending over a month interviewing, a personal email was in order. Especially since I spent my senior practicum on the unit.
Interview Questions: What was your hardest job?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter after online application.  Set up face to face. Interview failed to accurately describe the job. Offered the job a day later. The interview was typical with the company generated questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you didn’t get along and how did you resolve it.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Hirevue interview process was fairly easy, definitely different from anything I have every experienced. Wished there would have been a phone interview as well to answer questions I had about the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had bad experience with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Informal. Went in was basically offered the job and then when told to check back she said oh we went another way. Very unprofessional as the interviewer was unwilling to give any negative feedback about her department. Even though there is always room to improve any where you go and for her not to know that put a bad taste in my mouth
Interview Questions: What makes you want cardiac

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Walla Walla, WA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple but nerve-racking! Apply and wait for response....i got a response within 2 days and was invited to do an online interview through hue view. They gave me 7 questions to answer. Basic questions. But oh my word if you are not used to recording yourself on video then you're in for it!!!! Nah but its ok once you take the practice questions. Thank goodness!!
Interview Questions: What are your short and long term goals?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Hood River, OR) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people, interview was friendly and comfortable. Onboarding process does take a while, but other than that it was a seamless process. First for a phone interview to see if I was a good fit, then I was called in for an in-person.
Interview Questions:
Any experience in the field?
What aspects can you bring to the team?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Too many steps in the interview process. First you have a phone interview and then to see if you meet the qualifications of the job.  The basic job interview question. It was not hard at all.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is slow, you do not get any feedback, just an email saying thanks for your submission.  It takes a LONG time just to get a position and the interview is really slow.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to handle a difficult family member and what did you do?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Eureka, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted on LinkedIn by an outside recruiter with a general message. We connected and arranged a time to speak by phone. 
Our call was on a Wednesday morning, and it seemed to go well. The recruiter stated that she'd like to show my resume to the HR Manager and would contact me Thursday or Friday. I asked if she needed a cover letter and she declined. 
Two Thursdays and Fridays have passed and I never heard back. I assume they weren't interested, and that's okay. 
The communication prior to the interview was solid and quite flexible, however, the lack of communication since the interview was disappointing.
Interview Questions: Have you done benefits?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was 30 -40mins,  very good interesting with the panel and I .I was interviewed by three ladies. They all ask me questions alternately, after interview was completed I was given a your of facility, they say that someone will contact me within two to three business day whether I am accepted or not... They did
Interview Questions: Tell me about myself

title: AR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: 4 managers around a table. Simple questions, fairly brief.  I applied online and about a week later I was contacted for an interview.   They have 3 buildings in Portland, so be sure to know which one you are going to Pop1, Pop2,Pop3. They are walking distance from one another, but it totally throws your game off if you are waiting in the wrong one and have to hustle to a different one while they are waiting on you.
Interview Questions:
Do you have medical coding experience.  
Tell me of an time you went above and beyond for a customer?

title: Behavioral Health Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Cty Spok Val, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I spent over an hour in the interview process. I was told that the behavioral was secondary to home health RN, which is not how the job presented on the job site. I was asked availability for training, talked extensively about the job, skills review in Renton for a week, and was told that they would have the recruiter contact me for a " ride along" with another RN to see if I would be interested in the job. I was under the impression, as stated in the interview, I would be contacted for a ride a long the following Tuesday. Left feeling great about getting this far. I left, did some errands and headed home. I checked my email after I arrived home and saw that the recruitment team had sent me a "Thank you for applying" but was not chosen.  The time on this email was within 15 mins of me leaving the interview. I thought maybe there was a misunderstanding, so I called and left a message with the recruiter, that I was to have a ride a long, and did not know if it was a mistake. I did not hear back, so I emailed recruiter as well, then left another message. I understand and respect that they changed their minds about me within 10 mins of walking out the door, but I wanted to make sure that there was not a mistake and I was truly suppose to be scheduled for a ride a long with another RN. I was perplexed. The two messages I left and the email was rudely disregarded. I shared this with my cohorts and they were appalled that a recruiter would not be kind enough to call me back, or email. I was an internal candidate. How do they treat external candidates.  So Julia Lodge, I hope you get this email and realize that you were not professional and just plain rude. This is my review for Providence Health and Services, Spokane Valley, WA.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when I was presented with a difficult task and how I handled that task.

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
A phone interview was conducted with the HR talent manager.  He then set up interview with education department.
Interview with education department - director, manager, and other educators.  If they feel you are a fit for the organization they recommend you to the director of the specialty unit.
Then interview with specialty unit director, managers, nurses,
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing to work at Providence?

title: HR Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: One virtual interview. It was a little awkward because it is one sided and you are talking to yourself. The questions are timed so you only have so much time to respond.
Interview Questions: How do you best prioitize your time

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. It was very basic. They found me online through LinkedIn and emailed me to set up the interview. They were quick to reply but changed the interview time multiple times.
Interview Questions: Why work here?

title: PTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in front of panel of three. They asked a series of questions regarding my experience in the field and to draw specific examples for each. The interview ended in more of an open discussion where I had the opportunity to ask questions I might have.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a position in this particular setting?

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Had 4 interviews in order to meet the whole team. Was told I had it, then was given to someone else due to a provider having second thoughts about me being a new supervisor with multiple clinics.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Met with two managers and the director of finance. Ask me standard behavioral questions. They were all nice and helpful in helping me understand the scope of the position. They came off as a company that cared about seeing it's employees succeed.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a disagreement with a.manager and how you handled it.

title: Cls Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applying for jobs on their website . HR call to screen first. Going to interview with panel of 4 managers. Asking more then 10 questions in about 1 hour . After that need to provide them 5 professional references . 2 must be from previous supervisors.
Interview Questions: Tell them about yourself

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Waco, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview and the talent acquisition interviewer was very pleasant. The questions were practical and mostly about fitting in with the Providence team. Didn't ask technical questions concerning phlebotomy other than education and experience.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself fitting in to our team and organization?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Remote, OR) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Immediate repky to application requesting a video interview. Logged in and used exercises to prepare. Clear instruction and easy to use. Never heard back so this was actually a detriment to getting to present to an employer.
Interview Questions: An example of creative problem solving.

title: PAs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process; I was interviewed in person by two managers. They were great to interview with the setting was comfortable and the questions asked were great questions. Overall the interview process was quick comfortable and filled with smiles.
Interview Questions: knowledge in Medical Insurance Coverage

title: Ambulatory Surgery Scheduler and Special Projects Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First every person I came encounter with was so kind and personable. I felt like I was having a conversation during the interview. They question were asked so fluidly I almost forgot it's an interview. I can tell the Nurse director is a strong leader and am really looking forward to working with them.
Interview Questions: What made me interested in this opinion.

title: Externship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick interview with the department, after an initial video interview. Met with the department heads for a quick sit down, review of position, and then went over scheduling and any conflicts.
Interview Questions: core values of providence

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was met in the department lobby by the department chief, who would not be my direct supervisor. I was given a brief rundown of the position and asked some boilerplate questions. I was then taken to the office of the person who would be my direct supervisor. I expected a tag-team interview, but the department head seems to be satisfied with minimal information on perspective employees. It was disconcerting at the time, but made sense later on. That person rarely interacts with techs beyond the level of "hi, how was your weekend?" The Tech supervisor asked more in-depth questions, but seemed more concerned with personality than prior experience.
Interview Questions: Literary genre preference.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Well first of all, give yourself an extra 20 minutes on upon arriving to the hospital because you will be lost. I showed up unfortunately 5 minutes before the interview. But I'm kind of glad because I wasn't nervous because I didn't have time to sit and be nervous. I was brought back immediately, the supervisor of the lab is very friendly, she makes you feel comfortable. We jumped into the interview fairly quickly, the questions were easy for the most part. Just lots of questions. You'll be there for a good 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What made you leave your job?

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was a nice and relaxed interview. I had met the lady interviewing me once at a football game which made it less stressful and personable.  She asked me personal questions about myself and we spoke about her for awhile and she made one of my first interviews a great learning experience.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for?

title: Senior Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Had the usual phone screens and in person interviews loops. Phone screens and in person went great. Follow up from them was severely lacking. Was told I would have a decision with a week. Even after following up, they never got back.
   If you make it to an in person interviews, a company really should have the courtesy of proving some communication in status.
Interview Questions: what's your experience with marketing

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone screening.  Videotape/online screening.  Background checks.  Drug test.  Personal interview with panel of 6 other persons.  At the beginning of the process I had a lengthy telephone conversation with a departmental assistant supervisor.
Interview Questions: How would you fit into this team at this day clinic?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. I met with Nurse Manager and Assistant Nurse Manager. The interview was approximately and hours long.  I also received a tour as well after the interview. An offer was given by the week.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had conflicts with a coworker and how did you handle it.

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
panel interview with nursing manager and unit employee with job seekers so that they can know what to expect from the hiring process. very thorough and really care about what you think is the patient experience. Good co workers, friendly environment
Cons
Interview Questions: what made you pick nursing

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. Coding Challenge
2. Phone Screen
3. On-site

Overall, this so called digital innovation group (DIG) appears to be a 3rd rate development shop ran by rejects from top companies in the Seattle area. The compensation level will reflect this fact.
Interview Questions: Very easy coding challenge followed by random questions on MVC, delegates, design patterns. Essentially, whatever comes to the mind of obviously unprepared and unprofessional interviewer.

title: Financial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short and concise, the manager asked about my previous experience and then had a senior member of the team ask me more technical questions. Overall, very smooth and I received a verbal offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: What animal would you choose and why?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: After wasting my time between numerous nurse recruiters from Providence (they don't even work in Spokane) I gave up. Everyone just told me to keep applying online, I'm an RN and I have experience, I took a job elsewhere after becoming frustrated with the process. They don't need nurses that badly.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for?

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First was a 30 min phone call then I had a face to face interview with two PTs that lasted about an hour and a half.

I first filled out the online application. Then I was asked to complete an online interview consisting of questions that I had to answer into my laptop camera with a predetermined time limit. Then I had a 30 min phone interview with a recruiter and once I got past that I had a panel interview with two PTs. Overall the process was pretty long but I felt my interviews went well and I thought I connected with the PTs I interviewed with.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult patient or co-worker?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (San Pedro, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with team leader who described the programs in the hospital.  A background check was required and the HR department was very helpful.  The interview process was professional and the contacts were all helpful in guiding me through.
Interview Questions: How do you envision yourself serving in this environment.

title: Human Resources Client Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a phone screening and I was later invited to come in for a face to face interview. During the face to face interview we discussed the amount of growth that Provedince has sustained just recently.
Interview Questions: What did I know about the position?

title: Patient Dining Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call few days later. Had a phone interview, then got called for an in person interview. The got a job offer all within 2 weeks. Quick, easy, fast process.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Providence?

title: Collections Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Austin, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: company contacted me for an interview, scheduled for morning. interview was one to one with Accounts receivable manager in conference room. was a good interview felt more like a conversation rather than traditional question and answer.
Interview Questions: experience, have I ever performed collections before

title: Critical Care Float Pool RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Kenai, AK) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted by the recruiter to set up a phone interview with the hiring manager for the float pool. She called and we talked very casually for a few minutes and felt at ease. Then she asked a couple job related questions and she offered me the position.
Interview Questions: How much experience in each type of ICU had I had in the past.

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a video interview with Hirevue online, which took about 45 min to complete. It had both video responses and essay responses. You were given the question and given about 30 seconds to prepare your response and then given 3 minutes to actually respond. The essay questions gave you unlimited writing space.
Interview Questions: Describe a fight you got into with your boss or supervisor. The essay questions were things like 'how many words can you type a minute'.

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on the Providence website and got an email from Talent Acquisition within 2-3 weeks. After that email, I had a phone interview. I passed that phone interview and got an in-person interview at a clinic.
Interview Questions: Compassion is kindness and empathy towards others. Tell me about a time when you showed compassion towards another.

title: Senior Software Engineer II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Similar to Amazon - interview loop with  5 or 6 people, 3 of whom were technical. Specific questions on values, teamwork etc. Technical questions include typical problem solving and interview about former projects with details.
Interview Questions: Sketch an architecture of multi-user chat system, describe potential difficulties, tools used, etc.

title: Patient Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was rushed by employer. Was told the job would be temp to perm when it was not. Was promised that this would be a temp to hire position when it was not.
Interview Questions: The asked about my computer skills and patient scheduling skills

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Lacey, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted initially for part of Family medicine over phone. Got through over the phone interview and set up a normal interview at the location. Interview went well received call that I didn’t get the job but was informed of another posting going up shortly that the management team would like me to apply for for a position in internal medicine.
Interview Questions: The one questions I honestly couldn’t answer was, “when was one time that you messed up?” I’m pretty new to the whole interviewing process so I wasn’t honestly ready for that

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
submitted the online application and waited about ten daays.    It was a 2 step process with  a phone interview and then a video online  follow-up set up on your own time
.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a upset and difficult client

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone interview (30 minutes) and one in-person interview (60 minutes). Included skill-based “describe how you would…” questions, with the expectation to hear detailed, specific end-to-end answers covering basics and higher-end skills. Also fit-based “how would you handle…” questions.
Interview Questions: If there was no budget process in place, describe in detail how you would set up a process.

title: Software Engineer (Digital Innovation Group) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter, who had me apply via a 1-2 hour online coding test (provided by a third party). I solved the problems correctly, according to the provided test cases and my own, and took the time to document my solutions via comments. However, I never heard anything from Providence or the recruiter after this, which, combined with the automated interview, gives the impression that they don't care about candidates' time.
Interview Questions: Find the shortest distance between two points from a provided array of 2D coordinates.

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: They sent me a link for a video interview and it was uncomfortable.  I did not have a webcam at home so had to do this interview in a public space.  Also I feel that this process allows Providence to discriminate candidates without them ever knowing
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflicts between coworkers?

title: Crisis Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my qualifications, training and volunteerism for Thurston/Mason County Crisis Clinic on Providence Psychiatric Hospital job search engine. Was called for an interview same day. I thought the interview went great, but I was not called back.
Interview Questions: What would I do in a triage situation with 5 patients

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard corporate process. Three part process that started with an email requesting an phone interview. Then a phone call was received to schedule an in-person panel interview. I had an  interview with Management and then several weeks later I received an offer.
Interview Questions: What projects have I led? My positon wasn't a project specific

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview consist of 9 nurses and 2 doctors.  Of the individuals on the panel: 1 nurse, was the Director of both Case Management and Utilization Management, and the Cheif Officer of St. Jude at the time.
Interview Questions: When I was interviewed, there were a panel of nurses to ask questions abuot the my leadership style.  The Director was sphereheading the review, as well as the Supervisor at that time.  The questions were to direct my attention to a staff which was very channeling to other former Directors and Supervisors.  They needed someone whom was well rounded yet firm.  They felt that I would provide good leadership which would allow a better working environment. The Doctor and Director whom I interviewed with, felt that I was well rounded and that my knowledge about  the work was excellent.  They recieved feedback from my former employer based on a leadership position as a Director of both Case Managment and Utilization Management. The interview was both written and verbal questions for someone in a leadership role.

title: Leadership Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was hands down the worst, most unprofessional interview process of my 12+ year career to date. I drove all around town for panel interviews, team interviews, 1:1 interviews, and after 10+ interviews and SIX MONTHS of back and forth, I have literally not heard one single word. Leadership should be respectful of people's time and energy. I am employed and it took a great deal of energy and effort to prepare and attend 10+ interviews with 20+ people. The very least you can do is reply to one of my emails asking for a status update or return a simple phone call.
