The process ate up 6 months of job seeking time and I am astonished at the lack of communication and unprofessionalism that permeates across all of the leadership team.
Interview Questions: Too many to list. 6 months, 10 interviews with 20+ people.

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on Providence website with resume and within 3 days i had a request for video interview.  Video interview had to be done i. 3 days and answer 5 questions
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you gave outstanding customer service

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 or 4 staff going around the table asking questions. Questions were varied and not all of the staff had any input for the position.  Hiring manager was among the group. Sometimes I asked clarifying questions as some of the questions were not 100% clear on what they were looking for.  Everyone was nice and the interview started on time.  Introductions were done and some casual talk at first to make you feel comfortable as they knew that interviewing was a bit nerve racking.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and logical questions asking about your experiences and what if questions.  Ask about strengths and weaknesses.

title: Senior Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very respectful and knowledgeable employees. Deep dive into technical architecture and operations. Key aspects of redundancy and disaster recovery. Highly recommend taking an interview.Very respectful and knowledgeable employees. Deep dive into technical architecture and operations. Key aspects of redundancy and disaster recovery. Highly recommend taking an interview.
Interview Questions: How does load balance fundamentals work?

title: Business Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. They hiring manager was very direct about expectations. The team answered all my questions. The salary was lower than I expected (compared to my current company).
Interview Questions: If you could buy a billboard with a message, where would you put it and what would your message be?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Research the company culture and values. Give good examples about your experience and background.  Some managers use the STAR method. They mostly look for if you are a good cultural fit.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for our company.

title: Customer Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I had two separate interviews with different people each time.  Initially, I was not selected but was told there might be a second position opening up in the same location in a few months.  I was asked if I would still be interested.  I told them I would be.  And later, I received the call and was hired shortly after that.
Interview Questions: My experiences with dealing with people face to face and especially those who may be difficult.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Its a very long and lengthy hiring process and orientation is 2 days long for 8 hours each. Then you had to sit in class for about 3 days to learn the computer system. After that you have about 3 weeks of training in clinic.
Interview Questions: What does working as a medical receptionist look like?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and professional. Took about 2 months from application. A couple phone interviews, then Skype-like interview, then in person interview. Both the hiring manager and recruiter stayed in touch every step of the way.
Interview Questions: Behavior-based.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by an HR Representative, then by the Department Manager, and then an interview was scheduled. The interview was a panel of 5 employees and lasted about an hour. After the panel interview I had another phone conversation with the department manager. The process then moved back to HR for references check and an offer.
Interview Questions: Take us through your resume to highlight professional and educational experience that relates to this position.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview and they were very professional but also efficient with their questions. 2 staff nurses and two managers interviewed me.  Questions were average difficulty, a lot of behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Radiology Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Waco, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was swift and to the point and I conducted it on the weekend which was great because I am busy during the week. The question was ok and there was not a trick question and if you are taking a test
Interview Questions: When can I start because i wanted to start the following week.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Missoula, MT) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring takes about a month from job offer to orientation. You must pass a background check, you will have 48 hours to pass a drug screening, health screening (i.e TB negative), and have all of your immunizations.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with seeing patients while they are vulnerable - i.e hooked to machines, breathing tubes, under medicinal influence, etc.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Hood River, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I met with the main supervisor first and answered questions. Then 3 of the staff came in and asked questions and wrote down my answers. I was able to ask them any questions and it made it feel more casual. Nice staff. The recruiter called me right after the interview and said they would extend an offer Monday. It was Friday when I went in. Over all the process in general is long. Took a month before i could start, during the wait i submitted and waited for background checks and drug testing to go through. I look forward to working there.
Interview Questions: They ask me why I felt I'd be a good candidate for the position.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter contacted me about my application and set up an interview with a panel which consisted of the manager, the director of the unit, the educator and one of the charge nurses from the day shift. They scheduled another interview a week later with charge nurses from the night and day shift. I'm still waiting for another possible interview with the rest of the staff. I have heard from a friend that the hiring process is long and drawn out. I'm keeping this in mind especially since the recruiter told them I had another offer. I am hoping that they either give me an offer or another interview because it seems like a nice place to work. It seems like a tight knit community who care about the work they do and everyone was friendly and professional as I walked through the unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself..Give an example of when you had a conflict between yourself and a supervisor/patient/family member/doctor. How did you handle it?

title: Athletic Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Face-to-face interview where the job was explained to me. I also got a tour of the facility. I got to meet the other staff athletic trainers and have them tell me about their day-to-day work life. I got to speak to the hiring manager. I got to ask questions. I was told that the position would be full-time but that it would not be benefitted. The salary offered was very low considering the amount of hours expected to be worked were high.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to travel

title: Senior Software Engineering Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through their website and was emailed by the recruiter for an initial call within a week or so after applying. 

The recruiter asked me about my experience with the startup I started, team size, etc. Other questions were about my previous experiences. Despite having a few senior roles as well as a co-founder of a modest startup with 16+ years of software experience and under, and 2 masters in computer science, I was told that I was a better fit for a senior software engineer role. 

I had to decline furthering the application in an organization where it was obvious that the recruiter has no idea on how to recruit ambitious people who built companies and have entrepreneurial streak. 

I would discourage people to look at their innovation group or at least avoid talking to the recruiter and directly going to the hiring manager somehow.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your recent experience

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Winchester, KY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the Unit Manager and asked to come in for an interview and when I hesitated, they offered for me to bring my child. The manager was very pushy. I felt uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Where did they think I would fit in at?

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: they already know who they want to hire- why are they wasting my time!? they are not looking for the best qualified person, they want a tool- full-time position- 10 hour shifts- need help asap- sounds great
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?!?!

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process.  I applied in early September, didn't get called for an interview until the mid October.   Great interview--and they told me the next step (round of interviews) wouldn't happen until around Thanksgiving!  I couldn't believe it, but it's now mid-November and I haven't heard a word.
Interview Questions: Great questions about my philosophy of care, what's important, how have I handled difficult situations.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interactive, friendly, professional interview. Online application process is relatively easy. Followed up with either webcam recorded interview or phone interview. Webcam option is terrible and half of the questions are not applicable to new grads, which made answering those questions very awkward. Phone interview went well and scheduled for in person interview. Was a final candidate but hospital ultimately chose another candidate with more direct experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you did not agree with a supervisor or colleague. How did you handle the situation?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Rosa, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a team of 5-6 people in a roundtable format. Everyone was very kind and friendly...the atmosphere was one of wanting me to succeed.  Many questions were asked (10 or so?) and they have multiple parts.  Nothing unusual or out of the ordinary, they pertain to experience, how I'd handle future challenges, etc.   Hospice is filled with nice people, no nerves required!
Interview Questions: I don't temember specific questions

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Great first impression and strong follow-through on managements side.  Training was great and although the hospital seems really big at first everyone is very helpful in directing you to your desired destination
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this hospital?

title: Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: It was cumbersome.  I had to return over and over again to meet with a variety of people,  some of whom I  rarely saw or worked with after I was hired.
Interview Questions: Will I be bored in my job?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Interview went smoothly and was straight to the point in asking interview questions. Was asked about 5-6 questions. Also was asked what shift was interested in, but make sure to ask what position/shift your interviewing for, it can make or break if your offered the job. May have a 1:1 interview or panel interview. Only one interview in person, no second interview and no phone interviews unlike other hospitals.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were given unclear directions? How did you address or handle it?

title: Safety Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with the 5 member team that was about 45 minutes. The second interview was with the team plus an additional 3 people that was also about 45 minutes long. The team was extremely nice, and has such a positive energy. I left each interview excited for the next time I could come in.
Interview Questions: They gave many situational questions that were pertinent to the job.

title: Unit Clerk/Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence (Apple Valley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a LONG time ago, I was interviewed by 3 diff managers.I was already employed 16 years before i applied for the position in the ICU.I already knew the managers, and they already knew my work ethics
Interview Questions: They asked me about different critical thinking situations. They asked me about critical arrhythmias, and how I would respond to them,

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The process included 3 interviews. One with HR person regarding my interest in the irganization. One phone interview with 2 members of the department and then an in person interview. The in person interview had 4 people asking a set list of questions. Each person took turns asking questions and I was given time to ask any questions I had.
Interview Questions: Which of the companies core values do you resonate with?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Digital. Convenient. Brief. Questions do not discriminate between potential employees and current employees. General questions about organization overall and short essays about your experience/skills. Questions were very general...more about organization than candidate per se. Not much of an opportunity to display your skills or what makes you stand out as a candidate. It would be nice if there were more if/then and how questions. So, the hiring manager could get a better sense of each candidate.
Interview Questions: Providence Health & Services is a Catholic group of hospitals and clinics, as such we routinely begin meetings with a prayer or reflection and have crosses throughout our hospitals. How do you feel about working in a faith based environment?

title: Customer Service/Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Do NOT lie on your Resume. They are incredibly thorough, will contact each of your references plus your past employers. If they do not receive the answers they are seeking, they will request you send W-2's or Paystubs to prove employment. Be honest and you will have no problem!
Interview Questions: "Of the many candidates we are interviewing, why should we choose you? Why do you stick out amongst them all?"

title: Supervisor, Talent Acquisition Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I attended a Talent Acquisition Open House event at the campus in Renton in May and was extremely impressed with the TA leadership and team and the exciting initiatives happening at Providence. After connecting with a TA manager there I applied and shortly after was contacted for a phone screen followed by an on site interview with two managers and a lead recruiter. I also had an opportunity to meet other members of the recruiting team. I was asked back for a 2nd interview with my future manager as well as director and was offered the position. I'm looking forward to joining the team!
Interview Questions: The interview primarily focused on what background and experience I'd be bringing to the team, challenges in the talent acquisition space and how I would contribute.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through their employment website. Received an email for an invitation to interview and a few days later, I received a second round that took place at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Software Test Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Sylmar, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very specific technical questions related to circuit analysis and design. C and object oriented programming. 4 sessions of 1 hr interviews with different potions related to the position. Very long time to answer in regards to getting an interview and recieving a update.
Interview Questions: Design a multiplexer using logic gates.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone after submitting an application online. I got a call back within a week.  I spoke with a manager on the phone who arranged for a in person interview. For the panel interview I met in a room with the manager, the director of critical care services, a charge nurse and a staff nurse. I was offered the job, pending a drug screen.  The drug screen was followed by an appointment with HR. The onboarding process took about 3 to 4 weeks total.
Interview Questions:
Why did you become interested in critical care nursing?
What does working at a magnet hospital mean to you?
Tell us about your experience working in critical care thus far?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with single manager, relatively casual. Was asked several questions about my resume and previous experience, was asked to go into detail about certain situations i've encountered in my experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had conflict with a co-worker, and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked situational and behavioral questions.  There was a panel of several managers from different units. They gave me an estimated time to get back to me which was a week. They got back to me a couple hours after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you showed compassion for a patient.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (West Seattle, WA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a group interview with 2 interviewers in one room. The experience was pleasant and did not think a lot of the questions were hard to answer. As long as you present yourself as hard working and have compassion to hep others, you'll definitely be a good candidate for the position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Lots of waiting around to just get the interview. The phone interviews were not probing at all, just a glance at the resume and a few questions. Lots of waiting again. I gave up on them at one point, then they came back saying they were interested. I went in and interviewed face to face for 4.5 hours, met with 9 people. Then at the end of it, they decided I did not have the skills for the job. The skills. Shouldn't they have determined this in the phone screen and not wasted my time, money, energy, etc. It is easy to determine skills in the prescreen. You don't wait to do that in the face to face interviews over a marathon session where the candidate is tired by the end of it. Horrible candidate experience. Would have preferred a no up front than bringing me out to interview only to be told no on skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to tell the stakeholders no.

title: Employee Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2 months from time of application to the actual interview. I applied online and then was contacted via email by the Wellness Manager to come in for an interview. I interviewed with a panel of 3 people. The interview took exactly 1 hour. The questions were fairly standard questions. They took turns reading questions off of a prepared sheet and jotting down notes. Almost all of the questions were behavioral questions asking for specific examples of how you handled specific situations. The last question was why should we hire you. Typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had to deal with a difficult coworker. Tell us about a time you felt overwhelmed with tasks. How did you handle it? What do you know about current needs in employee wellness. What do you know about the population that this position would be targeting.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Received an automated email a few weeks later saying I was no longer being considered for the position.

Two weeks later I was surprised to receive a phone call from a recruiter requesting an interview. The interview went well and I was scheduled to speak with the hiring manager the following week.

By the way, I mentioned receiving the automated rejection email and was told by the recruiter that he had someone helping him screen applications who probably clicked the wrong button or didn't understand the role well enough to move me forward. That was disheartening. I imagine they miss out on a lot of great candidates due to poor candidate screening practices.

Nonetheless, spoke with the hiring manager the following week and had what seemed like a good coversation. She promised that I would hear from her or someone from the recruiting team within a week on next steps. I sent a thank you note, which was never acknowledged and then heard nothing for over 2 weeks.

I called the recruiter 3 weeks later as part of my normal follow up process, plus he specifically said to me during our phone interview, "If you have any questions during the recruiting process, please call me. I'll get right back to you." Left a message and never heard back...from anyone.

It's entirely possible that they decided to pass on me following the second interview OR it's  possible that because of a mistake made earlier in the process (namely, my application erroneously being flagged as closed at the beginning of the recruiting process) I got lost in their discard pile despite being fully qualified for the role and having 2 positive interviews.

Either way, it was a disappointing experience. Both people I spoke with shared passionately about Mission Hospital's values, namely dignity and excellence. Unfortunately, neither value was executed well during my brief, confusing recruiting experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mission Hospital?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a phone interview I received about a week after applying. It was fine, just a phone screening and a few behavioral questions. They did catch me off guard with a question asking about customer service, but still received a call back less than a week later to schedule an in-person interview. I'll soon have that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you delivered exceptional customer service.

title: Patient Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Positive experience: they said they really needed help. They stressed their core values and showed me a card of daily affirmations that they wore with their name badge. It seemed like a healthy environment. Don't be sold on management, it is pretty bad. The catholic religion, core values and doing the right thing is just a marketing scheme. It's simply about operation for money the rest is a lot of lying from management. I did experience some wonderful patients who had good relationships with their doctors.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Providence Health & Services?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The manager and assistant manager were very kind and welcoming. They made the interview easy and comfortable. I was called and scheduled and interview within a week. My job offer came 2 days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a conflict and what you did to resolve it

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I ariived 15 min early, filled out  a questionnaire.  someone came and got me from the lobby i did my interview got a tour and was hired on 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize you time?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, received an email from the recruiter for a phone screen. Had the phone screen and was told I'd hear back in a few days.

This is where it was really odd - I feel like I was given the "run-around" for what was to happen next. They asked me to come in for an in person interview, then said I was to be considered for 3 job openings (not just 1). After inviting me onsite, a few days later they asked me to have another phone interview with 2 potential hiring managers for 2 additional roles.

Following this, I received a cold email the next day saying I was out for all of the positions I was being considered for. Not sure what happened, the questions were relatively easy and the discussion seemed to be fairly positive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your team and how you keep them motivated.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews are widely used throughout Providence. Panels use behavior-based question format. The interview and decision process can take quite a bit of time. Panels can range from 3 to 6 people.
Interview Questions: Describe your qualifications

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Paterson, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I am not sure what the hiring process is because I have not yet heard back but the interview was a panel of people from the care management department.  They called me after I had recently applied and through then I scheduled an interview with them a week later.
Interview Questions:
What are you strengths and weaknesses?
What do you know about St. Josephs?
How do you handle and manage a large caseload of patients?
How do you work in a collaborative team?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied as an internal candidate. The process took about a month. First round of the interview process involved a video interview. Later, a recruiter contacted me for an in-person panel interview. The interview itself was quite positive; they asked a medley of questions, mostly behavioral. Although I satisfied more than the minimum requirements, I eventually lost out to an external candidate with more experience. Oh well - you win some, you lose some.
Interview Questions: Can you give me an example of a time you experienced resistance during a project?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Saint Paul, MN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Nice and comfortable. Very professional, started with questions about previous employment. Explained the tasks and skills of sterile processing I've experienced. Manager explained what she was looking for and what the role would be.Dicussed how I would benefit the position and what would be expected in the role.manager explained the daily tasks and schedule of the position. How many employees are in the department.What is the role of each position.
Interview Questions: How would I react in a conflict with another employee.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: there was an online video interview that had prerecorded questions. It was difficult because you didn't have much time to prepare. It was awkward. After that there was an in person interview. They asked many many questions. This interview was much more difficult than regular position interviews at providence.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions. Exp: Tell me about time where you had to deal with a difficult customer and how did you handle it?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted after applying online by a Providence recruiter, set up an interview date and time and within a few hours was offered the position. After accepting then there was further steps, drug testing, background check, one completed then an onboarding time was set.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mobile, AL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hospital hosted an RN job fair, so I went to it & had a chance to speak to several of the nurse managers from units all over the hospital.  Once I picked the unit I was most interested in applying for, I filled out an online application & followed up with an interview with the 2 managers on the unit about a week later.  It was very easy going and informal. I felt comfortable with them right away!
Interview Questions: Strengths?  Weaknesses?  Past experience?  What I was looking for?  What shift I preferred?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: interviewed with HR over the phone, interviewer was very nice, and professional. Conversation flowed well and was enjoyable to participate in.job was pulled before any offer was extended. was told that I would be contacted if the job was re posted as I would be a top contender for the position.
Interview Questions: how do you manage your time

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: <30 minutes interview, questions not terribly challenging. Hiring process great from HR communication to pre-boarding. Interview was conducted one-on-one onsite, but also available remotely. Heard back the next day re: job offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in home health?

title: Quality Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went smoothly and efficiently. Everyone seemed to be on the same page with regards to schedule and the questions asked were topical and reasonable. I felt comfortable during the process and felt that the staff did a good job.
Interview Questions: What quality improvement projects have you worked on in the past?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was not about getting to know me ask a person. Was about how I live their values. And my responses were scored on a point scale. With three people in the room and no standardized process, their ratings were not equal.
Interview Questions: After hearing our values, do you have anything you would like to say about them?

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Note: it has been almost two months since applying.  I have had the first interview.  There's supposed to be a second interview.  I called two times, and emailed once over the period of four weeks before I even was replied to and updated on the status.  I'm still being considered and waiting...  

The interview took place at Providence St Vincent's and the process is ok.  I applied online, they called two days later to schedule the first interview after a phone screening, and two days later I was interviewed (that's six days after applying).  Good sign!  They came out to get me late (~15 minutes late).  The lady was unsure if another person would be joining us; another person did join.  The two ladies took turns asking standard questions, and did not deviate from the questions too much.  The second interview is supposed to take place with the entire staff.
Interview Questions: What would you do/how would you prioritize if there was a client at the front window with a crisis, the phone was ringing, and there were emails being pinged to you in a constant stream?  How does this scenario make you feel?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview.  The questions were pretty general.  After approximately a month I learned I had moved past that stage I had an in person Panel Interview with all interviewers taking turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict with coworkers?

title: Human Resources Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I had applied about 3 months earlier and had honestly forgotten about the position when I was called in for an interview. i interviewed with 2 supervisors in the HR department and the interview was very smooth and conversational. Pay, and movement in the company was openly discussed in the interview.I felt confident about it and received a call a week later with a job offer that I accepted.
Interview Questions: When was a time when you were not able to give a customer what they requested, and how did you handle the situation?

title: Health Information Correspondence Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview lasted approximately 20 minutes and was fairly low key - not too many questions and most were pretty basic. I passed this stage of the process and have been selected for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Providence? How did you hear about this position? Why do you want to work for Providence? Why are you currently not employed? How does your past work experience relate to the position you are applying for? Describe your experience with working as part of a team. What EHR systems have you used? Do you have any experience with Epic? How much did you make at your previous position, and how much are you expecting to make in this one? If you are hired, what is your availability for starting work?

title: Health Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call a few days later to complete a phone interview. I was scheduled for an in-person interview several weeks later. The in-person interview lasted approximately 45 minutes and consisted of behavioral and situational questions. We also discussed my past experiences and personal skills. There were several people conducting the interview and a few of them were not very personable and did not give much feedback. I decided afterwards that this position was not the right fit for me.
Interview Questions: What types of resources do you use to help others achieve their health goals?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked about how their values apply to real-life situations in my life or work. They have values like justice, compassion, safety, and other such. Check out their website for all of them.
Interview Questions: When have I showed justice in my life?

title: Clinic Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call (screening) by the recruiter. Once I passed the initial screening the manager of the position called me to do a phone interview. After that phone interview I was invited to a in-person interview with a panel of 12+ individual. After the panel interview I met with the PI of the study.
Interview Questions: Explain a conflict in your past work experience and how you dealt with it?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call to come in for an interview a few days later. It was an in-person interview with a nurse manager. It was very straight-forward and I was offered the position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in the nursing field?

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to set up a screening interview, then was approved for a meeting interview with the nurse manager. I was told that because the interview was so "important" I would need to take a day off from work to attend. I later found out that a friend was interviewing for the same position the next week on a day that I was not working, so it seems I was lied to. Then during the interview the interviewer was very distracted, the process seemed very rushed, it felt like she was not interested in meeting with me but just going through the motions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time a customer was unhappy and what you did to change the outcome?

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial telephone interview with HR and another with with Management. I then had a panel video interview after which they moved forward with the process and asked for my references.  I happened to be in the area and offered to stop by to briefly meet in person. However, the manager, who was also on the video interview, met with me for an additional half hour and then took me to the conference room to meet with two auditors (one of whom had a list of questions).  I had no notice and was not expecting this (I told the manager up front that I had a plane to catch that day). After that meeting, more like a continuation of the interview, the manager took me to meet the director who also asked additional questions. The process took 2 1/2 hours. I barely made my flight.  They contacted references (not exactly sure which ones) but after all of that, I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: Name a situation when you had to speak with a client about a problematic situation.

title: Senior Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
External recruiter contact, then a coding exercise, then an internal HR phone screen.  The coding exercise was straightforward but unnecessary given my existing portfolio.  Once I passed that, the recruiter claimed a high likelihood of passing the phone screen and continuing to a half-day of interviews.

The HR representative asked me about my previous positions and why I was no longer employed there.  Despite giving her the information, she demanded to know why they were so short and "what was the common reason" behind me leaving (there was none).  She was rude, obviously had no intention of continuing the interview process before she even called, and ended the call in 6 minutes.
Interview Questions: How long was your last job?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First interview by phone with recruiter, who basically validated my resume. Second interview about 10 days later via phone with the hiring manager. Had a great conversation, but the projects were not a good fit for my background, so I suggested I withdraw my candidacy. Manager said there were other positions available being offered by his peers and wanted to bring me in for a panel interview. Two weeks later had a panel interview with two hiring managers in my areas of interest. Great interview, with the typical questions. Two weeks later had a fourth interview with project stakeholders.
Ultimately, they went with an internal candidate. 
Overall a very positive experience, and I'm hoping to still get my foot in the door.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you were unable to deliver something for your customer. How did you handle it and how did it turn out?

title: Public Affair and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: They really want to get to KNOW YOU and make sure you're a great fit for them. First I applied online, a week later I did a video interview (not my first, and it was a better video interview than I have done for actual tech companies), a week later I was asked to do a group interview (not my first). The group interview was pretty short seeing that there was 3 of us being asked questions for about an hour. Everyone was very friendly and respectful. I spoke with a manager a few days later to talk more about this position, which was great because it gave me more insight if I wanted to be apart of the department.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite job and why?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a recruiter, in-person with a HR Director, in-person with the person currently filling the role, HireVue video interview and now scheduled to meet with the team at the location where the position is open - BRUTAL!
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working with a company that starts their meetings with a reflection or prayer?

title: Purchasing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the director and the department manager. They asked a lot of questions and I was able to respond to all of it. Every time I answered their questions to me, they nodded. meaning that they like my answer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle pressure, are you comfortable talking to people, how do you solve problems at work.

title: Health Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: they try to make it more serious than it really is. they scare you into thinking its so competitive but everyone gets accepted. once you are "accepted" from the interview process you have to complete 30 hours of training which happens over a course of a weekend. its long, boring, more stressful than it really needs to be. they take their "leader" roles too seriously
Interview Questions: if you were stranded on an island, which items would you want and why

title: Purchasing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied and within a week got an email invitation to do an interview online where you see a question on screen and record yourself answering. The next day I got an email to schedule a phone interview with HR which took about 10 minutes. Then the next week had a phone interview with the two supervisors. The phone interview was about 20 minutes and quite easy. It was more informative for me rather than answering a bunch of questions. Got the call later that day offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Typical questions but mostly they were giving me info on the position.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: 1 hr with 2 people.  They were nice.  Just a conversation.  I felt very relaxed.  Gave me the background of the position.  Took turn asking questions and gave me plenty of time to answers.
Interview Questions: How do you rate your excel skill

title: Clinical Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a video response to a number of questions. From there I was asked to an in person interview where I met at location with the supervisors and other members of the team. I was asked questions by a panel of employees and was able to ask hem questions as well. I was given a small tour of the building and explained the general dynamics of the building and culture. The people were very nice. However I feel I was sold a job that is not in line with the actual job is.
Interview Questions: Proudest accomplishment

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
My first interview was through the computer.  Basic interview questions were asked with a live camera running.  I was timed and video taped on answering interview questions.  I believe my interview was viewed by HR out-of-state from where I was applying.  I was then told the company had changed the job description and I would have to reapply.  I reapplied.  Next I was called for an interview with the Manager of the department.  Some questions were asked about my experience but the Manager seemed disinterested.  The majority of questions that seemed important to the manager had to do with how I would handle conflict in the workplace. At the end of the interview, I was given a written test of my skills for the position. I was called back for a third interview with the VP, Manager (same one I had my previous interview with),and two employees I would be working with. Again, I was asked about conflict in the workplace. Also, one of the employees asked what I would do in a situation not related to the job or so I couldn't figure out how it could be.I answered it the best I could but felt that it really had nothing to do with this position. Based on the questions asked in the interviews, it appeared that there was some sort of internal conflict going on in the department. Also, the work environment was not very appeasing as  the three employees were in low wall cubicles where the top parts of their heads could be seen. They did not have much privacy. They had a radio playing in an empty cubicle. There was nothing on the walls. The Manager and VP's walls/offices were just as stark and unappealing as the other employees' work space.  

At the end of my third interview, the one with the Vice President and Manager, I was asked if I had any questions for them.  I asked them how they felt, with my qualifications and my interviews, and if I would be a good fit for the job. I left the interview feeling that I had answered the questions to the best of my abilities but didn't feel that they had. During the interview, they told me that they had posted another job with the same requirements. After the interview, I noticed the additional job posting online. I received a blanket response about a week later from HR that they had made another mistake in the job description and that the job posting had been "closed or canceled due to the business needs of the department or because it is necessary to begin recruiting for the role with new position requirements".  Now, both jobs were listed on the job board.  I debated about reapplying for the job, but did not, thankfully.  A few weeks later, I received a letter that another candidate with better qualifications was chosen.  At the time, one of the positions was still available and it was still available months later.

The whole interview process and follow-ups were handled very unprofessionally for what I considered a reputable company. Hopefully it was just the department and not the way the rest of the company is run.
Interview Questions:
State is situation where I had conflict with another employee and how I handled it.
Status situation with the boss when there was conflict and how do I handle it.

title: Human Resources Strategic Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then interviewed with the recruiter by phone the following week. Came in for a panel interview with multiple managers. I ended up being the #2 candidate and was not offered the job. However, I was referred for another opportunity, went in for another panel interview with the HR team, and was offered the position. Very positive interview experience all the way around. Very impressed with the focus on mission. The recruiter has been great to work with.
Interview Questions: Standard types of behavioral interviewing questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Napa, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I am a travel nurse. The phone interview was quick and to the point. It took perhaps 10 minutes to complete. The manager was polite and informative. The interview was quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Are you flexible to float to other units?

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Corona, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very laid back and conversational.  I arrived early and they were very accommodating.  Typical situational interview questions coupled with a standard case study questionnaire.  Overall I felt as though the interviewer was thorough and allowed plenty of time for me to ask my questions.  Would love to get an offer from them.
Interview Questions: Case study on how I would audit the ER department

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Unfortunately, it was a rushed, impersonal experience without time to build rapport or learn about qualifications.  Not the recruiter's fault, who likely has a very high workload and competing demands with not enough hours in the day.  Several positions are open, so will likely reapply assuming this was a one-off situation.
Interview Questions: No formal interview questions were asked

title: Software QA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview with 3 people setup through a recruiter.  I met the recruiter on site prior to the interview.  The interview was in a conference room with a manager and two other participants.
Interview Questions: Who would you go to if there was a disagreement on requirements between you and the BA?

title: Executive Assistant to Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews and one in person interview.  In depth with less focus on skills, but rather working style. The role of an EA is about "fit" - assuming you have necessary skills: MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and ability to multitask while being meticulously accurate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Campbellsville, KY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview-discussing the details of the job, requirements and what the position entailed. Then in person interview with office manager and hiring manager. This consisted of what the job had to offer - benefits, hours, staff available.  Then the final discussion was over the phone regarding salary, benefits, etc.  This was when the salary range for the position, however, I did not get an actual offer, as I was told this had to go before the review committee for approval and salary confirmation.
Interview Questions: skills , attributes

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied and received a phone call to schedule an interview a week later. I met with the manager of the physical therapy department 1:1. We discussed my qualifications and experience. He gave me a tour of the floor and showed me the therapists' schedules/what our rotations would be like. He was very friendly and easy to talk to. An open, low-pressured environment.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Assistant Day Care Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: they brought me in, and they showed me around the facility, asked if I was okay with the pay and the hours, asked me about my previous child care experience and how much energy did i have.
Interview Questions: How many years in child care experience.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: the panel interview with conducted Director and manager,  applicant is asked multiple questions, told about policies and department processes. explained the hiring process, and time frame. Director explained the benefits and pay scale.After the interview HR then called to set up drug screen and then new employee orientation. this was a very slow process. over all experience was long
Interview Questions:
why do you want to work at providence
how many years experience as a CM
do you know medicare guidelines
are you willing to have multiple changes.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three separate phone screens. The first one was with a recruiter. Then, a phone screen with a hiring manager. I was brought in for a round of interviews - I spoke with three managers. That went well so I had a phone screen with one more hiring manager and met with that specific hiring manager. This all happened over about two weeks. I was made an offer about a week after the last interview.
Interview Questions: The hiring manager asked for an example of when a project or task didn't go as planned and what happened.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the manager and two others in the department. They each took turns asking questions and jotting the answers down. They were all very nice and made me feel very comfortable. They also took the time to ask me questions about my activities outside of work, my hobbies. etc.
Interview Questions: Typical questions..

title: Clinical Informatics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is long. I submitted an application almost 2 months ago, it took 1.5 months for an interview and has been another week to set up the next in person meeting. I wish the process would speed up a little.
Interview Questions: About the job title and what I thought the job was. They clarified all questions I had.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and 6 weeks later received a call from Human Resources to schedule an interview.  I then scheduled my interview for 2.5 weeks later. It was very laid back casual interview sitting on couches. The hiring manager was out of town so there was an asst manager a nurse educator and a staff nurse in my interview. I did bring a resume and all my copied certifications and placed them in folders and passed them out  to the interviewees. they seemed to really like that and commented on how professional that was.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a recruiter and was scheduled the next day for an interview. I was interviewed by the Nurse Manager and the Nursing Supervisor. The went back and forth asking me questions. It was very low key and pretty friendly. The interview lasted about half an hour and I got an offer the same day.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you disagreed with something that someone was doing.

title: Medical Assistant Float Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter first gave me a phone interview to ask about qualifications, mostly yes and no type questions. They will also ask your expected starting salary. I was interviewed in a group setting with four other applicants by two recruiters. All questions were regarding how to handle certain scenarios. The whole process was pretty easy and comfortable even though it was a group interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Project Manager- Northwest Washington Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a PM position in Washington state and received a call from Talent Acquisition. The interview was ~20 minutes with typical questions. I was told I was over qualified, the pay was about $30K less per year than average (and they were having trouble filling the position for that reason) and they would not pay relocation. I said I wanted to live in that area and could deal with those facts. A few days later I received the canned email reply, "After careful consideration, we have determined there are other candidates who more closely match the requirements for this position and the needs of the department.”  I typically do not reach back out for clarification but was a bit miffed. I spoke with the interviewer and learned  the choice was a local individual who was already working with the group and "She has the right personality."  Of course this is typical but don't think it is fair to post and interview for a position that an insider has already has obviously been chosen simply for that fact. I’m not sure it is best for Providence either.
Interview Questions: There are Christan crosses on open display. Do I have an issue with that?

title: Resident Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online to a med-surg RN residency. Within a week, I received a call from their recruiter to schedule a phone interview with HR. Soon after the phone interview, the recruiter scheduled an in-person interview for me with the nurse manager and clinical educator for 2 weeks later. The interview took place at the hospital, at which time I was informed that the nurse manager would not be present at my interview. I received a call from the recruiter 3 hours after my interview with an offer.

I was a bit disappointed that the nurse manager was unable to make it to my interview, being that I would have liked to meet the manager before accepting a new position.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you had with a co-worker

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: From what I remember, I was asked if I would being comfortable in a work environment that based certain values with religious views. At the same time, the employer was not biased to hiring you if you were religious or not. They wanted to see if you were kind and caring, open to and accepting of other people's view of religion.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Lead Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: HR person and screening was among the best ever encountered. But it ended up being a panel interview, with 5 people, so the interview format deviated markedly from the agenda pre-published by the HR resource because of this. But that wasn't the weirdest part.  One person in the interview asked some of the most irrelevant questions encountered in 25 years. "Describe how you would explain database architecture to a 6 year old."  Left me wondering, are you guys hiring 6 year olds into management?  Or is that just their mental age, or perhaps YOUR mental age?  Actually, that wasn't all that weird either, what IS weird is that the word "database" or database topics in general are NOT EVEN IN THE JOB DESCRIPTION. You should really avoid this company, there are severe cultural issues here that need to be addressed with terminations. I called the HR contact after leaving the site and withdrew.  NEVER done that before in 30 year career. This is a stifling, unenlightened environment devoid of growth opportunity, professional courtesy, or any signs of innovation.
Interview Questions: Do you (even) own a suit?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have interviewed at least 20 times over the past 3 years for a variety of different positions with Providence. Most of the positions, I am over qualified for and others would require me to make a specialty change which I am perfectly capable of doing. I have a 29 year nursing history with most of it ICU and 18 years in Cardiac Cath Lab. I can no longer work in Cath Lab because of physical issues so was looking for something less physically strenuous. I am an excellent nurse with a good head and have an exemplary background with tons of experience. I recently achieved my BSN and was on the President's list for the entire time.  Each and every interview process with Providence has left me feeling totally inadequate and unworthy and OLD. Most recently, I interviewed for a position as an employee health nurse which I thought would have been a perfect fit and I am located in the little rural town where the position was. I was notified for this position by a recruiter so I did the initial phone interview. After the "interview" if that is what you call it, I asked if I should go into the system and officially apply, the interviewer told me "no, that's alright, we'll notify you if we need you to go forward". So I had my official answer right then and there. Fortunately, another recruiter for another company called me the next day and was totally excited with my years of experience. The interview process was "tell me about yourself, and what do you think are your strengths, etc." Not the stupid canned questions from the Providence interview that really don't bring out the best in the interviewee but only serve to degrade and humiliate you. I have talked to multiple people in the area about Providence and how it is to work for them. They don't have the best reputation.
Interview Questions: Q: You're almost 59 years old, how much longer do you think you are going to work? (This was asked at an interview a couple of years ago when I was first moving up to this area, not on the most recent interview.)

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviews included: (1) initial phone screen w/HR recruiter; (2) phone screen with hiring manager; (3) phone screen with key partner/client in the org; (4) in-person panel interview with hiring manager, organization's partner/client, and peer.   Application was completed last August.  Decision was conveyed in November.  Offer letter available in December.  The process was not quick, but the HR recruiter was super; he kept me posted all along the way and was quick to obtain and provide feedback.  I accepted about $20K less than I was hoping to earn, but I took into consideration their non-profit status, their corporate culture, and their willingness to pay at the top of their range.  I felt I was treated with respect and consideration, and that the recruiter did a great job with communication.  It was - obviously - not a quick process.
Interview Questions: Some questions were domain expertise-specific.  Some were behavioral questions.  I was expected to know something about the culture and history of the organization, which was not a problem; I made it my business to do that research.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an initial phone interview to discuss my interest in the job.  Additionally, I was asked to have a group interview with several of the physical therapists from the department.
Interview Questions: My goals for my career

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
After applying, I was contacted for a 30-minute phone screen with the recruiter. The next day, I was scheduled for 2, 45-minute calls with team leaders. The final stage was an onsite interview day with 5 team leaders (3 1-hour interviews). 

In additional to questions about cultural/organization fit, I was asked many situation-based behavioral questions related to my area of expertise. The offer came 2 business days after the final interview. 

Overall, I had a very positive experience throughout the recruitment process. The recruiter was very attentive to the fact that I was expecting another offer and moved me as quickly as possible through interviews. I appreciated the organization's flexibility and willingness to help a qualified candidate get a shot at the role.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a Catholic, faith-based organization?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The preboarding process was a long arduous one. I've worked for government entities all of my life and have a perfect, clean record. It took several weeks to get past the background check. Once I did that, they have a talent scout contact you. From interview to hire was approximately 6 weeks
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with all of the staff.  The first interview was a group/panel interview with part of the staff.  The majority of the questions were about job experience and how you handled situations.  The second group/panel interview was more of the same.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview by HR representative.  Professional panel of other research associates and research nurses (approximately 6 people).  Held in office conference room.  Each person took turns asking prepared interview question.  Interview lasted approximately 1 hour.
Interview Questions: How proficient are you at prioritizing tasks? Give an example.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
The Interview process was fairly quick. It consisted of a phone interview discussing basics of why are you looking to leave your current position, why are you interested in working for providence, compensation, ect.
From there I was directed to do an on-demand interview through Hirevue, while is was a bit awkward it went relatively smoothly and consisted of essay questions in addition to questions where you had to record your answers.
From that point I was then given an in person interview where most questions were scenario driven and you had to work through an example scenario discussing what your strategy was and why.
Overall the process took about a week and a half from start to finish.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult co-worker and what steps you took to resolve this

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: A very unorganized and disengaging process.  I applied for the position three months before I was actually contacted for an interview, and almost did not go as I was interviewing at another company by that time, but was excited about the opportunity.  My interview was scheduled for 8:00 am, but when I arrived at the appropriate building, the door was locked.  A reluctant employee finally let me in with his badge, telling me he was not supposed to do that.  Then there was no one at the reception desk.  Finally a security guard arrived and demanded to know why I was there, and then took about another 15 minutes to find the person I was interviewing with - so I appeared to be 20 minutes late, even though I had arrived on time.  The interview was a panel, with a list of prescribed questions, which were all behavioral, and none about my experience or background.  Because the interview started late (not due to my fault), there was little opportunity for me to ask questions or engage in any kind of conversation or dialogue. I finally heard from the recruiter about 3 weeks later, with the only message that I had been deemed "not qualified." While I was initially excited about the prospect of working for a mission-driven, values oriented organization, this experience was so disappointing and disengaging that it painted a very different picture of this organization.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when a customer was not happy with a decision you made, and what you did it about it.

title: Director of Sales - Digital Innovations Group Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Uncoordinated. The recruiter called for the initial phone screen, followed with a phone interview with the hiring manager and ended with a panel interview in person with 2 people and with 1 over the phone. The was a serious disconnect between the HR department and the hiring team. I was left in the dark as to the decision they made and only after I called the HR rep and did not hear back, I called the hiring manager who had the HR rep email me to tell me I was not chosen. This was about 2 weeks after I should have heard from them. I made it far enough enough into the process (final 2 I would guess) that they paid for travel, lodging and meals, but couldn't even call me to tell me I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. No real structure to questions, mainly off the cuff. Most interested in what the sales process looks like to me.

title: Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Oxford, MS) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied by going there and filling out an application. I qualified and once they called me they only asked a few questions and was hired on the spot. The lady went over what the clients I will be sitting with liked and disliked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for providence?

title: Executive Director Pharmacy and Infusion Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had phone screening with HR.  Had follow up interview with hiring VP.  VP stated that they needed to find more candidates to interview.  I was not moved forward to next steps but HR and VP were very kind and responsive.  They seem like a solid organization that practice their values.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Providence?

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Assigned ICD-10 codes based on patient's geographic and health history. Coordinated with the Bill Department to ensure the proper billing. Contacted physicians for additional information regarding to patient's health conditions. Ongoing ICD-10 training.  Followed and maintained patient's information and regulated HIPPA rules and regulations.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in Coding?

title: Regulatory Billing Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about 30 minutes. Staff was very welcoming and easy to speak with. Three people were present for the interview. They did an amazing job of explaining the position in more detail and and were very open to answering all questions I had. I was called later that day and accepted the position. Overall the interview was a VERY positive one and I am looking forward to joining the team.
Interview Questions: How would your skills fit into the position? Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Have to pass the robobot questions in their online application process, so be sure to use key words to get to the next step of getting to a recruiter interview. Next step was a panel interview within a couple weeks. It took another 2 weeks to find out if I got the job, but only when I followed up with the recruiter,
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 2 to 5 years? What skills and attributes do you  have that will transfer to this job. The panel interview consisted of many questions based on (Situation, Action, Result) basis.

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this job in July of 2015 and I didn't hear from them until October 2015. I had already forgotten that I had applied for the position.
