My interviewer was very enthusiastic and talkative. The interview the generic questions about "how you handled such and such situation". He also asked about my background, why I wanted to work there. It was overall a pleasant interview. The overall hiring process was long. After my interview, I had to submit to a background check and also do a drug test. Overall it took an entire month before my orientation date. So if you apply to this job and hope to start ASAP, good luck.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the volunteer director. She was very easy to talk to and welcoming. I was nervous at first but she made the interview very comfortable because it was not too formal.
Interview Questions: What are your goals? Why do you want to volunteer? What department do you want to volunteer in?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple. First a phone screen and then an in person interview. All within a week span. I got offered the job about a couple weeks after the in person interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Phlebotomy?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Lubbock, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was casual. Only lasted about 25 minutes and the manager was talking negatively about former employees. I was not asked any experiential or personality type questions.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work there?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a group of managers, staff nurses, directors, etc all interviewing. It was intimidating but the panel were are friendly and very polite. They were very good about providing feedback as to whether you answered the questions well or if they needed more from you.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions and scenario

title: Hospice Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with a supervisor and answered questions related to hospice and the relevant experience i had previously.  I was asked questions about how i would deal with dying patients.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult coworkers

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews with Providence. First one was fairly easy with basic questions such as goals, experience, and availability. Second one was just to reiterate my availability and willing to work any shift plus weekends. Hiring process: Background check, drug test, fill out forms on your portal, meet with HR to complete additional forms and then orientation.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: CPhT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: straight forward, round robin panel of questions from three staff members, less than thirty minutes long.  [using the words in brackets to use up the minimum number of words required to post]
Interview Questions: do you have any issues completing a specified training program

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a telephonic interview first for the screening process and then had the onsite interview. For the Onsite interview, there was the hiring manager and one of the team lead. It was a straight forward process.
Interview Questions: some of the achievements

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted for a phone screen by recruiter. Took 3 emails over a week to get the recruiter to respond to schedule the phone screen. Ended up not being a phone screen at all but a video interview. Took the video interview. Contacted the recruiter a week or so after to get any feedback or update. No response. Finally got the form rejection email. Whole process was not organized, communication was terrible, never once was able to talk to a recruiter or ask questions, and received zero feedback. Being a director level position I expected a little more from Providence. The whole process left a very sour taste regard providence and a feeling a disrespect towards applicants. Makes me think twice about seeking employment in the future.
Interview Questions: Standard questions on background, how to handle situations, management skills, training and development, etc.

title: Contract Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with Talent Acquisition (HR), phone screen with hiring manager, in person interview with hiring manager. The Sr Recruiter I spoke with on the phone was straight forward and friendly, asking questions about my experience related to the job requirements, what I was looking for in my next employment, and salary discussions. The hiring manager left all salary discussions with HR. The phone screen with the hiring manager was friendly and professional, while very focused on skills and experience with a bit of questions about the mission of the organization. The in person interview focused on my organizational fit and desire to succeed and grow within the organization.
Interview Questions: What of the five missions of the organization resonates most with you?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Providence uses Hireview app to videotape the  interview instead of phone interview. Questions flash on screen and you talk into the camera. There wasn't enough time to read and think about the questions before the camera starts recording your answer. It felt unnatural looking into the camera to answer questions. For the app to work, you have to troubleshoot any tech issues on your own. Hated the process!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, one in-person interview, one group interview, then the job offer.  Somewhat lengthy with having to go to HR and also get immunization updates.  That is it
Interview Questions: Open ended questions - Describe one situation where you took the wrong path and what you would do instead?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume online via their Taleo website.  HR Recruiter from California called me and did a phone screen.  Scheduled interview with Service Desk Supervisor.  Place is hard to find, it's on the second floor of the data center.  Sat in the call center while they were ready for me and the interview started.  They asked a lot of team oriented questions including technical questions.  The trainer did a mock phone call with me which was something different.
Interview Questions: What is Active Directory?

title: Research Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was low stress and not overly formal. It felt like a natural give-and-take conversation and did not include any difficult or "got-cha" questions. The interviewer, who had a calm demeanor, asked about my background and interests and then described the job duties and schedule. The location (hospital common space) and format of the interview put me at ease and allowed me to field the questions in a relaxed manner.
Interview Questions: Where did you go to school and what did you study?

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with recruiter. Panel in-person interview with 3-5 members of the team. They use behavioral interviewing AKA "Tell me about a situation where". Really simple interview.

Read up on their "core values". I'm pretty sure that is on the score sheet as part of the "culture fit".

The campus is business casual. I would dress professionally, ever interview I've been apart of the interviewee's attire has been discussed afterward. One person I know lost a job because they wore jeans to the follow up interview (which shouldn't even need to be stated)
Interview Questions: Tell me about you experience working in a team environment.

title: Guest Services Dietary-per Diem Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Providence (Centralia, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: they called me in and I interviewed with the 2 top dept. managers. They asked the usual questions and I told them I don't work on Sundays. They agreed to that.  I heard in the next week that I had been hired. They called me to let me know I had gotten the position. They told me when to be there for orientation and gave me my apron . I went to a orientation class as well.
Interview Questions: They asked what kind of experience I had.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Torrance, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The process was smooth and I met manager right away for interview. 
Only one on one interview and it took about 30 mins to talk about yourself. Nothing stressful and manager is so nice.  I received phone call and had interview within one week and the result are over the phone and process starts about 1 month including general orientation and six shifts floor orientation .
Interview Questions: What is your goal for 5 yrs

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview...expected questions, but good experience. Some of the questions were ones that I had not encountered before - tell us about a job or employer that you wish you had not worked with and why. Another was, When have you felt most challenged and short of time to complete assigned tasks...and how did you handle the situation.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult client and what you did in that situation.

title: Prefer Not To Say Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then received an email saying I got the interview.  The "interview" consisted of a video interview where you read the questions then reply. Not as easy as it sounds unless you like making videos of yourself.  I don't think it's a great way to do it, it almost felt like I was making a video for a dating service. After that there was a phone interview with HR.  She said she would look at the video and call me back the next day to let me know if they wanted to do a face-to-face interview.  Well, she never did call.  They should have at least followed up with an email saying I didn't get the job rather just leave me hanging.
Interview Questions: Are you OK with prayers being said before meetings.  Yes, you may have to say them yourself.

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was referred by an employee. I did two phone interviews before coming on-site for an interview. The in person interview consisted of three staffers. The questions were general; however, they did ask a lot of questions regarding AHCA and health care in general. It took about a week to hear back and was offered a position. About 48 hours later, HR called and gave me the offer, which was not very good. They told me I could either accept it there or reject it. 

I refused to give an answer and called the hiring manager, who apologized on behalf of HR. She informed me I could have as much time as I needed. I reviewed the offer, and asked a lot of questions and got some great feedback. With time and information in hand, I decided against taking the offer. Ultimately, the position wasn’t going to meet my career needs.
Interview Questions: Please describe a risk within this industry that you think will impact your work here.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
Start to finish, the process took about 3 months. Applied as an external candidate. Submitted an application through a website that was easy to navigate. Contacted by the department's Director for a preliminary phone interview. Next step was to then talk with the Senior Director. Finally, I had an in-person panel interview. The interview focused on right fit and the panel asked mostly behavioral questions; it was a nice departure from the typical interview questions. 

One of the best experiences I've had. Individuals were prompt and accountable with their responses. After phone interviews I like to send out a quick email thanking the interviewer for their time. Surprisingly (and to my delight), I actually received a reply.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflicts with coworkers?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Received a phone call from HR about who I was and scheduled an appointment to meet with Nurse Manager. 
Met with Nurse Manager for a face to face interview and orientation of unit.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about a time where you had to deal with a difficult situation and what did you do.
- Define what it is like working in a team.
- How do you balance tasks that are time sensitive.
- Why do you want to work in healthcare

title: Director, OS&D Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The internal recruiter set clear expectations on the steps, provided regular and timely feedback, and provided all the information I needed to make each stage a success logistically. She spent time describing the role, the company, and the culture, and took interest in me and my questions.
Interview Questions: To describe my experience in 5 core capability areas.

title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a TA Director, two TA Managers, and the majority of the recruiting team.  The process was quick and enjoyable.  They did a great job of answering my questions and helping me to understand both the role and the organization's culture.
Interview Questions: My philosophy on professional development.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First round was phone interview, then if you are selected, they will contact you for on site interview, more likely with a panel of 2-3 hiring managers. You should prepare for both interviews. Questions can include case senarios similar to nursing school critical thinking tests. Know your nursing stuff and know the types of patient conditions you will be working with. Good luck!
Interview Questions: What is your future career planing?

title: Web Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for this job through their web site.
It was listed as the location being in Renton Washington. 

A couple days later,  I was called by the HR recruiter for a phone interview.  The very first question she asked me was if I was willing to relocate to Eastern Washington,  since this position is located there.   I was taken back by this and answer that I could not relocate, and that I thought the job was located in Renton.   She replied back, oh maybe they listed it in Renton too.

I didn't hear anything back for about a month,  and get a call that they would like me to do an in person interview,  and that the job was now going to be located in Renton. 

Before I could do the phone interview,  I had to do an 'online' interview.   Which consisted of several pre-recorded questions that you had to answer using a web cam or phone.   Each question gave you about 20 seconds to think about your answer.  I've never done this before, and it was a little odd. 

After completing this,  I finally did the in person interview.   
It was a panel interview,  with about other people.  some were in the room, the others called in.  This made things very difficult because of technical difficulties with conference call being distorted and hard to hear.   

At the end of the interview,  one of my questions were when they were hoping to make their decision.  They said by the end of the week,  I said great and hope to hear from them soon.   

I do want to say that everyone was friendly and answered any questions I had. 

Later the same night I sent the recruiter a Thank You email,  and also asked to please pass that on to the interview panel.  

2 weeks go by, and I don't hear anything.

I follow-up with the recruiter,  who tells me that the hiring manager is on vacation.   Will be back next week. 

Another 2 weeks go by,  and I then notice that the job has been re-posted on Indeed but is slightly different.   I email the recruiter asking if this is the same position or something new.   She replies back with that the hiring manager is on vacation and she will follow-up next week. 

Another month goes by,  and I log into their job site and see I was not selected. 

I email the recruiter telling her thank you for the opportunity to be considered and to please thank everyone in the panel.  I also asked if there was any feedback by the panel that I could use for any future openings that might come up at Providence.   NO RESPONSE!!!!

I just find that incredibly unprofessional, you have a candidate that is very excited about a position,  showing interest in it and the company.  And the recruiter can't spend a few minutes to follow-up with the candidates?

I think this looks poorly on the company as a whole,  the recruiters should be following up with candidates,  or at the very least let them know if a position was actually filled.
Interview Questions: How do you handle priorities of tasks that could come at the same time.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied in Feb, I got a call back in May19th. An interview was scheduled, but the supervisor had an emergency and failed to notify me or employees to cancel. I was contacted to reschedule. I was offered the position on the spot and was instructed to wait for HR to contact me. I was contacted by HR on June 29th to formally offer the position, the whole process was stressful they wanted me to provide my verification of employment to meet Start date. I was in no hurry to start July 20th but every day they called because Hire right was unable to get a hold of my previous employers ( they pretty much wanted me to do their jobs) I gave them as much information as I could then there was a whole CPR ordeal the whole process annoyed me. I got a call from them every single day until I just decided to withdraw my application.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied, was emailed by manager, set up time to interview, was interviewed by four people, two similar level people and two managers, went around the table each asking questions and occasional further questioning, many based on scenarios, what would I do if this happened? How do you get along with co-workers etc
Interview Questions:
How do I get to know co-workers?
What have I done with most difficult patient?
Who was the best patient?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Casual, mostly just getting to know you. It makes a big difference to have a current employee referral. Apply online then an in person interview then a drug test if you are offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in psych?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, nearly two hours 'over coffee'. I was asked to describe types and difficulty of previous projects. Also questions about specific IT skills. It was very two-way, since I did not actively seek the job.
Interview Questions: How I deal with difficult people, what sort of work environment I do best in, what other employers have said were my good points.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was unstructured, non-intimidating. Not a lot of detail about how I fit into the medical group.I met with fellowship director, NP educator, chairman of dept, and had a brief conversation with office manager.
Interview Questions: What should we know about you?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great and brief and easy to do.The people there were very helpful and the tour of the hospital was amazing and class we very helpful too. Great experience would do it all over again and would re ommend this place to work for. Also its i a grwat area close to the metro and buses
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work fore St Joseph's

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed via Hireright which is a recorded video interview where I was asked questions online and recorded the answers via my PC at home.  I was then asked to come in for a 1.5 hour long interview.  I met with the Lead and the department manager.  They did a very good job of educating me about the Providence Mission and described what it was like to work in their envt.  The asked me about my many years of experience as an agency recruiter to determine if I would be able to make the transition into becoming an internal recruiter.  I found that we clicked right away.  The 3 of us were finishing each other’s sentences and laughing about previous candidate experiences we had over the years. I can honestly say that this was one of the few interviews I had over the course  of my career where I felt completely at ease, comfortable and it was actually fun.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you would be able to transition from an agency recruitng environment to an internal recrutign environment?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Colville, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very good, they listen and asked pertinent questions. They were also accepting of questions and very frank about the work being done at the facility and what roll you would be needed for and fulfilling.
Interview Questions: Sometimes our office becomes very busy with multiple departments depending on us doing our job properly, how would you be able to handle a mistake during a busy period in the day?

title: Student Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got an email from the hiring manager saying I will be setting up an interview with her. They did not specify that the hiring process will be done through a different company, meaning that the background check and other identification paperwork and health clearance were through a third party.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to become a nurse?
What do you do if you see abnormal values or vital signs?

title: Food Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Kansas City, KS) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have not been hired yet.  Mr Ross is reviewing the candidates.  They were interested in my immediate background in food services.  Wanted to know if can work with various personalities and what recommendations I have for possibly improving employee relations and working with difficult persons and what do I like most about and dislike about the food service industry.
Interview Questions: What do I like most about the food service industry.

title: Environmental Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-live and got a phone screening a few days later. Then, after the screening I was asked if I'd like to scheduled an appointment for an interview. I did and a couple of days later I was there. Nice and easy, the way it should be.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your other job? (In my case it was justified and the interviewer was very sympathetic.) How much experience; What shift would you like if given a choice; Any problem dealing with the nasty stuff? (blood, urine, etc.) Are you going to be there???

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application, phone screen with Recruiter, in person interview with hiring manager/s. Discuss the scope of the position as well as work experience and how that fits with position you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Providence?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Cake walk for anyone with experience in the field. The background check took a long time and a lot of paperwork because they wanted copies of old pay stubs to verify previous experience. The people in Human Resources were readily available to help.  The recruiter called me and set up a few  baseline questions to get me started, such as how I felt about this line of work.  Then there was an online application to fill out.  The drug screen, the interview, and the background check. I went to the interview without any make up or jewelry.  I wore a nursing uniform to the interview but street clothes are worn by most of the staff.
Interview Questions: How I felt about a moment of silence or prayer before meetings because it is a faith based organization.

title: Mental Health Assessment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got call from hiring manager, setup interview date, and did interview.  Did some back and forth calling and emailing with hiring manager and was offered a position less than a week after the interview; process was very simple.  The interview itself was quite challenging.
Interview Questions: Interviewer asked me how I deal with different personalities, both patients and staff.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Mission Hospital interview process was very thorough. I was first contacted by someone from St. Joseph Health to schedule a phone interview with a recruiter. The phone interview consisted of questions regarding work history, mission and vision of the hospital, etc. Once the interview was completed, the recruiter scheduled an on-site interview with the hiring manager and HR. They also completed a reference check prior to an on-site interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mission Hospital?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. First video interview. In the video interview, ther is no prep time. You have 3 minutes to answer each question. There are only 3 questions. If they liked that, then passed to department for live phone interview
Interview Questions:
Something that I did above and beyond.
Something I overcame.
Some negative incounter and how I turned it into a positive experience.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed over the phone. Very quick process, took no longer than 15 minutes. The recruiter was very nice and the questions were easy to understand. The only thing I didn't like was that she told me she would get back to me within a week to let me know if I had advanced in the hiring process, however that did not happen.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Access Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was a fairly informal chat about my job history and how I might fit into the position. Was a very positive experience. Due to road construction in Seattle I was nearly an hour late for the interview, but I was in contact with the interviewer and he was willing to wait until I made it. I greatly appreciated his flexibility.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit for the position

title: Healthcare Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with three people. There were standard interview questions that were asked. It seemed very informal. Two of the people conducting the interview were nurses and they were interviewing for a financial role. You could tell that there was little understanding of the position. I would answer questions and speak about the importance of financials and they didn't seem interested or knowledgeable in the subject.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation you have been in regarding a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Biomedical Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had several interviews with Providence. A couple of phone screening calls with hiring manager and HR. Then had a face-to-face with hiring manager. Then two separate panel interviews with the Biomed team.
Interview Questions: What was a situation where you could not produce a positive outcome, and how did you handle the situation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application, contacted by HR recruiter, asked to submit interview video, came in for an interview shortly there after with floor manager, hired that night, passed background check and work history within a few weeks. Started work 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions:
Tell us how you have managed conflict with a coworker? 
Tell me about a time you felt a care-plan was not beneficial or unsafe, what did you do?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Expect a longer process

There is the application
Phone screen
Video interview
A few in person interviews

This is to truly get the feel of the person, in order to find the best fit for the team. It is an experience, but completely worth it.
Interview Questions: Wide range of questions, used to help understand how the candidate problem solves, how they use their skills, and what they are looking for in their career.

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: First, two hour interview by executive recruiter.  Two rounds of all day interviews plus phone interviews. Some interviews were with multiple people and was interviewed a second time by some of the same leaders.
Interview Questions: Interviewer read their mission statement to me.  "To extend the healing ministry of Jesus in the tradition of the Sisters of St. Joseph of Orange by continually improving the health and quality of life of people in the communities we serve."  And then asked how does our mission, influence you in your role in performing the duties of the job for which you are applying?

title: Medical Office Manager III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 phone interview with their HR and 4 face to face interviews with various directors and medical staff on multiple days. The interviews were very pleasant and professional. The HR representative also called to follow up and gave me a status update on the process. She stated I was a good candidate and I was still being considered. Then all of a sudden 3 weeks went by and no other form of communication. I sent 2 emails on different days. First to the HR recruiter and received no reply, then to the hiring director also no reply. I expected something back after 5 interviews but they didn't seem to value heir candidates as much as I thought they would.
Interview Questions: Their questions were very standard; none were too difficult.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The manager who contacted me was pleasant. The other nurse and provider were pretty rude and as soon as I left the room they were laughing. They made me feel extremely uncomfortable by looking down at me.
Interview Questions: All questions are pretty basic, explain the situation, what's your strength and weakness..etc.

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: After discussions with recruiter, I had a round table interview with peers and hiring manager.  They each asked questions and bounced ideas against each other during the interview.  They made a decision to hire shortly after the interview.  The interview gave good insight into the work environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Most of the interview consisted of a panel format conducted by peers, followed by rounds with hiring manager and a VP. The questions asked were pertinent to the role, the panel interviewers didn't seem very interested in hearing my questions however. One of four panelists was using his laptop for most of the interview, directly in front of me, and another was reading his smartphone constantly. I found this to be unprofessional behavior, and as a result lost interest in the role.

Side note: the CIO unexpectedly entered the room midway through the interview. He was not scheduled to join, and sat quietly for about 15 minutes. He then began to ask several questions in an aggressive manner, however some questions were not entirely relevant to my skillset. Again, I thought this was unusual in an interview situation and was not prepared for this by the recruiter.
Interview Questions: What was the largest network deployment project in your prior role?

title: Social Service Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: applied back in January , great interview, didn't hear anything for almost a month and then I had a second interview with the hiring manager. First interview was great with the manager and she informed me that there would be a second interview at a later time.  Afterwards, an hour later, i received a call from HR that I had got the job.
Interview Questions: Are you flexible

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
Screening by hiring manager.  then panel interview with hiring manager and about 4 others where panel interview was virtual, some in same room, some on screen. 
Behavioral interviewing.  They want situation, what you did, and outcome.  They listen for that, they did ask follow up questions. 
About an hour long, and not enough time to have discussion in the panel or ask enough questions to help you know if you want to work with them.  
Thankfully I had a good discussion in phone screen with manager.
Interview Questions: All were typical questions, no surprises.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and was asked a set of 10 questions. They gave me 30 seconds to review the questions. Make sure you are in a quiet room. Its uncomfortable
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly manager, I felt right at home. did not feel any pressure. the manager and I sometimes got off topic and talked about our backgrounds and found out we went to all the same school. very friendly place
Interview Questions: what what I do in certain situations?

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took about four weeks, not including how long they took to contact me for an interview. I applied in January of 2015 and they called me for an interview on July 3, 2015. Vaccinations prior to start date took about 4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this hospital?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews first with HR, then with Managing Director then final with Executive Director. Each one of them took a little over an hour and there were 2 tests that were given, also the background checks were applicable.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to see yourself here at St. Joseph

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is usually pleasant. They ask about 8 questions by 6 to 8 employees from current employees. Prospective employees should come to interview dress appropiately and be smiling during interview. Make sure to have a list of questions you wish to ask. Take bottle of water to interview.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you had a problem with authority at a job and how did you handle it.

title: Home Health Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone call from the Staff Recruiter with a brief phone interview.  Once approved to move ahead, I was scheduled an in-personal interview.  The interviewer was very kind and flexible by scheduling my appointment after my current work day, and he made the entire interview very casual and pleasant.  I was very pleased to find out that he would later be my rehab manager.
Interview Questions: One of the questions the interviewer asked me was why I wanted to transition into home health therapy.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Informal in nurse managers office. He gave me about 10 different scenarios and the interview flowed like a conversation. He was very relaxed and told me alot about the unit I would be working on and the orientation process.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult decision you have made n the past six months?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty painless. From the first phone call to start of orientation was only six weeks. I had a phone interview then was brought in for a face-to-face interviews with my potential manager and coworkers. The culture seemed great.
Interview Questions: I was asked basic interview questions about my background, why I was interested in the position and there were standard HR questions that had to be asked to every candidate.

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was a phone interview, which was great - one on one with the Manager - a week after I applied.  Got called in for an in-person panel interview a week later.  Panel interview was unorganized, awkward and uncomfortable - for the interviewers!  It felt like it was the first interview they'd ever been a part of, which is shocking because they're Recruiters.  After that interview I never heard back, not even an email.  I have heard from other colleagues that they also went through multiple interviews, only to never hear back again.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were extremely specific behavioral interview questions.  They were very specific to the role they are hiring for, and not the roles the candidate has previously filled.  Prepare to get very creative, and dig into the far reaches of your experiences!

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic Panel/Group Interview after online/phone screenings have been completed. You are met by at least one supervisor, a lead and lead in training. Each member takes time to ask pre-defined questions from their computer generated list, then any followup questions they might have. While the process is scheduled for 30 min. I was there over an hour and a half. There isn't much in the way of feedback, it felt a bit like I had more interviewer experience than the supervisor at the time.
Interview Questions: "Describe a time when you made a mistake, what did you learn"

title: Access Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Went back and forth with a recruiter by email for a week or so to set up an interview. Never talked to them by phone. Finally set a date and went to the interview. I sat at a conference table for 20 minutes past the start time and 3 managers/directors finally came in. They had no idea what job I was applying for so I showed them a copy of the job description. They seemed very uninterested in being there with gazes out the window and yawns as if I was disturbing there nap time. Interview lasted about 17 minutes. We just went over my resume and they kept picking random things to ask me about from my resume that had little to do with the position. Lots of long pauses and stares at each other on what was next. Not one behavioral question was asked, which is what I mainly prepared for based off of other reviews. I'm pretty good at interviewing so I felt prepared. Didn't hear anything back and didn't expect too or really want to hear back after that experience. I don't think this is the norm for PHS so hopefully your experience will be better. I think PHS is a good company to work for; however, everything I have read points to lower than average pay unless you are upper management or a nurse with many years under you belt. No discussion about religion.
Interview Questions: None. Almost offered to buy them coffee to wake them up and get the party going.

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Tanasbourne, OR) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Inexperienced group of staff and management all huddled in a very small cramped office , asking superficial questions and actually expecting insincere answers.  My questions either were not answered well due to their level of skill or not to my satisfaction. It was a joke of an interview, but I needed a job and I was desperate, so I overlooked all this.
Interview Questions: What did I do when a co worker made me angry or upset (they were looking for a positive reaction).

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in to the director's office and she interviewed me from behind her desk.  She asked me standard questions, and she was very warm and personable. She made me feel at ease despite me feeling very unprepared.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?  What are your biggest strengths?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It's simple, usually three interviewers. Each take a turn asking a question and write it down. After that they ask you if you have any questions. Before all that, they talk about the position and requirements.
Interview Questions: One of the values of Providence is Stewardship, give an example of a time you performed a task that saved the company money?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: one on one asks you if you know how to use a computer word excel  years of experience want you to do a work interview for 1 week talk about making good money no true
Interview Questions: basic questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Newberg, OR) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough with good questions pertaining to qualifications, temperament, and experience. Interview was comfortable, professional, but not intimidating, and held by the manager and other staff nurses. (I am now filling up space so I can proceed and move on without getting the annoying message saying I need 50 words at least).
Interview Questions: I am giving a relatively common question, but important- How would you deal with another nurse with a difficult personality? (And now I am filling up space so I can easily proceed and be done with this 30 word requirement)

title: Customer Service/Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was casual with basic customer service questions. It was distracted to see the interviewers writing down my responses as I'm talking to them. Interview lasted an hour and the people are friendly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: "Responsable de rayon Running, trail, triathlon et golf" Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted through a temp agency, interviewed with management and was contacted the next business day to offer the position. They described the job in pretty good detail. Pay range I feel is below average for my experience.
Interview Questions: What type of values do you follow?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted a day after applying for an interview. Interviewer was kind and welcoming. Job was thoroughly described. Interviewer asked multiple questions and the interview lasted approximately an hour and 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you think this position does?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process took a LONG time. From my first interview to them breaking the result to me, it took months. They decline my application with awkward reasons but immediately withdrawal the job posting... The company seems to have it's own agenda in hiring instead of finding somebody that really fits for the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Kent, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Half hour phone interview, in person interview for most of a day which included over 5 meetings with product people, project managers, managers, and senior developers.  Interview with senior developers included whiteboard skill evaluation.
Interview Questions: No questions were difficult that I can remember.

title: Inventory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview of the most generic questions, the entire interview is based off of what you answer, not your experiences, work history, education or references. Each person on the panel asks you one question that they themselves were given to ask, not one that they came up with themselves. It is a very controlled environment and hard to succeed if you do not know anybody on the panel beforehand.
Interview Questions: All generic interview questions, i.e. have you ever had a problem with a co-worker and how did you handle it?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone interview that was followed up by an on site interview with a few people from the department. They asked pretty basic interview question then proceeded to get to know me a little better by asking about my past school and work experiences.
Interview Questions: Describe when a patient became unruly and how you handled it

title: New Grad L&D Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then was contacted by human resources for a phone interview. She was very friendly and asked me questions about my school clinicals and behavioral situations. For example "how did you deal with a difficult patient"?. I was told that I would be contacted by Friday if I was chosen to move on. I was contacted two weeks later and invited to the panel. The panel consisted of 7 nurses/chaplains/manager/ect. Everyone was kind, courteous, and genuine. The interview lasted 30 minutes and each person took time to ask a question. The questions were typical..."strengths/weakneses/change in pt status ect.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a hard time in your life"

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was very informal. It clearly showed the recruiter had not read her emails with information she requested prior to the interview. She also did not seem prepared at all. She was very rude and arrogant. If this is the first contact to a company and it is so rude, it shows how the company and department is. I think the recruiter is similar to the receptionist of a company. They are the first window into the company and if they are rude and nasty, it may be an indication to how the company treats their employees. I was not expecting such rudeness especially since the recruiter was the one seeking me out.
Interview Questions: the unexpected questions came from information the recruiter already had gained from email communication.

title: Online Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Replied to a posting from an online job board (I forgot which one), and submitted my resume, which included a portfolio of my work. A few weeks later, I was scheduled for an in person interview. I went to a hospital conference room and met with my (now) manager and her manager. There was another person who was going to be on the phone, but there were technical difficulties. The interview lasted about 40 minutes with a series of scenarios. Within a week I received a call that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What instructional design methodologies have you used? What learning deliverable did they produce?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Bryan, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Everything went great no long time for interview I had interview and the next week I was doing my drug screen,physical and by he week after I was doing orientation and I went straight into training and working
Interview Questions: To be on time and to cover my shift as scheduled

title: A/R Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Job posting was originally for a temporary part time position.  the hours kept changing.  Pay amount changed based on who you talked to.  Had to take off of work different times for different steps in the process.  I had to drive out to a further location for the drug test and medical exam instead of having me use a closer facility.  Was unable to use the closer facility until I asked. Interviewer was unsure what the job would be but very upfront about that.  I was part time and not getting benefits so I was able to ask to take only a half day off or work for the EPO instead of an entire day.  Took almost a month from start to finish.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your self.

title: Regional HIM Compliance Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Called for interview about 3 months after applying. Interviewed by Supervisor and Lead of department. They had questions about how you work with others but it seemed to me they wanted to know more about hard skills and past successes.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you have handled working with difficult people?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with pharmacy technician supervisor and another technician in a conference room. They aske me about myslef, and my history in pharmacy. They asked standard interview questions, and told me about the positions available. At the end of the interview, the supervisor told me that I should be expecting an offer from HR. She couldn't officially "hire" me in interview, but stated that HR would be emailing me in the next day or so
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you had issue with another coworker? How did you handle it?
Pretty standard questions...

title: Lean/Six Sigma Black Belt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied and then heard nothing for months.  I assumed they weren't interested.  Out of the blue they contacted me after I already accepted a position elsewhere.  I applied again some time later and the process went downhill from there.  First, I had a phone screening interview, which went well.  Then, an in-person group interview, which went ok, but apparently not.  I was contacted a few days later and was encouraged to apply for a position that better fit my industry experience and was told I wouldn't be considered for the job I applied for.  I re-applied for the new position and was interviewed again with a different group, which seemed to go well.   I was asked back for another interview, but some of the influential decision makers never showed up.  A follow up phone interview was scheduled and not all of the people showed up for that, and the ones that did weren't scheduled and they asked questions that didn't fit with how the first group described the job.  The key hiring manager then went on vacation for a few weeks, and about a month after her return, a follow up in-person interview was scheduled.  Two days after this I received a rejection call, which is ok- I would have turned it down at that point anyway based on the chaos during the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: "How comfortable are you with clinical language?"

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then contacted for a phone interview 3-4 weeks later. I spoke with a Senior Project Manager for about 40 minutes. I was contacted by an HR Recruiter about 2 weeks after the phone interview for a Panel Interview with the Director of the PMO and a Senior Project Manager. I went to the in person interview and it was standard. The Panel had a paper with interview questions. They went through every interview question and wrote down every answer I gave. They had to write everything down and this slowed down the flow of the interview.
Interview Questions: They used general interview questions based off of a paper. They wrote down every answer.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with technical supervisor and lead technologist. Gave a tour of the facility and then sat down for the interview. Used select interviewing questions. A lot of questions based experience and also mission statement and core values of Providence.
Interview Questions: How do you relate our core values to your everyday work at your job

title: Hospice Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Arlington, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First, I completed an extensive online form with the ability to attach resumes and cover letters specific to each position and keep them stored there. Seemed to work well. But, after months of not hearing but continuing to apply for similar positions, I reached out to a friend in their hospice program and she spoke to her supervisor. Out of the blue, I received an email from "HireVue" explaining that I needed to complete a Digital Interview with them within 4 days. I was leaving in 3 days for a 10 day trip to a place out of didgtal contact. There was no one to call at Providence to make alternative arrangements, so I decided "to heck with it" and went ahead with the DI. It was awful. I did have an opportunity to fiddle with my home lighting and practice answering the written questions as they appeared, however, the process of speaking to the camera light on my monitor without a person there to give feedback and having a ticking countdown going for each question and doing this for 60 minutes was dehumanizing. I probably gave the worst interview of my life. 
Then, I didn't hear from their Human Resources until I called the designated person 2.5 weeks later. She only said she'd call me back and after waiting another 6 days, she sent me an email saying I'd been considered but not chosen. It was made clear that this video was available to any department within the entire organization. I  spent months getting over this humiliating situation. Having no human to speak with during the process was frustrating. 
I  hope it's working for them.
Interview Questions: How did I deal with co-workers whom I disagreed with?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the manager reached out to me via email to offer me an interview. she brought me in and I spoke with her for about 10 minutes and then she took me on the unit and introduced me to the nurses and other staff.
Interview Questions: How I handle multitasking; asked about previous jobs

title: All Professional Roles Within the Organization Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The organization essentially exclusively uses the Select Interview process, which is heavily dependent upon questions designed to recruit actual experiential information in response to behavioral interrogatives.  Candidates should not project response content such as "I would do this or that" --- fact-based / experiential examples are required to succeed with this interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you disagreed with your boss and had to champion your decision / point-of-view.

title: Middle Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people in human resources and non-threatening in interview
Interview Questions: What would you bring to the job  to improve the overall quality of care?

title: Medical Records Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: They are nice to people who is applying for the position.
Interview Questions: None that I don't remember because I'm prepared to the question.just listen to the question and focus. Be honest to your answer.

title: RRT II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very open/honest and to the point!' It seemed as though in the beginning that they were not too caring to push the process along regarding to my hat being in the ring!  I felt as if I was not a real factor in the Position that they had made their mind up and chose their person for the position before I was interviewed.
Interview Questions: How am I perceived by other coworkers>?

title: AR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a two person interview that lasted appx twenty minutes and was positive and engaging. The questions were moderately challenging and gave a chance to highlight skills.  The people interviewing were friendly.
Interview Questions: How do you approach a difference of opinion or disagreement with a co-worker?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an hour in person interview.
Interview Questions: Explain Epic

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the Providence Taleo system. Many applications never saw a recruiter but were immediately rejected by the electronic system. Had a group interview with the director as well as some other leaders who would be key contacts for the position. Was offered the job as I walked out of the interview and received the formal offer from HR the next day.
Interview Questions: Normal situational questions

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: phone, on-site with behavioral based questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Network Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was a formality for me as I was a temporary employee with the organization for 6 months prior to a full time permanent position opening up. The process was that I submitted a standard cover letter and resume to the organization. I was then ask in for an interview that was given by a panel of co-workers. They asked very standard interview questions and the panel was for approximately 3-4 co-workers.  
As I stated, for my position this was very much a formality since they were required to open it up and interview prior to officially hiring me for the position that I was already doing as a temp.
Interview Questions: no unexpected or difficult questions

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Took a very long time. Interview questions were easy. It took forever to get an offer letter. You are required to take a pee test- never have I ever done that in my line of work. There is also shots you have to get if you work in the hospitals.
Interview Questions: I don't recall one.

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with hiring manager.  It was very different than all my previous interviews.  Interviewer seemed on the defense when I asked questions.  Not sure if we just didn't connect or if they had already made some assumption about me.  They made it clear job was NOT in IT and they had a lot of work.
Interview Questions: Why aren't you returned to your previous XYZ company?  It was somewhere I hadn't worked in 3 years so seemed odd.

title: Home Health Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anaheim, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went to 4 different interviews and interviewed with at least 6 different people. I first was contacted by HR and we spoke on the phone. Salary was not discussed at all. If I would have known how much they were going to offer at the beginning, I most likely would not have bothered. I had to drive over 60 miles round trip for all 3 interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you handled a difficult situation. At every interview!

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly quick. Met one on one with the department manager and then had a group interview with doctors and other office staff . The onboatding process took about a week
Interview Questions: Name a time when you went above and beyond

title: Reimbursement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Torrance, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Positions are listed with agencies most times. You are hired on this way and then asked to stay on as a perm hire after 6 months or so.
Interview Questions: There were none.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Medford, OR) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asked typical questions. What is your experience? I was asked if I ever work with a combative patient at any given time. I was also asked in a very very very straight forward to the point fashion is I was willing to work really really really early in the morning.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths

title: Subject Matter Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen and in-depth Q&A about other clinical organizations I have contracted with. Detail of most serious problems. Management of off shore engineers. Budgeting issues encountered in the past.
Interview Questions: Largest Citrix and EPIC Deployments I had designed and managed

title: Regional Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview started with a phone screen with HR.  Then I came for an in person interview with three executive leaders.  I had a final interview with a 4th executive who wasn't able to make the interview.  The whole process happened within 3 weeks of me completing my application and I received a job offer a couple days after my interview.

It was a good experience.  I was actually surprised by how simple the process was.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based interviews.  (e.g. Give me an example of when .... )

title: Senior LD Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter set up the interviews with several different people (in person and some virtually).  Then I waited, and waited, and waited to hear back.  I called multiple times and finally got an answer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with a co-worker, what was the issue, how did you respond, and what was the outcome?

title: Senior Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, screening by HR, Manager interview and then a panel interview process.
Interview Questions: Most questions were of the objective but analytical variety, where they ask, "tell me a time when..."

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional and unorganized. The hiring manager wasn't involved in the interview and the interviewers didn't know what position was available.  They said the hiring manager would call me with information on the open position as they were going through a reorganization so everything was still unclear.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult people?

title: Care Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth.  My employer was very direct and clear on what they expect me to do.  I submitted my application and resume online, so I did not have to bring a physical copy to the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you believe is the greatest strength you have?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took approximately a month+.  Got a call from a confused recruiter that left odd messages on both my cell phone voice mail and my home phone. I called her back and she spent 5 minutes discussing my voicemail message.  Odd. The interview itself was standard process with two interviewers taking turns asking questions. "Tell me about a time when..."  "How would you deal with a direct report who..."  stock questions. Very nice people. Very nice environment. Thought I did a very good job with the interview. Got called back for 2nd interview; but they were indecisive about whether or not they were going to go forward with hiring anyone for the position.  Ultimately, they canceled the posting and no one was hired.  Bummer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was easy went from traveler to staff.didnt have one i went from traveler to staff no real process except hr paperwork. easiest job to get.  I really have nothing else tosay
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Very formal interviews. They us set questions from corporate that must be completely filled out before proceeding. They will do a phone interview and then 1-2 more in person interviews, always with full team involved.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard strength/weakness questions. They will ask for specifics on how you have handled a conflict with a peer, what you've done to help your precious employer or a project in the past. They will talk about their Catholic system core values and will ask a specific example of how you're recently demonstrated those values.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: One phone call,  followed by an interview by a pannel of five to six. Then checking with references. Next,  official job offer by recruiting. The atmosphere throughout was quite official and serious.
Interview Questions: How I dealt with upset customers.

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Providence (Waco, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was very easy and straight to the point, the questions were related to job experiences. When I left the interview I was immediately hired, then sent for a physical, drug screen.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Hospice Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition Company- no phone contact with actual company officials not until -Initial phone contact, telephone interview, more phone calls, appointment made for live interview. After interview, more phone calls.  If hired must go through background checks and drug testing.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with an unrealistic patient or coworker....

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Irvine, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: My resume was submitted by a Staffing Agency through a shared professional relationship. The Alliance HR Department contacted me to do a phone screening.  Then I was asked to meet with the VP of IT who this position reports to.  Then I was asked to come back to meet with another IT Director who was a peer to the open Director position.  Then HR contacted me to inform me that they went with another candidate because she was more strategic.
Interview Questions: The VP of IT asked me a lot of operational questions regarding project management, portfolio management, SDLC, etc. He interrupted most of my answers.  And most of the time he just talked about himself, the company and what he's done with the department. Overall, it was a weird interview.

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: First the manager contacted me on the phone and we set up an in person interview. The interview consisted of standard behavioral questions. The interview was an average difficulty. Went over your experience and education. The manager was super sweet and nice. After the initial interview, HR contacted me with an offer, and then it took about 2 weeks to get background check, drug test, physical done, and attend an orientation.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had a difficult time communicating with someone and how you overcame it?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Limited, not enough questions about change management.  Very soft share your story type of interview.  Behavioral interview is the type they use.
Interview Questions: "Tell us a time when you had to share unpleasant news with a client, what was it and how did you do it?"

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was professional and collegial
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Tech Level I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Napa, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very smooth, everything was fine, fast and simple.
Interview Questions: There was any difficult questions, they really know what they are doing and what they are looking for in an employee.

title: Discharge Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Three interviewers asking basic and behavioral questions. It was laid back and pleasant. One of the RN's walked me out and told me I'd done a great job. The only struggle was convincing the director that I understood it was not a clinical position and I would not be doing counseling as that is the background that I came from. Once I had established that it was clear that everybody was pleased with the interview process. When I left the interview, I felt good they were all positive lots of smiles they weren't trying to trick me with questions it was very straightforward
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had conflict with your manager, what did you do and how'd it turn out?

title: Operational Excellence Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2013
