Interview Descriptions: I applied through university job website. The first round is phone screening. It's very straight-forward interview. The manager is very nice and experienced. I was asked about my background and internship experiences. I was asked to go for an on-site one-on-one interview 2 days after the first round. The manager showed me around the office, the floors and walked me through several project that he was undertaking at that time. After the interview he told me that I got selected. The questions he asked were focusing on how much interest you had on continuous improvement.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in health care industries?

title: Medical Records Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I applyed on line for this position and was interviewed on the phone enitilally. Then I was interviewed in person on another date. The interview took about an hour.
Interview Questions: It did have a few unexpected questions but I don't think it was the most difficult interview that I had been through.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by e-mail by unit manager. Arranged interview with her and then group interview with other staff nurses. Typing test administered at that time. Job offer the next day via e-mail.
Interview Questions: Select interview process is used. Other questions by staff nurses included some to assess critical thinking skills.

title: PRR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Solid interview process, I felt like the interviewer really cared about my answers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Back then Paper application then telephone interview then person to person.  About 2 week process the person to person was with one lady more or less  telling me a description of her role I was going into a New grad program
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: resumes are screened by the HR department and acceptable candidates are sent onto the Manager and then the staff.  The Staff decides who to interview.  The interview is behavioral and points are awarded based on how you answer the question.  Scoring is used to determine the best fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had conflict with a colleague, what happened, how did you resolve it and how did it turn out?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the hiring manager two days after submitting application.  Interviewed two days later. The interview was entirely behavioral.  All of the questions are based on past experiences.  The hiring manager told me about the interview style during our initial phone conversation, so I was more than prepared.  The questions were job specific, but I believe they use the behavioral style of interview throughout the company.  An example question might be: "Talk about an experience where you've dealt with conflict in the work place and how you responded".  I received an offer from a recruiter within a week and began the on-boarding process. The hiring manager remained in contact throughout the entire process. The background checks, drug test, health screen, etc takes at least a couple of weeks following an official offer.
Interview Questions: The questions were predictable.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Gardena, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: All as expected, was greeted and seated in a cubicle that was set up with various spreadsheets. Once 'tests' were completed- actual interview was fairly basic- was brought on as a temp.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Providence

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had to seek out a recruiter because my job remained under consideration. The first interview was general with a lot of behavior questions " tell me a time when". The department manager and clinical manager were both present. I was called back for a second interview a week later to meet other key staff I would be working with if hired. I was called back by the recruiter late on a Friday a week later with and offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation when you disagreed with you supervisor what happened and what were the results

title: Medical Transcriptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Atlanta, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Friendly interview with my new boss.  Made me feel welcome from that day on.  It was a great experience. Very casual, not "stuffy."  I learned a lot from this opportunity.
Interview Questions: Do you have pathology experience?

title: Preoperative Secretay Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview with my would be immediate supervisor was smooth and easy. Then the final interview with the Manager was even easier. I was very comfortable during the whole process and the mood was just right.
Interview Questions: How to handle irate surgeons and patients?

title: Senior Human Resources Strategic Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took months to get thru from start to finish.  2 phone calls- 1 pre screening and one quick interview.  1 day with two panel interviews.  One had 8 people in the room and the other had 7.  Then a final interview with the VP.  Tons of questions based on situations where the choices were all judgement calls as to how to handle the situation based on your interpretation of expected outcomes.  Not directly asked about faith, but made it know it is a faith based organization.  Then it was 2 weeks before hearing back with an offer.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable serving others who are of a different faith than you?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Your resume gets you in the door, but your interview gets you the job. Interview questions are based on the STAR format. Always have examples on hand, so that you can show what the Situation, Task, Action, Result was. Never, never reply that you don't have an example. They are looking if you are a good fit with their culture.

This was an internal application, so I didn't have a phone interview; however, if you are external, you will have a 1) phone interview; 2) interview with one person or several; 3) possibly a 2nd interview; 4) An offer contingent on background check and drug screen.

All and all, it can take an external candidates 6-12 weeks from phone interview to first day on the job.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of when you disagreed with your manager and what was the result.

title: Call Center Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Apple Valley, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The ad was in the Newpaper and I had applied. One weel later I was called for the position. I had interview and I was called back for a second more broader interview with a group. I was asked question from three different individuals and this lasted 45 mins. Medical questions and of course ny resume and work history
Interview Questions: What at this time the amount I would accept?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview to set up in person. The in person interview was simple. The basic skills questions. Nothing difficult or thought provoking. The job description made the position out to be very busy and with a big opportunity for advancement. Not the case. Dress is business casual.
Interview Questions: What is your least favorite thing to do relating to office work?

title: G I Endoscopy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: THe managers were very brand focused, more concerned about my familiarity with specific kinds of equipment than the entire job process.  I have never been so talked down to before in my career.
Interview Questions: What was my experience working in the environment.

title: Anticoagulation Clinic Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Pre-screen conducted by HR personnel over the phone.  In-person interview conducted in panel format -- interviewers (3) sat on one side of the table, alternating asking questions and taking notes.

I can appreciate the necessity of consistency in the process for each candidate; however, the entire process was very impersonal and somewhat cold.
Interview Questions: The questions were very generic, and some were not related to the position at all.  The interviewers seemed unprepared to interview for the specific position.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: My spouse and I were flown in from out of state after a 1-1 telephone interview with a recruiter and my one up.  Interviewed over 2 days by senior management, middle management, medical staff and the very staff I would be supervising. Toured the area in anticipation of relocation and met with a real estate agent to check out housing. Stayed in a comfortable local hotel and assessed the overall community to make a sound decision. Dined in a top notch restaurant with key people I would be working with and my spouse accompanied me.  Offered multiple contacts for f/u questions and I was very impressed with the overall experience which lead to a job offer.
Interview Questions: Could I work in a faith based facility?  Was I willing to stop consulting work to take a permanent position?  Can I facilitate change?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (New Delhi, IL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
interview is good.they will ask basic questions and related to your projects in your curriculum.
make sure that you fulfill the resume, so that you can answer whatever he asked.communication skills are important.in hr round some basic questions
Interview Questions: skiills

title: IT Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK)
Interview Descriptions: Online application, phone interview, team interview, executive interview - it was a long extensive process.  I submitted my initial application in April, but didn't start my first day until July.  Once I got through the application and interview process, I still had to pass a drug screening (which now may include nicotine) and background check.
Interview Questions: I was asked, "You have no experience in Healthcare - how will you know how to relate to doctors and nurses who are highly trained?"

title: Senior Human Resources Strategic Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long, multiple group interviews, external vendor for background who was horrible to deal with and created inaccuracies!   Online application and resume submit.  Phone contact with recruiter, phone interview with hiring manger then multiple panel interview with local staff.  Took months from initial application.  Background took weeks due to horrible customer service!
Interview Questions: Past relevant experiences

title: Precertification Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Nashua, NH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer questioned me on my familiarity with medical terminology and basic clinical knowledge. Further, I was asked how I would be able to make a positive contribution to the department. This I answered with the statement that I can bring my clinical experience to the otherwise non-clinical precertification process, hence providing a more rounded approach to securing prior authorizations for high tech diagnostic imaging exams. The overall experience was very positive and satisfying.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with medical terminology?

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Providence (Lake Forest, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applicants must interview with many different people, including the director of Community Benefit, the Clinical Manager, and other Mental Health Therapists. Applicants must be fluent in Spanish, even if the job requirement doesn't specify bilingual. Must be able to demonstrate they can work as a team member, and be willing to share an office with several other employees.
Interview Questions: What is the definition of dignity?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed with my current boss and one involved with hiring. They asked me typical questions of different scenarios at my last jobs. I was hired right after I went home from the interview. HireRight did my background check and it took quite a while, I also had a Urinalysis and after the background check and urinalysis went through I had a health screening where I had to bring my immunization history and they provide shots for you if you are missing any and draw your blood as well. Total time took for post-interview necessities was four weeks before starting.
Interview Questions: "Tell us of a time you had to make a decision that you look back and realized you could have done something better."

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Not very good at all. Way too intimidating. Managers seemed like they lacked the experience with interviewing people. Shake hands and act more inviting. These jobs don't pay enough for someone who is a perspective candidate to be treated so unfairly. Even if it did, based on how I was interviewed, I wouldn't want to work here, and definitely wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
Interview Questions: Questions were not difficult to understand or weren't too unexpected. I am familiar with the behavioral interviewing process myself because used to manage people. But I would always interview in an inviting and friendly manner. I didn't get that from this place.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call, when in for a interview, weeks went by and I finally got the call, came back in for all the medical screenings and then the 8 hour "new hire" meeting.
Interview Questions: "Sorry, does it bother you that I'm on my phone right now? *laughing*"

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply through the internet, receive call from recruiter, interview with recruiter, then one on one interview with hiring manager, followed by two panel interviews, one with the work team and the other with other managers in the hospital. Then calls to references, background check, medical check, and if all passes you receive your offer.
Interview Questions: The questions weren't unusually difficult. Be prepared to speak to the Mission and Values and maybe what they mean to you. Even though this is a faith-based organization, it is not at all forced onto people.

title: Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with supervisor and peers.
Interview Questions: What did I do with a patient that was beyond expectations for my position?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Resume submitted, then a recruiter contacted me and I submitted a detailed online questionnaire. Interview was scheduled. Interviewed by two people. Interview consisted almost solely of "Behavior-based" questions, read from a script. Questions such as, "Have you ever had a situation in which you were asked by an employer to do something against your own values, and what did you do/how did you handle it?" Interviewers were cordial but gave little information and no feedback. Asked very few questions about me but did describe job when asked. I never got a call back.
Interview Questions: See above. There were a number of questions like this one.

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
hard interview, many technical question , small panel, took  meet and greet
with other mahagers, providers,sets of standard question which they ask to all the candidtes and compare with others
Interview Questions: conflict handle

title: Registered Nurse Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Olympia, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initially, phone interview with HR recruiter then scheduled in person inverview with 2 of the clinical managers at the time.  Interview went well and was quickly called shortly after with job offer.
Interview Questions: Basic questions revolving around experiences, role playing situations, how you handled difficulties in the workplace and patient difficulties

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (North Portland, OR) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 interview
Interview Questions: Nothing that I recall.

title: Windows Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Simple and single interview with small group 2-4 people.  There was a silly hand written test you have to do that ask some really 101 type tech questions.  They seemed to be more looking at personality fit rather technical skills.  It was relaxed and took about 45 mins.  I had a follow up phone call with the director that again was about learning more about my personality then technical.  Over all it should be an easy interview for anyone with some skills.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you solved an issue with Active Directory?

title: Inbound Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 supervisors, each took turns asking questions. Mostly questions about your experience and how you handle situations. The interview was about 20-30 minutes total.  Interview/work attire is business casual.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with an angry patient?

title: Technical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with a lot of details and examples are wanted. You'll go through a phone screening with the recruiter and then a phone interview followup with a leas/supervisor or manager next. If you pass through, you'll interview with the panel of about 3-4 people on the team. You'll want to bring questions and come prepared to answer the questions with specific answers. A lot of answers need to be based on recent experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a fast pace environment with constant changes to procedures?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: A very straightforward but unique interviewing process.  The first interview was in person with the hiring manager.  It was a basic screening interview to determine fit and skill sets. The next round was three consecutive interviews with potential stakeholders and future team members.  Then the final interview was with the organization's Chief Medical Officer. The whole process took about two months.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when everything went wrong on a project.  How did you react?

title: A/R Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview started late. they where still out to lunch. Had to interview with 2 people. They wanted to know why I hadn't worked in over a year told them that my husband was dying of cancer so I had to quit work and take care of him. They where very pushy to ask where I wanted to be in 5 years. What would my last employer say about me.
Interview Questions: Why havn't you worked within the last year?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two people,  behavioral related questions. It was overall your basic style of interviewing. Sat down in lab area with a  manager and a soon to be Co worker. I believe a good fit was most important for them at the time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one of your strengths?

title: Cleaning Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very chill. I applied on the last week of June 2011, got a call two weeks later to schedule an interview. Went for the interview, and a day later got a call from HR asking if I would take the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online and by email. Went through phone screening process. Went to 1:1 interview. Went to an interview day that included multiple 1:1 interviews and a chalk talk (presentation). Was offered position contingent on background check and drug test results.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Providence?

title: Process Improvement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Have a specific set of questions to choose from. Focus on specific examples from past work experience. Have some specific examples that show your skills and some examples of difficult situation or that you didn't achieve your goal and what you would do differently
Interview Questions: Describe your education and training and how did you apply it?

title: Director IT Asset Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Web site to submit my resume was easy to work with and kept the information to make applying for other opportunities easier should I choose to apply for other opportunities.  A few weeks later I got an email that notified me that my resume was forwarded to the hiring manager for consideration.  
A few weeks later I got a call from a recruiter to set up a panel interview.  I had a panel interview and was made a job offer a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you deal with ambiguity? Give an example and what were the end results.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and get contacted within a few weeks by the hiring manager if your application passes the HR screening process.  Interview over the phone and then get invited to an onsite interview.  Usually 2-3 people sit on the interview.  They use the select interview process.  Then contacted within a week or so for an offer.  If accepted, HR does background check and you do a drug test.  If all passes, you get invited to an orientation and start shortly after.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you faced a difficult situation at work.  What happened and how did you handle it?

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen to go through resume. Followed by quick phone interview then a basic Interview with a panel of hiring managers and department heads. Recruiter was very helpful throughout process. overall it was very smooth interviewing process.
Interview Questions: very standard questions

title: Student Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Petaluma, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were held with the medical imaging department manager. As I have herd from others they are fair and honest during the process, one of my fellow classmates was hired shortly after obtaining her ARRT and CRT certifications. I was told only that it went smoothly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in ten years time in this company?  This is a difficult question to me because of un-expected circumstances, meaning if a superior job offer arises in five years I may be tempted to take it. Talking to your superiors may be beneficial to achieving the desired increase, so be honest.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Torrance, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by the nurse manager. She asked me very simple questions like the normal vital signs and then on my second interview I was interviewed by most of the RNs and the other managers all at the same time! I was incredibly nervous but they were all really nice and the assistant manager asked all the questions whiled everyone else just listened and took notes.
Interview Questions: what are the normal vital signs?

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I found an ad on Craigslist for a medical biller position. I found out the ad was from a staffing agency. Did a phone interview and the came into office to do application, background, and drug test. Had another interview with hiring managers. Two person panel interview. We discussed past experience and then behavioral style interview questions..."Name a time you..."  Fairly simple and low key.
Interview Questions: Previous billing experiance

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The location had, no receptionist at the door.  There was a desk but no person or directions.  After a while, I nearly left, I noticed a map of the building on the wall.  Then I found the administration office.
Interview Questions: work history I have done

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Hourly wage was a miscommunication problem between recruiters and Providence. They lowered our wages by $2 after contract was signed. They wanted to keep lowering it the wages since they were over budget. 
Interview was done by recruiting company.
Interview Questions: N/a

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was a crucifix hanging on the wall of the conference room. They put me at the head of the long table with 4 people on each side (8 total). It was an intimidating experience. Instead of getting to know my skill set, they asked questions like: "How do you feel about prayer/moment of silences before meetings?"  and about 10 questions related to problems I've encountered in my working environment.
Interview Questions: "How do you feel about prayer/moment of silences before meetings?"

title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had worked there from staffing so they knew me. It was informal. I knew the people.  Staffing is a normal way people get hired as PRR's. I knew the people already from working as a float. I like one of the managers that left soon after. I felt like I could do the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What do you like, how do you like working with your team?  The usual general questions.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy basic question regarding previous experience and handling multitasking.  Interviewed with supervisor and program director. Both were very easy to talk. It was probably one of the easiest interviews I have ever attended.
Interview Questions: My previous work experience.

title: Information Systems Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Burbank, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview, Generic Questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you resolved a conflict and the step taken to resolve the problem.

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Providence uses a typical behavioral interview process: “Think of a time when ...”. Being OK with working for a Catholic health care system is one question (Note: Providence hires and values all people of goodwill with a commitment to compassionate care, regardless of religious background or affiliation). Committing to the Mission and values is of critical importance in the interview and — trust me — you won't be happy at Providence if you don't have this commitment.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working for a Catholic health care system?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was sent over there by a Staffing agency and was unprepared for the interview.  Every question was followed up by "Give me an example".  It was more of an interrogation, then an interview.  He did not take the time to make me comfortable.  One of the questions was "What was said about you on your last yearly evaluation", followed by "Why did the say that?".  I was also asked what my "Values" were which I felt were personal as he was basically asking if I was what? Catholic?
Interview Questions: What software do you utilize to organize your day?

title: Director of Evidence Based Care and Clinical Effectiveness Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was excellent with good communication and follow through
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a change?

title: Credentialed Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Two telephone interviews,  usual questions, nothing extraordinary. And drug test
Interview Questions: There were no unusual or difficult questions.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted within 2 weeks.  Had a phone interview with HR member and came to the Renton office for an in-person interview.  Was offered the job later that day.  The overall interview was easy - the two women that interviewed me were very easy going and friendly.
Interview Questions: If I knew HL7 interface language

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone screen with the director which took about a week to schedule internally. The second interview was a panel interview with the director and two project managers on the team. They mostly asked about technical skills and experiences working on projects. I received an offer that afternoon after sending a thank you nor after running back to my desk after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Six Sigma Black Belt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by in-person interview, panel style, 4 interviewers. Select Interview process, questions all ask for a specific example, "tell me about a time..." Interviewers took turns asking questions and wrote the answers down in a booklet of papers. They also  asked about my comfort level in working for a faith-based organization.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you and a co-worker disagreed on something. What was the issue, how did you respond, and what was the outcome.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Sat with a group of people-manager, ACM, and staff and answered bucket questions. The questions were very broad and not unit specific. There were 2 interviews one with staff and one with management.
Interview Questions: How do you define compassion and give an example.

title: ESE Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Its a long careful process start with recruiter phone call 1st, followed up by tech phone screen, on site group interview, talk to the manager/director then lunch together.
The focus is on candidate's storage support/operation capacity + past working expoerience on the similar jobs.
Interview Questions: Work experience in support EMC, NetApp, IBM &amp; HP etc

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Trying to get an interview was difficult. Finally, got a hold of a recruiter and was able to get an interview in a position that she thought was a good fit. Took 3 months.
Interview Questions: What was your last review like, and would you mind submitting that review.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Providence (Fullerton, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: You must take a few basic medical assistant test before you speak with the manager; then you are asked a series of appropriate questions, I was also able to ask a few questions of my own, and was given pretty straight forward answers, then was told that  i will get contacted in about 5 business days with an answer.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose the medical field
What are your weaknesses and strenghts
Would you say you catch on very quickly, or do better once youve taken some notes?

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Providence (Orange, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and informative.  But the initial contacting from HR was very lengthly, almost 6 weeks.  After interview it took another 4 weeks to get background, drug screen and offer letter and orientation scheduled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from the Recruiter  to come in for a 1 hour panel interview.  The interview consisted of detailing my experience and answering questions from the panel throughout the hour.  Although it was a panel interview, they were very kind and it helped to ease my nerves.  In about a week I was called in for the final round which consisted of a business case with two of the business users.  The point was to see how I gather requirements and perform analysis in a real life scenario.  Once I completed that I went through a phase of providing the details to the team and having a 1:1 with the manager.   This round took about 2 hours. The next day I received an offer and accepted the offer within 2 days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First screening interview was  through HR, followed by phone interview with the department manager. In 2-3 weeks a panel interview was set up with other managers, and an offer followed a few days later. I accepted the offer, and started the pre-employment process about a week later.. The entire process was smooth and unremarkable.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Clinical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Takes forever to get a call, you may already accept another job before they call you for an interview. They don't focus on your abilities, they don't ask about experience.  They want to know if you do what your told and will stay a d put up with their crap.
Interview Questions: They asked what I disliked about all my former employers, what my weakness is aND if I can balance work and personal life.

title: Department Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Renton, WA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was well balanced.  The questions were challenging but not unreasonable.  I had plenty of opportunity to ask questions of my own.  They made sure I knew they  were a faith based organization and that I could support their mission of caring for the poor as Jesus would have done
Interview Questions: We are a faith based organization based in Christianity.  We express the love of Jesus through the compassionate care of others, respecting each individual and caring for the poor and vulnerable.  While you are not expected to be a Christian, you must be able to support and live out the values.  Can you do that?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Common practice interview... HR is slow, however once you get past HR you round with interview panel rapidly.   Overall, you end up answering common industry questions such as "tell me about a time where you failed."  You round with manager, interview with service line director and then progress to panel interview.
Interview Questions: Not difficult,  "Tell me about a time where you failed yourself and a client?"  Seemed like a get you question

title: Food Services, Nutrition Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Viejo, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
HR called me and asked me to come interview with the nutrition/food services department.  

Once at the interview, we were in a small conference room with three department supervisors and the HR (4 people) each taking turns asking unique questions relating to Mission Hospital's Core Values and each taking notes on my answers.  I quickly learned that I needed to come up with answers about my experience that related to their 4 core values - Dignity, Service, Excellence and Justice.   It was tricky to come up with impromptu answers.  I was surprised there were 4 people interviewing with me - since it was an entry level job without a degree/certificate in hand.  I would have expected the job interview experience to be this way for a more professional position.

The interview lasted about 45 minutes.  They asked me if I wanted to shadow the department and I was happy to get the opportunity to do that. 

Once hired, I needed to wait two weeks to start because I had to attend the hospital orientation, get a panel of vaccinations  (because i would be in contact with patients) and take a physical assessment test to make sure I could life, stoop, bend, etc.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you exemplified or witnessed dignity in the workplace.

title: Technical Support Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Tigard, OR) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initial Communications was by phone after submitting an application through Providence's Career site.  Interview process involved a sit down at a table with 4 interviewers that were made up of two phone reps, one tier two rep, and one manager.  They took turns asking various technical questions that were written on a pre-designed template.
Interview Questions: What program do you use to Send messages to other users, computers, or messaging names on the network.

title: Acute Care Staff Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Laborous.  Difficult to connect with recruiter.  Poor follow up
Interview Questions: Must have a "bad experience" to discuss and correct

title: Data Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received a call to schedule a phone screen. Basic questions just going over your resume and specific experience. Then I was asked to come in for an interview. This was with the manager of the department and a high ranking Analyst, it took me about 1hr 45mins to complete the interview w/ Q&A. I was told it would take about 3 week to figure out if there would be a job offer or another interview with the director, but less than a week and I received an offer.
Interview Questions: What does a Union do in SQL?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Providence in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from an HR employee asking me to interview for a position as a case manager, although I had actually applied for a job as a staff nurse. I met the qualifications and that's how badly they needed to fill the position! The interview was 2 parts in the same day. I met with several members of the department, including 2 managers, around a table and they asked me a list of questions that I'm sure they asked everyone. "Tell us about an experience with a patient that changed you" is the only one I can remember now. I also met with the same woman from HR at a different office and she asked me more general questions. A few days later I received a call offering me the position and had to take a drug test, health physical etc.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult situation and how you handled it" etc.

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: online applications only, one interview, offered job but took a very long time, HR takes forever to get on managers desk then depending on manager you may or may not have to go to a panel of unit personal and then you are hired by personality and sucking up instead of ability
Interview Questions: How will did you deal with a difficult situation in the past.

title: Accounting Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the CEO, was redirected to various managers. Had a phone call with 2 seperate CFOs and then went to the office for a panel interview with 3 managers. Got hired and started a week later. Great process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Healthcare?

title: Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Started off with an initial phone call with the hiring manager to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview was informal and consisted of 4 people who asked a battery of questions about work experience, career goals, and a general explanation of the position. After the phone interview, waited about two weeks before being invited for a 10+ person panel interview. The day before the interview, I was introduced to the IT team and sat in a steering like committee. Everyone was very pleasant and nice.  The panel interview was very formal and everyone had a packet of behavioral and situational questions. This was very difficult but I was given as much time to think and answer the questions. At the end of the formal questions, it was an open session for everyone to ask their own questions. Overall, the interview went well but I do have to emphasize it was a little nerving. The work environments (hospitals) seemed pleasant but office space was lacking. Job position that was offered had lots of opportunity to learn various programming languages, improve on current systems, build database, build new relationships with clinical departments, and so forth. People are very nice. Programs/languages/systems: Centricity, McKesson, HTML, JAVA, UNIX, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had a difficult customer and how did you resolve any issues.

title: Housekeeping Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had 3 interviews with some managers that they did no know  anything about housekeeping.
Interview Questions: If I will enjoyed potlucks!!! I though i was going to work????

title: Business Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was straightforward. The interviewer(s) develop standard questions and ask each candidate the same thing. The hiring process involved an extensive background check, a drug test and a physical exam that was very thorough. A new employee will also be required to have vaccinations and a current TB test. 

Each area of the hospital is different as to work culture. In administrative areas the employees are expected to dress in a conservative business-like fashion, and there is a dress code. There are no "casual Fridays". Other areas of the hospital require uniforms. Overall, there are policies and procedures for everything. The ability to follow rules and guidelines is highly valued.
Interview Questions: Questions are tailored to each individual position. This is a Catholic hospital with ties to the community at large, so there may be questions related to volunteer work or involvement with the community.

title: Marketing/Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Providence in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contact someone in the department personally prior to interviewing so your resume will stand out from the stack. But typically apply on the website and go through HR then interview with supervisor.
Interview Questions: What are your ideas for the department?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Providence (Portland, OR) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone intereeview followed by panel interview. Pre difined questions not related to work just to measure fir in work envirbnment.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with confilicts?

title: Meetings Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Anchorage, AK) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quite thorough, but simple.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Everett, WA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in my resume electronically for a job. Recruiter wrote back and invited me to a group interview for new graduates. Recruiter failed to mention the date or time for this interview but weeks later sent a follow-up message stating date and time. 
The "interview" consisted of the head of the residency program giving a lengthy presentation on how great Providence is. She gave a rah-rah presentation that lasted more than an hour about what a great place Providence is to work. Complete with listing every single hospital unit, because apparently med/surg and cardiac floors are so different and groundbreaking in a hospital. She also waxed on about how Providence supports nurses continuing with their education--whether it be to get a masters or bachelor's degree. This became extremely ironic considering the following...
All 20 of the applicants got in line for a very public 1:1 "speed dating" interview with the head of the residency program in front of everyone else. It became crystal clear that this tired, 50-something woman preferred nurses who were young and had their associate's degree because ANYONE over 30 or with a bachelor's was summarily dismissed with no eye contact and a wave of the hand. Literally, a WAVE OF THE HAND. It was quite possibly the worst interview experience of my life. 
2.5 weeks later I received a mass generated email telling me that I was not selected. Shock. They had not called any of my references or clinical instructors. Nothing.
Interview Questions: Do you even HAVE a college degree?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Mission Hills, CA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview
Interview Questions: What do you do when confronted by difficult coworker

title: Privacy & Compliance Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Providence (Beaverton, OR) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I've worked for Providence in the past, and the company's hiring process is notoriously slow. Providence uses an online portal to initiate the application process, and it's not uncommon to wait a month before hearing that you've been selected for an interview. I waited about three weeks and then called the hiring director, who promptly offered a phone interview (to take place within the week). This director and a Providence manager were both present for the phone interview, which was scheduled to last an hour. It lasted 48 minutes. My perception of both these people is that they were very nice and wanted me to feel relaxed. Within two hours of the phone interview I was invited for two 1:1 interviews and a panel interview (to take place about two weeks later).
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you've applied your technical expertise.

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I took in an application, was called in for an interview, then I was hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Spokane, WA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: they listened, I talked, they asked questions, I answered
Interview Questions: Why did I want the job

title: Human Resources Manager  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Providence (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call requesting a time to talk for about one hour.  During the one hour interview we discussed everything from position to salary..  Since the job was not at the level I was lookng we ended our conversation with the recruiter forwarding my resume for a higher level position.  I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: How does you past experience relate to the job offered?
